reviews.review: We went here on Halloween and were so excited to try it! We ordered the crab cakes, lobster bisque, salad, and both ordered filets. Crab cakes were good, bisque was ok but not too flavorful more creamy... The salads were nothing special and definitely wouldn't order one if it didn't come with our entree. Compared to other steakhouses we weren't overly impressed. Service was great though!

This place is delightfully old school, and should NEVER change up it's formula. You can't help but feel good about life in this place. My beef Wellington was absolutely amazing - I wish I had the budget to eat here once a week. Their sommelier is extremely knowledgable, and the servers are all friendly and outgoing. The rose at the door? Just the cherry on the sundae.

OUTSTANDING!! 

Located in the Four Queens Casino, it reminds you about the glamour of how Las Vegas used to be. Every staff member is dressed in 3 piece suits, polished and friendly. They give every lady a single rose upon entry. The decor is old school Vegas with the brick work and stained glass light fixtures. It's dark and it's the perfect spot to have an intimate dinner date. My BF made reservations for my birthday so we were seated right away. 

The dinner starts with a delicious bread basket and drinks. My vodka martini was nice and strong and the left over drink was served over ice. The amount of drink they gave me was close to 3 glasses full. A+ for me!!!

Next, someone comes to your table with the salad cart full of options. Toppings included tomatoes, onions, eggs, croutons, mushrooms, artichokes, etc. Their Cesar dressing was amazing!! They make the dressing fresh so you can really taste the anchovies and all the other spices. My only gripe was the server poured waaaaay too much dressing over my salad. After finishing the salads, they serve you a raspberry sorbet to cleanse your palate for your main course. 

I ordered the seafood trio which came with a jumbo lump crab cake, Chilean sea bass and grilled shrimp. The crab cake was full of crab meat and flavorful. The sea bass was so flaky and moist. The shrimp was lackluster compared to the other two and a tad bit over cooked. My BF ordered the rib eye medium rare. Perfection!! The steak was tender and cut like butter. Super juicy! 

Your dinner comes with a light dessert consisting of two chocolate covered strawberries, figs and apricots served with fresh whipped cream. The whipped cream was the best part! I could have licked the bowl, but I held back. Lol! Of course they do offer more decadent desserts on their menu. As a bonus, our server Oscar brought me a chocolate lava cake for my birthday! 

Thank you to the staff of Hugo's Cellar for making my birthday special. This will definitely be a spot to visit again!!

This was my 3rd year in a row eating here and its just as amazing every time. 

Greg and Ahmad were our servers this time, both of them, the food and atmosphere did not disappoint!
We had a few people not show up so we had a nice 3 some and it made it an intimate gathering in a famous place. 

With great food and my favorite bullett rye whiskey it was the best time.

I cant wait til next years SEMA show for the forth annual Jim & Gil dining experience

We have been hearing about Hugo's for years. We just couldn't justify the cost. That all changed on New Years Eve 2015!  We consider ourselves fairly sophisticated Foodies who cook at home almost all nights.  We want our restaurant meals to meet our expectations.  Hugo's Cellar did just that. From beginning to end, from Rose when we entered to noisemaker when we left..this was an exceptional meal and experience!! The staff were perfect, the food was amazing and this was worth every penny!  Our first trip there..not the last.

Since it was the hubbys 50th birthday we decided to try something new on this visit to Vegas.  Reviews for Hugo's cellar were really good and the Chateaubriand and lobster for two sounded like just the ticket for our celebration. The setting is lovely, dark and romantic. The meal started off nicely with a wonderful salad served table side but unfortunately the experience went down from there.  We were quite excited when we saw the nice sized lobster tail and were fully ready to enjoy.  The steak was ordered mid rare and served medium and the poor shellfish was overcooked to the point that no amount of butter to dip it in was going to help.  The staff was semi solicitous and asked if we wanted replacements but we opted to just take our desert to go and make an end to the disappointing meal.

I was truely pleased with this restaurant. Old romantic feel with the atmosphere of what the essence of real fine dining. Tucked away in the basement of one of the oldest casinos the four queens. The experience from start to finish was all top notch. 

Greeted and seated with a rose in a quaint booth we were welcomed with water and a warm hello. Offered a predinner drink and warm bread. 

We started with escargot which was served hot and fresh. The table side salad was a real shocker. The salad is an entree in itself. With numerous toppings available the experience of the way its served is memorable. 

We enjoyed the table side flambed duck and filet mignon with shrimp skewer. They were both very delicious. 

The experience in itself made this an extremely memorable dining experience. I would definitely  recommend this restaurant.

First of all, this was my first "Old Vegas" dining experience and it was fantastic! I had SO much fun. It actually made me wonder why we started to move away from this type of dining. Thank goodness there are still places like this keeping it classic.

The hotel offers free valet and self-parking (four hours with validation) and it's just a quick walk down Carson to Fremont.

When you walk down the stairs from the casino floor, you really feel like you're in a cellar. There's a small lounge/bar area near the host stand. Even if you're here for dinner, I'd recommend some time at the bar with veteran bartender Dean. What a personality! Tell him what you're in the mood for or what you like to drink and he'll make you something new and name it on the spot. Your cocktails also come with their own refills - a beautiful crystal bucket filled with crushed ice and a carafe of whatever you're drinking. I had the Raspberry Lemon Drop and it was great; the right balance of sweet and liquor. Also only at the bar are complimentary mixed nuts, adorable heart-shaped water crackers, and spreads: Chicken Liver Pate and Smoked Cheddar with Bacon and Pimientos. The pate was amazing! I could have sat at the bar all night eating pate and crackers.

If you're a lady, you receive a fresh red rose prior to seating. They even have vases at each table to place your rose(s) while dining. Then, when you're ready to leave, they wrap the stem in foil to take with you. They do this EVERY DAY! 

Want to know what you should eat? Anything that involves table-side service! After all, you're here for the Old Vegas experience. Gosh, it is so much fun. Especially if you have the honor of dining with server extraordinare Victor. He's been here since 1983 and you'd never guess it with the amount of enthusiasm he has for everything! 

We started with the Table-Side Salad (this comes with all entrees or $19 a la carte). The cart has all the salad elements and you tell your server what you'd like and they put it together. If you're with Victor, just have him make your salad. If you're not picky or allergic to anything, tell him to put whatever he wants. It's quite the show and he is extremely entertaining. I had a blast just watching him make the salad! And the salad had EVERYTHING. Romaine lettuce, tomato, red onion, mushroom, anchovies, bay shrimp, marinated artichoke, hearts of palm, hard-boiled egg, parmesan, blue cheese, roasted pine nuts, and croutons. There are three dressings: Caesar, Creamy Pepper, and Honey Orange Walnut Vinaigrette. Victor recommends an unique combination of all three, so of course, I said yes. The salad was delicious. This is a must!

We shared the Duckling Anise Flambé ($40). The duck is roasted with licorice spices and herbs, then flambéed table-side. More of that table-side action. It's also topped with a Grand Mariner duck confit mandarin orange sauce. Served with wild rice and roasted vegetables. The duck was delicious and I loved the sauce. 

All entrees come with bottled water, assorted breads (cheese-toasted lavosh and rolls) and rose-shaped butter, their famous table-side salad, fruit sorbet as a palate cleanser (we got adorable mini cones topped with lemon sorbet), fresh vegetables, choice of roasted garlic whipped potatoes, red potatoes with parsley, or wild rice, and chocolate-dipped fruit (strawberries, baby figs, and dried apricots). I mean, WOW. 

We finished with Bananas Foster ($18 for 2 people) which is also flambéed table-side. Served with vanilla ice cream in a beautiful goblet and long, slender spoon. YUM.

It was an amazing meal and even better experience. I really didn't understand the hoopla, but now I get it. Service was IMPECCABLE. Each table has TWO servers and a bus boy. Everyone is so professional, crazily attentive, and importantly, thrilled to be there. Our drinks were never empty, our table was always clean, and one time I didn't even realize I dropped my napkin when I stood up and before I knew it, there was a new, folded napkin waiting for me on the table! By the way, if you weren't impressed enough, all the servers have culinary training for their table-side cooking! I truly cannot wait to come back - no need to wait for a special occasion!

Notes: They tend to get busy every night, so reservations are recommended in advance. It's a popular spot for locals and visitors!
Best martini's anywhere.  Best Steaks anywhere.  Best Salad Anywhere.  These guys knocked it out of the park - again!  Very special place that we will return to again, and again.  C. Best Boise, ID
Fantastic dining experience that is well worth the price. Great service with delicious items and nice atmosphere. One of my favorites in Sin City!
Excellent - I'm not a big salad person but their salad bar with the Orange Honey Walnut Vinegarete is the best I've ever had. Had Veal Chop as main dish and again a home run.

The service at Hugo's makes the experience. It is very romantic and 1950's glam. From the moment you arrive, you can tell it is a restaurant like no other. The women are greeted with a beautiful long stem red rose and you are treated like you are the only people in the restaurant. The food is great, but that is to be expected. The sommelier is knowledgeable and charming. The servers are quick, attentive and unobtrusive. I highly recommend the restaurant. The only criticism I could make is that it can get a little smoky from the casino above. Well worth every penny and will definitely do it again.

Hugo's celler is a classic gem in Vegas. As good or better than all the high end expensive ala cart steak houses. But it's all included with your meal. 
Great salads, bread variety, two vegetables, the best steaks and a small desert tray.  I had Beef Wellington. 
The service and ambiance is classic. 
Most servers have worked here for many years. True professionals. 
Not to miss Hugo's.

Classy old school Vegas Steakhouse downtown in the otherwise unexceptional Four Queens Hotel.   Ladies get a rose when they sit down,  get the table side salad,  and don't miss the free chocolates at the end of your meal.   Swanky and not outrageously priced like on the strip,  still not cheap though.  Dress nice.

We love the atmosphere at Hugo's. 5 stars for atmosphere but based on the last 2 times here the food does not rate as high. Table side salad is great, lobster bisque excellent. But the steak my wife had was not great.  I had a seafood trio consisting of shrimp, sea bass and crab cake. Just ok. If I can convince my wife Richella I will try again sometime. Love the place for the atmosphere and service!

We loved Hugo's the first time we went nearly 10 years ago. Everything is still good, it's just that we can find better places for less money now.

March 14, 2016 = Party of 5. I order what I always get, Filet de Boeuf - Atlantis, which is a bacon-wrapped filet served with lump crab and bearnaise sauce. Steak was cooked perfectly & bacon was tasty. I was a little disappointed with the sauce. I got crab meat but not much sauce so everything was dry because of that.

One thing I can't say anything bad about is their salad. It's made to order & you get tons of choices. I absolutely love it every time. 

If you've never been, I feel like it should be on a list to do. But we've gone multiple times now so the luster has rubbed off.

We took my mom to Las Vegas for her birthday. The only thing she wanted was a good lobster dinner....I Googled "the best lobster in Las Vegas". I researched many of them. Then I found Hugo's Cellar, quite by accident. ~ Let me say that this was the BEST meal I have in a long time. 
The service was exceptional, the food was wonderful. The tabe side salad service and the chocolate dipped strawberry & fig desert was perfect. The prices were a little high, however the dishes came with salad, sorbet, small sides, main course and petit fours. The atmosphere reminded my parents of the old days ~ cozy & quaint, the only thing missing was the "Rat Pack". I must say, we were so pleased to find this gem in a downtown casino restaurant. The only other thing I would say is make reservations! 

I am so glad I found Hugo's Cellar on Yelp!

Very old school feel. Romantic and dark. It's hidden inside of the Four Queens Casino. Once I walked in I felt like a queen receiving a red rose. They have a full bar which is nice. The food is very well the price. Loved the honey walnut dressing for the salad, which you customize. I had the Queens lobster. Such a luscious meal. Potatoes were to die for! Gave my momma a run for her money. Sean one of our waiters was so hilarious and made it an even Moore memorable experience. I'm still full almost 5 hours later. Would definitely come back again!

I was nervous about finding a nice downtown restaurant.  Everything looked either very old or dirty.  I came across an advertisement in the Las Vegas tour guide for Hugo's Cellar.  It looked like the only decent place to eat, especially after leaving all the good restaurants on the Las Vegas Strip.  Hugo's is located in the basement (cellar) of the Four Queens Hotel.  Once you get through all the smoke and slot machines you are there. 

At the bottom of the stairs the lady is given a red rose.  After receiving the rose you are walked to your seat and the rose is placed in a vase until after your meal.  Your seated in a cellar.  The cellar is surrounded by all red brick walls and pictures.  All employees are wearing suites or tuxedos.  You are immediately served a glass of bottled water, given a menu and list of the specials.  Before you receieve your appetizer and meal, there is a man pushing a salad cart.  He will prepare your salad anyway you like.  After you eat your salad you are given your appetizer and than a small scoop of sherbert.  You receive your meal.  After your meal you are given a desert tray with choclate strawberries and a couple of other delights.  

Must warn you.  Eat slow.  They serve you a tremendous amount of food.  I ordered scallops, which were cooked perfect!  I have never been more happy with any restaurant.  Be prepared.  I never had a to ask for a single thing.    

If you love wine, they have a huge selection.  Salad, Bottled Water and desert tray is complimentary.
Classic steakhouse.  Old school Vegas atmosphere with great service, wonderful food, and one of the best martinis I have ever had.
Another 5-star experience at Hugo's Cellar. The meal was perfect, as was the service.  This is a #1 dining spot for me and my wife.

Thank your lucky stars that this place is in downtown and not in the middle of the strip. If it were, then it might be pricier than Craft or Cut. 
You get five star service for a the price of a four star place, and that makes a huge difference on your bill. 
This means you can splurge a little and get wine or a cocktail, and maybe even a signature dessert. 
There's a hired wine expert walking around and he answers any questions you may have, or he just pops out of nowhere and gives suggestions on what to drink. Pretty cool. 
Like the wine guy, all the waiters are experienced, personable,and funny. They've all been working there for a looonnng time and probably have some great stories. 
The food was magnificent and the best part is is that sides and salads come with the meal! The salad is made right in front of you, and it's a yes no process that feels like an interrogation. LOL. 
The filet mignon was thick n juicy and cooked perfectly. The sides were white asparagus and mashies and tasted fine. 
Because they bring chocolate dipped fruit after, I decided to try something different and got the kona experience. It looks like a science experiment when they bring it out, but it's basically coffee percolating  in front of you. Kona coffee is some of the best in the world in my opinion, and it tasted divine when it was finished. Pretty cool. If you want a real dessert, then I'd say get the banana foster that's made right in front of you. 
The service alone is reason enough for me To go back and I love that it didn't break the bank either. 
It's a gem in the city of sin for sure.

I swear I wrote and posted a long, long review of this place when I ate here back in November 2013 but it's gone!?!  I don't have time to rewrite it this second, but until I get a chance to update my review, just a few words (ok the review ended up longer than I expected, but that's kind of my MO):  

Excellent.  Classic.  Amazing service.  Old-school charm.  Some of the best food I have ever had anywhere in the US or abroad (I had the filet and shrimp aux poivre, the steak was tender, the sauce delightful, the shrimp and steak both perfectly cooked).  The table side salad service was a show in itself - the guy who does it (can't remember his name) was born and raised in Las Vegas and has a wealth of knowledge about its history and funny personal anecdotes to tell if you are the kind of customers who want to hear that stuff (we were!).  It is worth going just to chat with him about old Vegas, Elvis, and the Rat Pack.  The meal and the experience were well worth the price - unlike other places in Vegas the price of your meal includes sides, bread, salad, and dessert (a plate of chocolate dipped strawberries, apricots, and a few other goodies).  You can order a dessert off of the menu, they looked delicious, but we were so full and so satisfied by the complimentary fruit that there was no need.  Drinks were very reasonably priced for a restaurant of this caliber.

Our dinner here was THE HIGHLIGHT OF OUR TRIP to Vegas.  You won't be treated with this kind of sincere, genuine kindness and class anywhere else!  Don't let the old casino's cheesy facade and dated interior fool you, this place is top notch.  The ambiance is completely different once you go down the stairs to Hugo's.  They even give ladies a perfect, long-stemmed red rose upon entering the restaurant.  I felt like a queen when I dined here.  Everyone was so nice and friendly and welcoming - the employees, the other customers, EVERYONE.  It was like something straight out of a movie.

If you have only one splurge dinner in your budget while you are in Vegas, skip the strip and come here.  Seriously, you won't be disappointed.  They've been in business this long for a good reason.

My wife and I went Vegas for Valentine's Day.  We did not actually get to Hugo's until our third night in Vegas, but it turned out to be our favorite meal of the entire trip.  The ambiance was great the service was outstanding.  Each lady received a long stem rose (which lasted for almost a week.)  The presentation for my martini was perfect.  (It was really a double for only $12).  The second part of the drink was in it's own carafe and in an ice bucket.  The table side salad service was very nice.  The fact that the entrees come with matching sides is appreciated.  

My actual rating for this restaurant would be 4.5 stars.  That is because the particular entrees that we had (I had the duck--she had the New York) were only good (not WOW).  However, the overall experience was so positive, that we will be back next time we're in Vegas and will try other dishes.

An old school hangout for the Rat Pack back in the glory days of Las Vegas.

Located in the cellar of the 4 Queens Hotel and Casino.
The attire should be business casual, some people dressed more formal and some a little more casual, but one should never show up in tee shirt and shorts.

Onto the atmosphere, it is romantic, lit for the most part with candles at your table and the rest of the lights on medium.

The wait staff is fantastic and attentive!  They explain everything to you in detail and also make recommendations. No notepad is needed the waiters remember everything in their heads.

Food also comes out at a good pace, none of those 1 hour waits between appetizers, entrees, and desserts. I dare say after you are finished with your food about 10-15 minutes later the next course arrives.

My friend and I each ordered the lobster bisque,  plus crab cakes for appetizers, then the seafood combo (crabcake, scallops and salmoln i think) and I forget if I had cheesecake or apple pie. My memory is a little fuzzy.  The food was delicious, but the entree was a tad on the small side for the price.

Also order the coffee for two, it gets brewed right in front of you in a fancy contraption.

The meal came out to only 150 before tax and tip.  This included 3 appetizers, 2 entrees, 2 desserts, 2 coffees and 2 cokes.

My wife and I dined here to celebrate our two year wedding anniversary. If you want to step back in time and experience Las Vegas dining before the uber expensive restaurants on the strip started becoming the norm, come here. The restaurant is inside the Four Queens, a few steps down below from the bustling casino floor. 

Once you get to the bottom of the stairs, you are presented with a dim, old school, romantic restaurant. We arrived 30 minutes early, but were seated right away. But before we started walking back to our table, my wife was presented with a very gorgeous long stemmed red rose, quite a nice touch for starting a romantic dinner.

We started with Hugo's Scampi to share and chose the Chateaubriand and lobster for two for our main course. For some reason, the appetizer took quite some time to come out. A number of servers did apologize a number of times for the wait. We were served our salad a short time later, still waiting on the appetizer. The appetizer showed up right when we finished our salads. The scampi was good, just a little confusing how four shrimp took so long to be served.

Our main course was served a few minutes after our appetizer was delivered. The Chateaubriand and lobster were presented on a large platter table side. The meat is sliced and the lobster removed from its shell. We ordered the chateau medium rare, but it was more towards medium/medium well, almost like it sat under a heat lamp for a little too long? Regardless, it was still tasty, just didn't make quite as big an impression as a chateau usually does.

We were presented with chocolate covered strawberries after our main course, but were given a small chocolate mousse cake by the chef for our anniversary. A very nice touch and the cake was absolutely delicious. We tried to finish the cake because it was so good, but at that point, we were ready to pass out from the meal. Thank you to the staff who paid attention to my reservation notes.

It's the first average meal that I have had a Hugo's... the Ribeye was just not very good this time.  My buddy got the filet and it was great.  Not giving up, just an average piece of cow this time.  I'll be back.
Great old Las Vegas steakhouse.  The service is excellent and the food is great!  The table side salad is wonderful and the atmosphere is perfect!

A friend who lives in Vegas recommened Hugos to us.  We had a party of 6 had no problem getting a reservation and when we walked in all the ladies received a rose..aw..The wine menu was extensive and the sommalier was very helpful in choosing a wine for the table.  The menu had many choices we all ordered something a little different and each enjoyed our entrees.  As starters we got escargot and lobster bisquit - they come to your table and make a salad to your liking.  The portions are huge!! and it comes with dessert, chocolate covered strawberries and fruit.  The coffee was a little weak but was served with wipcream, cinnamon sticks and chocolate mint sticks.  We loved our dinner and it was a very old school setting.

You have to eat here at least once in your life if you frequent Vegas.

It's under the Four Queens Hotel like a bomb shelter.  It's very dark and romantic.  Every woman who enters gets a rose from the host.  The table side salad is to die for and I'm not a salad guy.  They basically roll this cart over and you choose the toppings........  Tons of baby shrimp please.....

The food is wonderful and if you take a date there you'll impress him/her.  You'll also get the old mafioso feeling in the clubby environment.

Vegas's Romantic hidden gem! I'm a local (dont let downtown/old hotel fool you) because this is one of the most romantic places we've been to. A must go to for a special day! My husband totally blew me away!

A little on the cheesy side (a red rose for every lady who walks in the door, rose decor everywhere etc.) but huge portions of great food - salad, palate cleansing gelato and chocolate covered strawberries with every entree.  Would definitely recommend checking it out if you're in old vegas

A lovely underground jewel in a not so popular casino.  We had reservations however were seated next to the door to the bar.  In and out in and out door opening and closing.  And...the ice bucket for all of the tables near us was next to our table.  Crunch crunch crunch - so much for ambience. 

The food?  Lovely!  We had a filet mignon that was perfectly cooked.  Bearnaise sauce - could I get a bathtub full and soak in it?  Yum.  

My husband and I shared the meal - no extra charge for 2 salads and an extra side.  

Our martinis were served with an extra carafe - making an equivalent of 2 drinks. 

The meal ended with complimentary dessert.  

The waitstaff was very attentive.  And...all ladies get a rose!
What a nice place to dine!  The food, the server is so good!  My husband and I are celebrating our anniversary there, both of us enjoy a lot! The duck is a must!

The environment the food the way everything played together made this one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. I had the beef Wellington was very very good. The wine guy was very intelligent and very helpful. I ended the meal with A glass of incredible port
hidden Las Vegas gem... wonderful menu, top notch service, and low prices to boot... I love this place

I cannot say enough about how good this restaurant is. I have been here five times and each has been better than the next. To begin with, the ambience is very nice and relaxing. The service is top notch. When you order an entrée, it automatically comes with a lovely salad that is made at tableside to your liking and then, after your entrée, Amuse bouches are served as a dessert and this is complimentary. 
Along with the bread basket and fresh butter before this, there is really no need to order appetizers or a dessert unless you can pack in a lot of food.
I have ordered the filet mignon which is outstanding. I have ordered the rack of lamb with Indonesian sauce, which is delicious. I have ordered Hugos chicken, and it is really good. The salad before usually comes with Romain lettuce and occasional combinations, with three choices of dressing including Cesar or ranch, and several vegetables and condiments can be placed on the salad at your request. The salad is always outstanding.
I have had dessert here for a couple of times and they are delicious, especially the black forest. The Amuse Bouches are chocolate covered strawberries, white chocolate covered figs, and milk chocolate covered apricots with fresh cream in the middle. Absolutely delicious. The coffee, regular, is brought to the table with cinnamon sticks, fresh cream, and any additions that you would like.
The price is always affordable for a restaurant of this caliber. Women always get a rose, red and longstem. This is one of the classiest and most romantic restaurants that one can go to, where excellence in food preparation and taste is always right on the money. This is a must!

Talk about amazing! From the start of our date to the end, Hugos did not disappoint!! We went here on a friends recommendation. It was a treat your self weekend as we are celebrating my graduating from grad school and getting a job. The staff was fantastic and the food OMG the food!!! We can't wait to go back. Please dress up it makes it so much more fun

Hugo's Cellar blew my hair back, knocked my socks off, pampered us, tucked us in and made sweet love to us all night long!

This place was orgazmic to say the very least. We arrived without a reservation and were able to accommodate us immediately. The maitre d' handed the ladies in our party a long stemmed rose and treated us like royalty. Our server, I believe his name was Anthony, was a true professional. He got us all excited about the meal we were about to experience. 

Our meal was something that we are still talking about.

it began with cocktails and a salad server arrived with a basket of fresh breads and built our salads tableside. We had over a dozen toppings to choose from and several dressings....so good!

After the salad we were served a mini sorbet to cleanse the pallet. I think mine was raspberry and it was so ideal after eating the anchovies in the salad.

Jason and I ordered the Chateaubriand for two and lobster tails. it was served with baby new potatoes and fresh spring vegetables. Our chateau was cooked to perfection and melted in your mouth. It burst with so much flavor that it made us both pause and look at each other with the look of satisfaction, kinda like the look you have after some really good circus style sex. 

Our friends ordered the rib eye and they were completely amazed with it! We all said over and over how that meal was the absolute best meal we had all ever had.

We thought our dinner was over. But, to our surprise "Anthony came over with an assortment of chocolate dipped fruits (strawberries, figs & apricots) and REAL whipped creme, and the dessert tray. We ordered two desserts from the tray and they were both served with REAL whipped creme and were TO DIE FOR!

During dinner we were talking about how we could just feel how good the coffee was going to be and sure enough. The coffee was so yummy!

The service was IMPECCABLE! We did not want for anything. Several times we commented on how we had NEVER had service like this EVER before, EVER! We felt as if we were waited on hand and foot! Our drinks were never neglected and we did not have to look for our server once. He was there every time we needed him and was not intrusive at all. 

We are going to back to Vegas just to eat here again!

Bravo Hugo's Cellar!

I was really looking forward to dining here... If there is one thing I truly don't mind splurging on it is good quality dining. To begin, I loved my long stem rose, traditionally classy. Nice touch. Problem#1: I was looking forward to a glass of wine to find they only have house wines available in glasses. All others are bottle only. That is a bit inconvenient for me, since my bf doesn't drink wine and a bottle would absolutely have me in ruins if I were brave enough to try to drink it alone. But ok, not a huge deal. Problem #2: My bf ordered 12yr or 18yr Jameson whichever they had available. A few moments later he came back with a glass of whiskey on the rocks, and informed us that they only had regular Jameson so that's what he brought out. Yuck. This set the mood for a bit of a disappointment right out of the gate... 
We ordered our meals and continued our evening festivities without further awkward moments but when the food came out I was left a bit disappointed again. Problem #3: I ordered the rack of lamb, which was actually really tough and not even the slightest tender at all. My bf ordered a steak and after trying a bite it was ok, but not nearly the quality of cut I would expect from such a renowned steak house. The rest of the night was fine. Great service and later the server explained to us that the mix up with the whiskey was that he was not very knowledgeable about the difference between the whiskeys and had been given the drink to serve by the bartender so he simply went with it. Which is understandable. I paid the bill, tipped accordingly regardless and called it a night. The experience was superb as far as service was concerned but the food was more like quality I would expect from somewhere very generic. I've tasted better food at BJ's for 1/4 of the bill. We have been to Joe Vicari's Andiamo at The D casino just around the corner from here and it was by far a better steakhouse by a long shot! Downtown in general has some amazing dining but this place definitely fell short of the list of favorites. Doubt I'll ever be back.

If Yelp considered short statements as "reviews" then all I'd have to say is..

"Hugo's Cellar is AWESOME!"

Instead, let me explain a little.  This is a review that could really go on and on so I'm gonna try to cut myself short.

There is nothing that I don't like about Hugo's Cellar.  The service is superb, the food is fantastic, and it reminds me of other "old school" Vegas gourmet rooms that are no longer around.  The table-side salad service is fantastic and whatever you order on the menu is gonna be delicious.  Remember to save room for Bananas Foster (prepared table-side) after dinner and a cup of great coffee. 

You might be surprised, but you won't be disappointed!
Amazing food, service and atmosphere! It is the perfect spot for a little romance! The meals are pricey- but it is worth it for what you get! We will without a doubt return here next trip!

My boyfriend surprised me on a Valentine's Day dinner here. The food was amazing the service was perfect . Loved the friendly hostess and waiter very accommodating being that I had just had back surgery two weeks ago and needed to sit in a comfortable chair. Everything was amazing even being that I was hurting, cant wait to go back again when im feeling better and know the experience will be that much better...

Everything was very good, but nothing was memorable.

Ordered the Rack of Lamb.  It was good...not memborable.  Other party members ordered the Filet Mignon...I tasted it...it was good, not memorable.
The tableside-made-to-order salad was pretty cool.  The guy shows up with a cart of fixin's and literally makes each persons salad, just the way they want it.  This is included with each meal (no extra charge).
After dinner, they bring out some chocolate-dipped fruits.  This is also included at no extra charge.
I'll give it 4 stars for now.  I need to try it again and it can go up to 5 stars, but it can also drop to 3 stars.  Maybe it stays at 4.

By far, the best downtown spot in Vegas!! I will drive 30 minutes to make it to the four queens any day of the week to eat here. A couple of hints to make your Hugo's Celler experience the best...
1. Go a bit early and have a drink at the bar, its old school and you can really get a sense of the place by watching the room and the waiters and the cocktails being made. Martini's are huge and served a fun way.
2. Order the salad cart, it is the most fabulous way to start a meal there.
3. If you drink Iced tea, get it. Its AMAZING I know, iced tea but trust me
4. Wonder around the hotel after and play a little craps or the slots, you will feel like its 1975 if you let it....

Old Vegas Old Vegas Old Vegas Old Vegas!

If I didn't already tell you, this is OLD VEGAS deluxe.  In the bowels of the 4 queens in downtown, a truly hidden gem for dinner.  Warm dark walls, booths and a menu reminiscent of "the old days".  

Not sure if the building or staff have been there longer, but they are all top notch.

First, the wine Sommalier is a fine Englishman with a extremely broad wine knowledge and a very pleasant demeanor.  We eat here perhaps twice per year and he remembers our names and the wine we had last visit.

The evening focuses around the salad cart with over 15 different items  and three home made dressings tossed table side by Victor the salad master.  Thereafter there are the old time standards, rack of lamb, veal oscar, steak diane, etc.

I had the veal oscar with crab , white asparagus and a wine demiglace, it was tender and very good.  My wife had the salad and shrimp cocktail, she wasn't very hungry, it too was nice.  My mother rounded out with the swordfish simply grilled, tender and good.  We chose a very nice, and nicely priced ($65.00) Spanish Cabernet "2003 Torres" mas la planta.

You are served a berry sorbet in a mini waffle cone between courses and finish off with chocolate dipped strawberries  and figs.  Yes, we were stuffed but had the banana's flambe anyway.... a must.

Listen to me!!!  If you go to Vegas you MUST come here.  Forget charlie trotter, aureole etc.  Relax and take a trip back in time.  You'll thank me later.

Our friend had raved about this restaurant and we were so looking forward to it.  Unfortunately, we were immediately disappointed by the behavior of our server.  Our friend was wearing a fedora as part of his outfit and the sever made him remove the hat even though there is no dress code for the restaurant.  Secondly, we had a 3 year old with us and no food accommodation was made for him even after being told on the phone that there would not be any problem.  The child had to eat crackers.  The food was very good but not an enjoyable experience.

I've eaten at Hugo's at least 10 times and it's one of my favorite places to eat downtown.

Now I normally like a restaurant to be modern, open, airy and with lots of light.  Well Hugo's is the complete opposite of that!  However in this case I just love the old school Vegas feel of the joint.  Low ceilings, brink walls, dim lights...don't care...love it!

Food is really good, not "Celebrity chef" great.  I am always comped so value is hard to put a finger on.  All meals come with a made at table salad and with sides included, plus a small dessert at the end.  The size of the meals means that starters or extra desserts are really not needed.  So for $35 to $50 you really get a complete meal.  Based on that I would say value was good.

LOVE the prime rib, bone in strip, rack of lamb and King crab legs.  Other seafood dishes are solid if a little under whelming, all the steaks are prime and it shows.  Made to order salad is great and a mini meal in itself.

Special shout out to the Sommelier from England who is just so friendly and very funny.  Tell him what you like and he will find a great bottle for you.  He always has a bottle of Kim Crawford out that back for us.  Love it!
by far the best restaurant I have been to in Las Vegas! The service is amazing. The staff is polite, funny, and super helpful. Than to top it off when amazing food and steak YUMMMMMMMMMMM

Just got back from our first time at Hugo's! We have lived in Vegas for 10 years, and have always wanted to try it, so we decided to celebrate Valentine's Day a week early. We were a bit skeptical based on its location, but our fears were quicly calmed---great place!

We arrived a few minutes early, but were quickly seated...and just like previous posts indicate, I was given a long stemmed red rose upon entry. The ambiance is old school, dark steakhouse, but very romantic.
We had the fabulous salad cart as our appetizer...I had caesar, and the hubby had a sweet walnut vinaigrette. Both were outstanding---shrimp, egg, croutons, peeled tomatoes, fresh mushrooms, and loads of parmesan cheese were at the ready. The cocktails were great---I had a martini that really was like having 3--one glass, then they gave me an individual carafe on ice to refill my glass as I needed. Bread basket had a nice variety of breads, but we were partial to the house special cheese lavosh--yummy! For entrees, the hubby had the 16 oz ribeye, cooked to perfection. I had the filet Atlantis--a succulent beef filet (huge!) bacon wrapped, served over lump crab meat with bernaise on the side. It was like butter! We enjoyed the chocolate dipped fruit tray, and also tried a chocolate almond cheesecake---so full! The coffee was excellent, and came with neat little goodies--cinnamon sticks, and chocolate mint swirl sticks.

We also had Anthony as our server--one of the very few true local Vegas people in town! He was very personable and professional... he had a great helper named Eric who was very attentive, and excellent at making sure we were happy all evening. What a great value for 2!!!! Our bill came to $144--that included 4 premium cocktails (grey goose and bacardi), coffee, salads for each of us, 2 desserts and 2 beef entrees with potatoes and veggies---4 premium beverages on the strip alone would be $50 bucks, the steaks would be at least $50 bucks each, plus salads at $12 bucks each, then desserts @ 9 dollars each, not to mention that each potato and veggie side would be  about $9 bucks a piece, then add the coffee..well over $220 bucks! We had a great experience, and will definitely return!!!

One of our best wedding anniversary dinners took place here at Hugo's Cellar.  I made sure to make a reservation over a month ahead of time because I really wanted to take my wife here for our special day.

They are located in downtown Las Vegas on Fremont Street inside the Four Queens Hotel.  The ambiance was almost perfect for a romantic dinner evening.  Felt like we had traveled back in time because of the decor and atmosphere.  They greeted my wife with a single long stem rose which made my wife very happy.

The food was very good.  Their table side salad was excellent.  Our steaks were delicious.

All evening, the service provided to us by the staff was top notch.  Very classy.

Thanks for a wonderful and memorable anniversary dinner.  Hugo's Cellar is a fine establishment to take your special someone for that special occasion.

Diamond in the rough!!! Cannot believe how incredible this restaurant was!!! From start to finish!!! Amazing staff and amazing food and drinks!!! All I can say is WOW!!!! Thanks Hugo we loved your cellar!!!!

Visited Hugo's tonight and it was okay. Honestly for the price the food was just that. Okay. I don't mind paying decent money for good food but I don't think the food was worth what we paid tonight. I have been to Hugo's before and it seems as if time has caught up with this place.  As much as they are trying to keep it as a old Las Vegas vibe, the food is deteriorating in quality. 2 filet mignons was 148.00. Of course you get salad and a small desert plate. Again, it was just meh. The service was good. Don't know if I will return or not?

Hugo's is the best kept secret in Downtown Vegas...Tucked inside the old and rundown Four Queens Hotel and Casino, Hugo's is well known as one of the best steak houses in Vegas and in my opinion...the best. I have eaten here more then 10 times so trust me when I tell you that I have seen almost everything on the menu and I have never been let down. The food and service is amazing, top notch. Everything on the menu is perfect. You must try this restaurant and you can thank me the next day! Enjoy...

My review is totally late (life is so busy), but my husband took me here for our weekly date night. Start to finish, our experience was AMAZING! I felt so comfortable here. The service is SUPERB! Water glass was never not full, our wine glasses were always filled, and we never had any wait time issues. Loved our experience here. The Atlantis was ridiculously cooked to perfection. Definitely on my top ten list of best dishes! What an amazing way to forget you're on Fremont or even Vegas. We'll definitely be returning to explore the rest of the menu!

All I can say is Amazing. Truly from start to finish one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. Why oh why did I just now make it to Hugo's Cellar. My wife's birthday dinner with another couple. The staff was A+. These guys are professionals. We are talking guys with 20 years working at the same place. Michael & Anthony treated us like we were the 4 most important people in the world.the food was supreme. The atmosphere is old school fine dining. It's in the basement of the 4 queens downtown Fremont street. Would I go again? Anytime I can is the answer. A++++++++

Wow!!!!!! The reviews do not lie - this place is five star all the way!!!!  Who knew there could be life outside if the Strip, much less a fabulously amazing restaurant with impeccable service ???

Tucked away in the four queens hotel, you walk downstairs and every lady is handed a long stem rose. 

You can take a prom photo at the stairs. :)

The salad service was delicious. Best salad of my life!!

The food is amazing and the presentations are creative and clever. 

We had an amazing experience here. Truly one of the most romantic restaurants in the world. World-class.

4.5 Stars... Really, really good, but not *quite* "as good as it gets" because of a few small flaws which may have been flukes.  (Plus if I leave an empty star spot, my boyfriend whose favorite place in the world this is may take me back again to try it again in hopes of me being able to up my review, teehee!)

We came on a date here on our first trip to Vegas together, and it was an amazing experience all around.    We had reservations so when we arrived we were promptly seated after my being greeted with a long stem red rose (which they do for all their women guests).  It's located beneath the  Four Queens Casino, and it's fun and a bit impressing to walk down the steps out of the noisy casino into the relative calm of the restaurant.   The atmosphere is dark, elegant, romantic, and classic feeling. 

The service was top-notch:  friendly, personable, just the right amount of refined to make you feel like you're eating somewhere fancy but not so much that you feel they're talking down to you, and on top of their game from start to finish.   The sommelier  was the same one that boyfriend remembers seeing when he came with his parents in his youth.   He was very nice and knowledgeable so I really hate to say this, but he ultimately ended up steering us into an off-menu wine that we *liked* but didn't *love* and that was significantly more expensive than the wines we had been looking at.   That's part of the missing half-star.

It was my first table-side custom salad experience and I am now sold on it and think every restaurant should have one.  I ended up with a bed of greens topped with shrimp, hearts of palm, artichoke hearts, tomatoes, pickled red onion, blue cheese, pine nuts, caesar dressing, and parmesan.   There were lots of other toppings that I passed on, but I don't remember what they were - sorry.  I just remember these because it surprisingly ended up being one of the best salads I've eaten and I've duplicated it at home several times now.

We ordered the Escargot as a starter, and it was melt in your mouth delicious. I love that they served it in an escargot dish surrounded by the perfect amount of sauce with the puffed pastry on top.  It made for a much cleaner presentation and easier to eat, rather than having to fish around in a sea of butter to fish out what may be a mushroom or an escargot.  Easier for those who are slightly squeamish about the idea of eating snails too:  less interaction and more enjoying the flavors.  This dish was beautifully balanced, light, savory, and just perfection.

For our entrees we ordered the New York Strip, and the Rack of Lamb (and we split them).  The portions were generous and they both came with large sides of beautifully cooked vegetables and creamy mashed potatoes.  The rack of lamb was cooked to perfection and was such a treat.  I loved the Indonesian style sauce that came with it, but the boyfriend preferred it without - which was fine because the sauce was on the side.  I would definitely order this dish again and highly recommend it.    The New York steak was good - very good, but this is where it fell a bit flat for me.  I have to admit here that I've had better steaks that I've made at home - mind you, I've made some VERY NICE prime steaks at home so I'm a pretty hard sell.  Don't get me wrong, It was very good but not quite as good as it gets, so this is the other fraction of a missing star.  I did enjoy every bite of it (eventually, bc there were tons of leftovers lol).  NEXT TIME I plan on ordering the duck - apparently that's all they served when it first opened and everything else has been added over the years, so I'm betting they've got that down to perfection by now.  (And the boyfriend is going to order the lamb again and I'm going to make him share it with me.)

After the meal they brought out a plate of complementary chocolate dipped fruits which was a very pleasant surprise and also the perfect 'little bit of something sweet but not too heavy because I just pigged-da'hell-out' end to the meal.

All in all it was one of the favorite meals I've ever eaten. If I was reviewing a less expensive restaurant it would definitely be five stars - but given its price level my expectations are extremely high.  Even so, it only fell the teeniest bit short of absolute perfection and I can't wait to come back and have a 5th star wooed out of me.  :)

I' m sorry to say that I was very disappointed in the food, atmosphere and service. This was recommended by multiple people for where my husband and I to go for our anniversary. First thing is that the host was very nice n the rose was beautiful. But this point on in the evening was not so beautiful. We sat at our table for 10min before anyone came over to us. Most places ask if we have ever eaten there n introduce or give suggestions - none was done. Both of our servers had no personality at all. When we ordered I know you get to choose your sides and server just walked away before I could say. My husband n I both ordered filet n shrimp. We ordered our filets medium. I know meat shrinks but this came out half the size of a card deck and the 3 shrimp were very small. The whole plate was covered in this sauce/ gravy. We had the crab cakes that were decent. Bananas foster for dessert- it was so so;( I know the restaurant is old in a casino but if you don't like the constant smell of cigarette smoke like me, you will not enjoy smelling it while you eat . Our main meals was not worth $58 each...We had one app to share n dessert . No wine or alcohol... Our bill was $200. If the food was great or service was great I wouldn't mind the price but Neither was good that we would ever come back or suggest this place to anyone!

Every lady gets a rose. This place is old school and still good. Been here many times throughout the years. Decent place to talk and have conversation. Dinner will run you around $50 and includes salad, side, and the always memorable chocolate strawberry touch at the end. I ordered the Veal Chop and portion was perfect and decent tasting. We also had the 10oz filet cooked to perfection. Good wine list with plenty to pick from. Special thanks to Jon for selecting a good wine out of the back. Worthy after all these years.

So today's adventure found us headed to Vegas and looking for a good spot for dinner. Leave it to our VP Jeff who lived in Vegas for many years suggesting a very nostalgic spot known as Hugos Cellar in the Four Queens.  He was looking for a place that still maintained a Rat Pack feel to it and we definitely found that at Hugo's this evening.

The restaurant truly is located in the cellar of the Four Queens and the second you descend the stairs into Hugo's reception area, it feels like you're walking into a set of a very dark and broody dinner scene of a Coppola movie.  They do give the ladies in your party roses and I'm not quite sure if that makes it romantic or just a little creepy, which isn't so bad either--if you're into creepy. :)

We had reservations for 9pm, arrived a few minutes early and were seated without waiting at all.  Host and servers were very friendly and seemed to be on their games--especially Michael, our salad and dessert chef.  Unfortunately, although coming across as very professional, our waiter on the other hand, was very slow and not very attentive.  Drinks took forever and it was another HOUR before we were even asked for the next round.  Appetizers were delicious but so slow to get to the table.  We even had to ask to put our orders in because we were never prompted to in that first hour.  Our entrees didn't arrive until almost 1 hour and 25 minutes later 5 minutes before they closed.  We had an upset table to say the least.

Once our dinners arrived, the mood began to lighten because of the quality and presentation of every dish.  My NY steak was done PERFECTLY medium and was incredibly tender and perfectly seasoned.  I ordered it with the au poivre sauce that needed just a smidgen of salt but after that was pure heaven.   I went with the red potatoes and steamed vegetables as my sides and they came out still retaining their crispness and wonderfully moist.  

After that meal you have no idea how much it pains me to give it three stars but the waiting was handled so miserably that I just have to deduct two stars for it.  

Hugo, please read this and make these errors right in the future.  I would love to give you another try, but unless there's some assurance it's been addressed, I'm back to the strip to my regular steak places.....

This restaurant located below the first floor at the Four Queens is kinda pricy , but worth it , especially if you hit a jackpot, or even if you don't....the meals are 5 course...I had the Ribeye and  Shrimp Cocktail, (appetizer), Hugo's Table-Side Salad, and the Bananas Foster...all meals are started with Sherbet to get those taste buds going....and after you eat, you can hit that slot machine again....

Husband took me here for my birthday - Ladies get a long stem rose as they walk in :) If you are a fan of Rack of Lamb - THIS IS THE PLACE TO GET IT ! :) I can't believe the price here, it's old school dining experience where everything is included - you get a salad (prepared at your table-where you get to choose your dressing and toppings), a sorbet in between to cleanse the palette, the entree and then a hot towel to clean your hands before a dish of dipped fruits are served ! We also tried their Kona Coffee (prepared via a vacuum coffee maker at table side) and Cherry Jubilee - so good but we must admit we were way over stuffed by the time we walked out ! Our servers Michael/Anthony were GREAT ! It was a great dining experience :)
Always a must when I'm in town. Food is fantastic and the sevice is excellent. Very romantic. Don't let the location fool you.

DO take your dates here and DO make reservations on those special nights.  Your partner would never expect anything like this.  I'm only saying that because when i think about downtown i think about old town:  beat up and just worn down crappy area.  You'll have to walk through the casino and all, but once you hit those stairs that leads you downstairs it'll take you to a whole another level.

The ambiance is something else like you're part of the mob or crime family.  Got to love how this joint has so much character.

You get sooo much more than just the great food here.  Little things like a rose for each lady before seating, table side salad tossing, sorbet between course to cleanse the palate.  Defiantly one of the most memorable dining experience i ever partaken by far.

Wanted: A date, preferably a sugar mama.  Must have all original healthy teeth and no pointy elbows. *cha-ching!*
This is more than an excellent high quality restaurant--it was a fine dining performance! The wait staff made us feel like royalty! THE BEST!

Excellent, wonderful, and tasty!
Absolutely fell in love with Hugo's Cellar yesterday!
We came here for an intimate dinner before seeing a show at the Smith Center and were wowed every single minute of our meal.

The food starting with the artichoke and spinach dip (+crab meat) was outstanding! The crab was tender and they didn't jip us on the crab meat! Just enough without taking away from the taste of the dip. The salad is great! I had the creamy pepper dressing (similar to ranch) and it was delicious. Made to your liking... awesome! By the time our actual entree came we were ready! I had the Veal Oscar which is perfection. If you like veal or want to try it, get this dish! Also, your meal comes with chocolate dipped fruit, and IT IS GOOD. But if you are too much like me and my boyfriend you'll get a cheesecake to send you over the edge! Absolutely delicious and creamy.

Our drinks were great, they even serve you a whole drink and pour it in the rocks for you so you're actually getting enough alcohol. Hard to find in Las Vegas.

The presentation of everything is divine. A rose for every Lady to put on your table. The servers and wait staff are extremely pleasant. Oscar and Carlos were wonderful they really are a great representation of this restaurant.

Would absolutely recommend this place over and over again. Loved every minute of it. A great meal and beautiful ambiance, the Old Las Vegas feel is all over this great underground nook.

Great for date night or even a girl's night! Love this place!

Food was five star...
Service was five star...
Atmosphere was five star...
Only one thing that in my opinion needs to change...when you have a large group that are all single why is it so hard to give your guests separate checks? I don't get it.

Okay, great steaks abound in Vegas. Hugos is a dining experience, not just dinner. Waiters in Tux's, salad made tableside to your order, and incredible steak and service. My Beef Wellington was so tender I could cut it with a fork. Oh and a la carte is how other places serve it up...you get all your sides with your steak at Hugos. Drinks were great while we waited for table and the house red went great with my steak. Did I say the service was exceptional? When in Vegas, go to Hugos Cellar. I know I will be back.

After a day of gambling, I had some extra money, thanks vegas, and I really wanted a good steak.  We were not dressed up, but I check with the hostess and they were totally cool t-shirts.  The service was amazing.  No one judged us because we weren't dress up.  The steaks were the highest quality and perfectly cooked. All the severs were so cool.  Totally worth the money!

heavenly place to have dinner. though a little dark for some ( i actually liked their lights turned low) and tucked away far from the glitz of new vegas this ihas a different las vegas atmosphere. more slow,  no gomba hairy chest with fake bling or the paris hilton wanna be starlets. this is a place to get away from all that for a while and get on of THE BEST steaks ive eaten on the west coast! 

the salads were yummy as well. they take full attention as to how you want your salad done and will create it in front of you as you pick out what you want on it. all you do is eat it.

as for the wine list..the wine connessieur/sommelier(?) is very informative and youll learn a thing or two even if your palate was raised on pabst blue ribbon or shlitz malt liquor. dont worry, you wont feel intimidated, rather more refined . try the reisling!

This was one of my best all-time eating experiences ever!

Flashback 24-hours earlier where my hubby and I spent way too much $$$ at a snooty Strip restaurant (Table 10?) that charged you for every side, had three waiters constantly hard-selling you and served very mediocre food. Screw those guys.

Flash forward to our next night's meal at Hugo's: a classy (70s Vegas classy), pampered evening where we ate the best food of our lives.

Ladies get a rose at the door, the youngest waitstaff have been there for 10 years (some of the guys have been there for 20). You get warmed hand towels, sorbet to cleanse your palette, salads are served up at your table...and the meat--oh the meat--is some of the best I've ever had in my life. I've heard they have an amazing wine selection as well, but we chose to go with some of their martinis which were to die for and plentiful. Sure it's $14 a martini, but they give you a carafe with the extra from the shaker so really you're getting 3 drinks for that price.

Located in the cellar of the Four Queens Hotel on Fremont Street this place screams Old-school Vegas. I was channeling Sharon Stone in Casino the whole time. 

No nickle-and-dime---you pay heartily, but you get a lot. It's worth every penny for the ambiance alone. Love it!

This was one of the best meals I have ever had. From the knowledgable wine sommelier, to the impeccable service, we had an awesome experience! The food was absolutely outstanding. We ate at Top of the World at Stratosphere a few months ago, and Hugo's was leagues above Top of the World. This will be our anniversary tradition for years to come!

An old world Vegas classic in every sense... Must visit!!! After entering the rather outdated but very lively casino floor we recognized the thin red brick walls and began our journey downstairs and into a time of Vegas past.

Greeted by the maître d' very humble and welcoming, my girlfriend was given a lovely long stem rose and we were escorted to a quaint, low-backed booth in the corner. Quickly the seasoned veteran servers began their well rehearsed procession of drink orders, sommelier service and menu consultation. 

One of only a few restaurants that dares to serve French Bordeaux I'd give Hugo's 5 star just for that! Our Martini was served up in a large carafe in a chilled bucket and I'm pretty sure the phrase "three martini lunch" was coined here.

The food: Excellent all around. A little too much butter for our diets but expected.

The most remarkable about our evening at Hugo's was the service. We felt as if dining at a friend's home, never rushed or bothered with constant "how is everything." The table-side salad server had been there for 31 years, the sommelier 14 years and all others so kind and welcoming, professional on a level to best those at the Wynn!

Absolutely exceptional experience. A taste of the good ol' days of Vegas. From being seated with a rose for my wife to the martinis to the table side salads (which are actually remarkable) to the amazing appetizers to the steaks and fish to the sides and desert - it misses nothing and excels at everything you'd love in a rat-pack era steakhouse. Recommend without reservation.

Went to Hugo's recently for a special event. I give this place a 4 star rating. The service is unbelievable but the food quality seems just ok. I had the Filet Mignon steak. It was good and large but, I have had just as good in a less expensive place.
The salad bar was nice but overrated. We ordered the bananas foster for dessert. Was just soso. 
Having said that...the service was impeccable. The waiters and servers could not have been more helpful. Our every need was met and we never had to ask for anything. 

The price was high but not outrageous. You must realize when you are paying those kind of prices, you are paying for the hidden extras like the free rose for ladies and the plate of chocolate fruits that comes "complimentary". 

If service is your desire..this is the place. It is fancy and high class. Just don't expect a lot from the food. You won't be disappointed.

Excellent service and food was delicious. We ordered the hot rock specialty for two, new york strip, and filet mignon! All cooked to perfection. Our waiters were so wonderful always friendly and making sure we were doing well.  We also ordered a couple of drinks at the bar and the bartender was so cool, he also came to our table to see how we were doing! Hugos is a hidden gem in the 4 queens! We will definitely bring family and friends back again.

Gotta agree with prior post, "old school and this place rocks"!   Always a great meal, the salad is the best in town.  Very romantic setting and the long stem rose given to your lovely lady upon arrival  is a terrific way to start the evening.  Prime rib is very good as is everything I've ever had here.   IMO, it's hard to beat Hugo's
Great prime rib, great salad, fantastic chilled seafood appetizer!  Service was impeccable. I'm so happy I've found this place that I can refer friends when visiting Las Vegas!

It was our 5th wedding anniversary and we had just renewed our vows at Vegas Weddings. The woman who officiated our wedding recommended that we go here for our anniversary dinner because it was one of her favorite date night restaurants with her own husband. 

Upon arrival we were told that they generally are booked with reservations but they were still waiting on two people who had not shown up, we elected to hang out at the bar and have a drink to see if they did. While waiting the gentleman asked if we were celebrating anything special to which we replied it was our anniversary and we had just renewed our vows. He congratulated us and sat us a few minutes later. 

When you are taken back to your seat they give every female a single long stemmed rose. The restaurant itself is very intriguing, it's like you're stepping back in time to the mobster days. Its very dark and mysterious. It was also very romantic. Our server and busser were very attentive. We never went without water or anything we needed. 

They have a sommelier which is really neat; I typically don't patron restaurants with a sommelier so my husband decided that since it was a special occasional we would splurge and let him pick out some wine for us. It was a fun experience although pricey.

Included with your dinner is a salad that they made at your table. The server brings out a cart with what seems like endless options. Before you get your main course they bring you a small ice cream cone of raspberry sorbet to cleanse your palate. It was soooo good, so I ate the entire thing haha. Who doesn't love desert before dinner? I ordered the Filet Mignon and my husband had the Rib-eye. Both were cooked perfectly, were very tender and flavorful. 

After dinner they brought us out a complimentary dessert, the Lava Cake, to celebrate our anniversary. It was very decadent and delicious! 

Overall this was such an awesome experience. The food and service were excellent. The restaurant itself is very intriguing and romantic. It made the perfect place to celebrate our anniversary.

DeeeLISH! 

The meal price includes a large custom salad appetizer, all your side dishes and  a significant dessert - I hate it when steakhouses make you pay for everything separate!! (Ruth Chris??!! Sheesh)

My steak melted in my mouth, it was AMAZING, best I've ever had in Vegas. The service was also stellar. 

Even though it's in a trashy hotel, it's nothing but class all the way at Hugo's ...
Wow. Last time we came in May, we were waited on hand and foot. Tonight, got there at 5, out by 6:15. So rushed. Food was mediocre. so disappointed. They rushed us the entire time. Won't be back....

I have to admit when I heard I was going to down town I did not have high expectations . 
Well I was quite surprised . You walk down a set of stairs into well what looks like none other then a cellar .  They greet the women with a rose when you get to the hostess . 
They proceed to walk you to your table and place the rose accordingly to you . I went with 3 people so we all had something different for dinner .
My girlfriend and I ordered the fish . It was phenomenal . We paired it with a bottle of wine  , the men had steaks . 
After dinner we all sat and spoke about how amazing the food was . I must admit I will be going back .

I visited Las Vegas with the hopes of eating at a good steakhouse. Hugo's Cellar was recommended and raved about by a local. Looking at the prices I thought they definitely should have miraculous steak!! I ordered the Filet Mignon and I have to say I was not pleased. Although the presentation was good, the steak was not seasoned, dry, and not worth the price tag!!! I would not return here ever again!
Old school Vegas great lamb chops and Chilean sea bass love the atmosphere and salad chart

Don't let the fact that this is in the 4Queens scare you. This place was fantastic.  Everything was awesome, from the bread to the salad to the entree to the dessert.  The decor was cute as well.  Very romantic setting.  Order the prime rib, it was the best I have ever had.  This is a great place for any sort of celebration or romantic evening. Thanks Hugos for an unforgettable experience!

We must go to Hugo's everytime we come to Vegas. I just love it there. The food is ALWAYS amazing. The salad cart is the best part of the meal. My filet could be cut with a butter knife. The chocolate covered fruit and kona coffee at the end are a great way to end the night. The food is spendy but so worth it! Go to Hugo's! You will love it!

Wow is all that can be said about this place it is dining at its finest. The presentation is fabulous and the food is wonderful to enjoy. The sizzling platter of chicken shrimp tuna and filet that you make yourself is the most unique experience I have had while dining. That is just an appetizer, the real treat is the tableside salad with many ingredients to choose from with choice of incredible dressing. The NY strip is just delicious. The meal is completed by a chocolate display of figs and apricots and strawberries. One must experience Hugos for true dining

We have been dining at Hugo's for some time now. I love the Old Vegas ambiance.  I've celebrated birthdays, dinner before the bachelor party, night out with the guys, and perfect dinner with just the wife. They start with a salad made table side (even have anchovies if you request for them). Escargot is our favorite appetizer. The quality of the Entrees and sides are first class. At the end they give you chocolate dipped fruit and freshly whipped cream. 

Service is always top notch from the time you arrive until the time you leave. I have recommended Hugo's to everyone that goes to Vegas and no one has been disappointed.
Great old Las Vegas style place.

First off the service here gives this restaurant a five star.  We had a great dining experience.  I would say this place is more geared towards couples with complimentary roses to the ladies as a nice touch.  I also really enjoyed the intermezzo a nice old Italian touch to clear your palette before dinner.  The prepared at your table salads was also a nice touch.

My wife and I were introduced to this place approx 10 years ago by some friends and it is still as great as it was back then.  We recently just came went back and things have not changed (which is a great thing).

All I can say about this place is it is Very Old Las Vegas (where the the attention to detail is only parrelleld to the Romance that this place ooozes..

Do your self a favor and hit this place up with your loved one.  It is easily the most romantic place in Vegas.

This Place is such a mystery  when u walk in they welcome you with a Rose... not to mention it's such a romantic setting! My boyfriend knew exactly what he was doing!! 2 thumbs up!!  The food... Delicious! Top Notch!  if I weren't so messed up from the turn up I would of been able to eat more...but what i had was delicious...steak, shrimp, all of it FOOD COMA... Service Excellent ! ! So pleased with this place

I thought the food was mediocre for the price. Lump crab cakes were not lump crab meat, just some stringy crab with lots of stuffing. We mentioned this to our waiter and he did take them off the bill, which we appreciate. I did love the table side salad bar, very fun and different. The tomatoes were frozen, but the other salad ingredients were good. The filet was alright, just nothing to write home about. I did enjoy the crab legs and the complimentary chocolate-covered strawberries, figs and apricots after dinner were a nice touch.

While visiting friends who live in North Las Vegas, they took us Downtown to a steakhouse none of us had tried. We were going by reviews on Yelp and on the advice of their son. All the times I've been to Vegas, I would have never considered dinner Downtown, but I was game. We called ahead to find out if we could bring wine, and as long as it wasn't on their list, the corkage was only $10. Walking in to the Four Queens is like going back in time to the days of Old Las Vegas. The smoke filled casino was crowded with cowboys in town for the Rodeo, so all the employees were dressed in western gear.  That is until we walked down the stairs into Hugo's Cellar. Talk about Old School Steakhouses. All the waiters were dressed in tuxedos and the dark space was reminiscent of days gone by.

The minute we walked in the room we were greeted by the hostess who handed me and my girlfriend a red rose. Our husbands were already impressed. When we sat at our corner table, they provided us with a vase for our flowers so they stayed fresh. The waiters were all very helpful, friendly and well informed, and the sommelier certainly knew his wines. Surprisingly one of the obsure bottles we brought with us was on their list, so we chose not to pay the exhorbitant corkage for that one. To say their wine list was impressive would be an understatement.  We all ordered steaks, which came with the salad cart and sides. Everything was absolutely delicious. The 3" thick filet mignon was almost tender enough to cut with a fork.  I chose the gorgonzola sauce to go on top, but to be honest the steak didn't need anything to make it better. My suggestion is to skip the sauces and dig right into the prime beef.  We skipped dessert, although their list looked great. However we got chocolate covered strawberries as our final course, which were very tasty.

All in all we really enjoyed Hugo's Cellar and would definitely recommend it to anyone taking the time to head Downtown instead of staying on The Strip.

Went here 12/21 to celebrate an early Christmas dinner with my mother in law who is 86. AWESOME! Great old school vegas feel, amazing service. Salad was good, sides were good, meat was excellent and cooked to perfection. The portions were huge so don't know how people do apps and dessert. The complementary chocolate dipped fruit was the perfect sweet treat at the end but they even took it a step over the top and surprised us with a chocolate lava cake because we were also celebrating a birthday. My mother in law loved it and she was so happy to relive some of her youth in old school vegas.

I've heard some mixed things about Hugo's. The atmosphere is old school vegas. The table side salad was good, but can't they use different bowls to mix when people get different dressings??? Had the scallops festival or something like that. It was good, but interesting. The scallops were cooked perfectly, but the sauce they were in was almost like a beef gravy. After a bite I just felt like I was eating a super tender steak covered in rich gravy. Kind of strange. But it was good. The chocolate dipped fruit plate they give for dessert was good too.
My favorite restaurant in Vegas... Superb service, food, amazing drinks and vino selection.. Oh, then there is the rose... Always a special treat. Classic old school Vegas.. Perfect.

I usually LOVE LOVE LOVE my meals at Hugo's Cellar...but this time my experience was dulled.  They were out of beef wellington, the item I MOST order and the rack of lamb, the item I was GOING to order in place of the Wellington.  The waiter (Eric) seemed embarrassed about the Wellington, and I would have appreciated if he had notified us of the outage upon our being seated, but what was most disconcerting was his lack of attention to us after our main dishes were served (I ordered the 10 oz. Filet, which was a bit on the rare side, but was corrected). After our dishes were served, the waiter seemed to 'disappear' and we were then attended to by the salad master, and the beverage support.  We will return, but will ask for an earlier seating...gotta have that Wellington !

OLD SCHOOL FANTASTIC...!!!

Who knew?!?  A really great steakhouse inside the Four Queens Casino on Fremont Street...?!?

I've been to the Four Queens a dozen times or more - I believe, as do several friends, that they have the best odds in Vegas.  

But until I saw all the glowing Yelp reviews, I've never ventured downstairs into the restaurant.

Folks, Hugo's Cellar is really good, old school fine dining.  

Well dressed, very friendly waiters with real personalities.  A salad cart wheeled table side so you can choose all of your salad ingredients.

One of the best steaks I've had in a long time.

Bananas Foster or Cherries Jubilee prepared table side.

A great wine list and a sommelier who can really help you.

Not inexpensive, but all in all a wonderful meal.  We'll be back the next time we're in Vegas...

If I could give this place 10 stars I would. An amazing gem on Fremont street that truly excelled our experience. This place is voted the best restaurant and that's because it's the best experience. I ordered the filet and shrimp aux prive and it was delicious. But the bananas foster was the show and easily the best dessert. Staff was very friendly, attentive and enjoyable. Truly an evening I'll always remember that you can't get on the strip.
Awesome steak house, had the crab stuffed filet.. Fantastic, plus the salad cart, sorbet, and dessert tray? You're blowing it if you don't go.

A friend recommended Hugo's Cellar and since I was staying at the Four Queens Hotel anyway, decided to try it.  Well worth the experience. It's miles apart from the noisy, packed casino floor.  It's more like the old school top notch Vegas restaurant, not a chain, outstanding steaks, service and ambiance.  I was not dressed in a suit, but was not treated any differently because of it.  The salad table-side was wonderful, and my steak and shrimp combination outstanding. The whole experience was one I recommend. Too many of the Vegas restaurants are chains, over priced and cater to well-heeled tourists. I would imagine that this hidden gem has been here for years and will be here for years to come.  Don't let the low budget tourists on Fremont Street deter you.

First class place....and a fascinating departure from the noisy, raucous gambling in the casino (Four Queens) above. When you descend the steps into the cellar, it's another world. Quiet, romantic, quaint and classy. The menu is fix prixe so the price, which seem pretty high, includes an excellent salad, some sort of potato, a vegetable and a light dessert. Great service, interesting menu and a martini served like I've never seen with so much gin (real martinis aren't made with vodka!) that I couldn't finish it. Our waiter had been there for 17 years! Highly recommended. Didn't see their wine list, but suspect it was classy. sdm

Hugo's was recommended to us by my boyfriend's parents.  We called at about 8:30pm about getting a table for that night and they were happy to put in a reservation for us.  When we arrived I was given a long stem rose and we were escorted to our table where there was a vase for my rose.
