The best part about this place is the location, the ambiance and the wait staff.  We were greeted sincerely, my wife was given a rose as we were seated.  The staff are all knowledgeable adults, not college kids looking to make a buck and move on.

My wife loved the dark, cellar like decor, and it was a great quiet place for a romantic dinner.

The food was really good, although I've had a better filet elsewhere, it was still delicious, and the portions were healthy.  After the bread, table side salad and sorbet palate cleanser, we were almost too full to even eat our entrees. But we managed.

Overall, I will definitely recommend this place, and probably be back for another special night out with my lady.

Always as good as it gets. The restaurant is so intimate and cozy, it feels like your hundreds of miles away from Vegas but it actually one of the oldest steak houses around! The salad alone is to die for. I could seriously go and just have them make me the salad. I dream about that salad. And needless to say, service is always impeccable. Highly recommend that you try this old school Vegas gem.

After reading good reviews on yelp, we decided to give it a try.  The food was pretty good, but the price was hefty so maybe even on that count.  The staff was friendly enough, but they need more training to pull off a high quality experience.  They were Denny's quality servers. Took a lot of the romance and fun out of it.  Also we were quoted "policy" that we order appetizer and meal at the same time.  A clear effort to turn over tables quickly.  Similarly priced places would never do this.

Been here many times over the years, but will NOT go back.  Too much good steakhouse competition in Vegas to ever go back here.  Waiter (Michael) was good, we were seated promptly (party of 10); food/ambiance/bar does not compare anymore to other leading steakhouses (Flemings, Morton's, Ruth's Chris, etc.).

The wine 'sommelier' is an A-HOLE!  We asked about a bottle of Les Dix Cab, he said it was very good,  blah, blah, blah...we ordered two bottles - he came back with 'the only one we have left'...I know my wines and this was clearly undrinkable...I let others taste it at our table and they agreed.  When I asked if he tasted it (with his tasting cup hanging around his neck) - he said he did.  Trust me, I watched him open the bottle, pour my tasting...he never tasted the stuff.  It was awful - this last bottle must have been stored in the alley.  He turned into a real prick in a hurry....first of all don't lie to me, and secondly don't treat the customer like dirt.  He took it back, brought out another 'recommendation' (Whitehall Lane Cab - it was better, but not great).  He poured it and never ever came back to our table - a real, walking, talking A-Hole.  Funny thing was, when the bill arrived we did not get the detailed breakdown - I swear to God I was charged for the bad bottle of Les Dix, but we were celebrating my wife's birthday and my daughter's engagement and I was not going to raise a stink.  They had the balls to put areas on the bill for tips for the Wine Steward and Waiter after already adding 18% for our group - no problem with 18% for a group of 10, but I put a big fat ZERO in for any other tips just because that Wine Steward was such a JACKASS!

Salad cart is not what it used to be and is over-rated!

You can spend the same elsewhere and have a much better experience.

No space in the bar for a comfortable pre-dinner cocktail.

Hugo's is officially in the cellar for me and I cannot recommend it.  Food was not as good as Flemings.

Love old  school dark restaurants!

This is a place to most def check out! Service is amazing and the food is heaven!

Salad cart was a big huge surprise for us- they really make you the best salad at your table - it's huge! be careful dinner is still coming! 

I'm a sucker for prime rib and so is my family. The meat cut like butter and had great favor. 

The service was so refreshing- old school vibe and every restaurant should get training from them before opening! These people are beyond professionals ! Way to go!!

Can't wait to come back here! Until then, I will dream about the salad cart :) lol

Diamond in the rough hidden underground at the Four Queens. Our group of 10 had a semi private room. Long stem roses for the ladies. Outstanding service from Greg Gene and Eddie. They were so fun. Martinis were recommended and enjoyed by all , from the raspberry lemon drop to the extra dirty, and those cute little ice buckets for your carafe!

Table side salads were amazing. Was sad when my plate was empty. Everyone had some sort of steak or the duck. Excellent meal. I enjoyed the cellar cut prime rib. Outstanding. Still thinking about it the next day. The cherry on top was the bananas foster prepared right at your table. Best I've ever had. Totally full but gotta finish this dessert!

Everything you'd ever want in a restaurant: great service, great food, great value. A memorable night for sure!

We came here for the first time on May 21, for my mans birthday and I have to say, this place is definitely a hidden gem. U think "Four Queens? Isn't that place super old and run down?" Well it is! But this place is located slightly underground when u come in and look for it u go down a set of stairs and end up at the front of the restaurant. It has to be the most romantic place I have ever dined at. It's very old school with the brick walls and the servers dressed in two piece tuxs. The ladies receive a rose when u come in, so cute! The tables or booth have a cute candle light area with a single flower vase for your rose. And surprisingly, my man knew the manager who he worked with at a different restaurant, so it was nice to run into someone we knew there he kindly got us a booth in the corner which was perfect! Richard is the manager, and he was kind enough to buy us a drink for my mans birthday! 

Now onto the food/drink service - I got a raspberry cocktail (recommended by our sever, so didn't get the name) and my man just got the house cab. Our servers were David (I think) can't remember his name because he didn't really make an impression on us, sadly. But his partner Victor, lat me tell you, he's been there for years, he's an older gentlemen but such a great person! He was the highlight of our night! He was attentive and had a great sense of humor with everything. So thank you Richard for giving us his station just as u recommended he was really great. If u plan on going in, ask for victor u will love him!! Ok so u get bread service they drop off a basket w about three kinds of bread and then u get a cute rose shaped butter (to make it more romantic) hehe. Then we got seafood on ice for two as shown in picture below. It was good nothing special since it is a simple appetizer but it was still yummy. Then you order your entrees and you get a table side salad service! So Victor starts it for u and he just kinda goes down the list and u answer yes or no if u want it in your salad and he makes it right in front of u and he's funny you're guaranteed to laugh with him. Then you are served your salad, u get to choose from three kinds of dressings and he tosses it for u. It comes with every entree! So then u finish your salads and the busser comes and serves you a cute little raspberry sorbet on a cone it's called a "palette cleanser" I believe and that was cute and yummy. So they do that before u get your entree. Then u get your food and ugh it's amazing! It comes w a garlic mash and few veggies. I get a ribeye which I personally love ribeye so I always get that (done medium) and my man got a filet (medium rare), it has a name to his entree which we couldn't pronounce it n I let alone can't remember  lol but it all tasted great! (See photos) then we finish our food and move onto dessert. You get a complimentary platter of fig, chocolate strawberries, & apricot. And then we got a birthday dessert it was a chocolate cake that I didn't eat bc I don't like chocolate lol. But the dessert we did order was AMAZING!! It's called a banana froster and it is made table side. Omg I have never had anything so amaZing! See pictures. It has alcohol in it, bananas, and ice cream. U must get it if u dine there!! And before I forget, as Victor made our banana dessert, there was a couple next to us celebrating an anniversary, so with the left over he put it in a little bowl and hands it to the couple which I thought was a sweet touch! They did love the dessert and thanked us for ordering it hehe. My bf joked to myself and said "should we split the bill for dessert haha. But not really we would never do that and it was their anniversary I'm so glad they enjoyed it as much as we did!! Overall everything was great from when u walk in to when u leave. Sorry if I don't go into too much detail about the food I didn't exactly study the menu and remember what was in it but the service was impeccable. We will definitely return! :) don't forget to ask for Victor!

This is a great place to eat at when celebrating a special occasion.  They have a big menu that covers the gambit of high end dishes.  I love steak but I go a little more exotic here with the rack of lamb or sea bass.  The best part of the meal is the table side service like the salad cart and dessert flambé that are fun to watch and harken back to the classic high end dinning experience.  They also have a sommelier which was kind of cool to see him at the tables tasting wine with his giant medallion hanging off his neck like flavor flav.

this is an old school gem in downtown.  reminds me of the Mob days of vegas because you would never think this place that's downstairs in old downtown would cater to you like a 5 star strip restaurant.  Hugo's cellar was absolutely delicious ... starting off with the house salad is fantastic and then the entrees... I ha lobster stuffed with crab.  so good!  I love how they roll around with after dinner liqueurs as well

Hugo's is a Vegas landmark and an old school experience not to be missed.  Let me be perfectly clear that it is in the Four Queens Hotel, a dive hotel on the old strip with the parking lot to match.  That said, when you step down the stairs into Hugo's Cellar you are in an entirely different environment.  Ladie's are greeted with a rose and the setting is very romantic (dark wood walls, candlelight).  Service is excellent and they have some great sommeliers.  They have a very good wine list and serve complementary bottled water, as well as a nice bread basket with cheese-toasted lavash and rose-shaped butter.  Their salads are the highlite, included with your meal and freshly prepared on a cart at your table.  Toppings like hearts of palm and bay shrimp and delicious dressings- try the orange walnut vinaigrette.  You are served an intermezzo sorbet to cleanse the palatte (raspberry on a mini cone).  Dinner is very traditional- chicken, fish, and steaks served with a potato and vegetable.  Not especially gourmet or cutting edge, but very old school classic and part of the experience.  They offer traditional desserts such as bananas foster prepared tableside, and they bring a complementary dessert of chocolate covered strawberries, dried figs, and apricots served with whipped cream.  This restaurant is great and remeniscent of old Vegas, definitely a must try.

Went to Hugo's last night for our 15 th wedding anniversary. Service was absolutely amazing as was the food. I wasn't disappointed at all. The lobster bisque was creamy and full lobster pieces. The lamb chops melted in my mouth like butter. Absolutely delicious. Will definitely go back again.

I love this place! My husband and I have been eating here for years. We often take company here for a very entertaining and enjoyable evening. The ambiance is amazing...think old school Vegas with dimly lit tables in a cozy nook. The sommelier is a comedian in his own right and gives the best wine suggestions! The food is amazing! The tableside salad is amazing. I've had their rack of lamb, the halibut, the steak au poivre and the lobster tails and have never been disappointed! The bananas foster is a real treat for dessert too! If you like a nice romantic dining experience, this is your place!

I came here with two out of town friends.  We were seated promptly, brought menus and drinks, and were ready to order after a short time.  During the time we looked at the menu, a server arrived with a bread basket.

Two of us decided to split the escargots en croute and I ordered the 10 ounce NY Strip steak done blue.  When the server came with the escargots, he cautioned us that the cast iron was very hot and we should let the escargots cool a bit so as not to burn ourselves.  As he was saying that, one of the escargots decided to "blow off steam" and it exploded out of the pan onto my sweater along with some garlic butter.  I took the snail and put it on my plate.  Our server removed the plate and brought me a clean one.  We all had a good laugh.  He was correct, they were very, very hot.  They're really not en croute--rather, they're topped with a piece of puff pastry.  My recommendation would be to put the pastry aside on your plate, eat the escargots, and then use the pastry to soak up the garlic butter remaining in the small wells.

When our server cleared these dishes, he told us he mentioned to the chef what happened and there would be something extra at the end of the meal.  Then he brought the salad cart and one by one made the salad according to each person's desired items and dressing.  I was a bit disappointed that bleu cheese was not an option so I opted for the ranch and he put extra bleu cheese crumbles on top.  The salad was good and it certainly is an old school way of doing salad.

In between the salad and the main course, we were brought lemon sorbet in a miniature cone as a palate cleanser.  Nice touch.  The it was on to the main course.  Garlic mashed potatoes or rice were the two choices (there was a third I didn't understand what he said) and I chose the garlic mashed.  There was a small baked tomato and some white and green asparagus.  My steak was cooked properly and was tender.  The vegetables were were good but I couldn't help but think how nice it would be if they had a baked potato cart like the salad one.  What a way to get baked potatoes.

For dessert, we were brought a chocolate mousse cake to make up for the flying snail and the standard tray of chocolate covered strawberries, and some apricots, and figs dipped in white and regular chocolate. Two of us had coffee and we were brought a dish of chocolate sticks, cinnamon sticks, whipped cream, and sugar to go with the coffee.

Service was very good during the meal.  The rose for the lady in our party certainly is a nice touch.  Now that I finally did Hugo's Cellar, I can say it was A-OK but I'm not sure that I would come back again.

I visited this restaurant 5 years ago for the first time and it was the best salad, best ribeye, best creme brûlée, and best service I'd ever had.  I've been back once a year since and my high expectations are met or exceeded on every visit.  It would be hard to convince me there is a restaurant that could impress me more.  The perfect place for a date or special occasion.  Prepare to be impressed.

IMHO, this is about as good as it gets for steak in Vegas.  The only thing Hugo's Cellar is missing is a view of the Vegas Strip, but let's face it, that''s not why I'm here.  It is for the calm atmosphere, the elite service, and the food!  

I've dined here twice in three years.  The first time impressed me and made me want to come back.  The second time (last week) made me list Hugo's as my favorite restaurant for a great salad and meat entree.

Both my wife and I agree that the made-to-order-at-your-table salad was absolutely  the best salad we've ever had!  I liked how they brought my cocktail (a gibson) in a small carafe - and it must have been a double - because the extra is stored in a dish of crushed ice on the table  so it doesn't get warm or watered down.  Now that's something very few places do for you.  A classy touch that's worth bonus points.

Other Yelpers have validated that the food - from the bread basket to the chocolate-dipped fruit - is expertly prepared, presented, and tasty, so I won't go into that.  But I would like to compliment the staff.  We had a team of three servers waiting on us, and they were smooth, efficient, attentive, professional and warm.  Combined with the quiet atmosphere, subdued lighting, and luxurious cellar ambience, this is a place that will not disappoint if you're weary of the hustle and noise of the Strip.

To add frosting to the cake, you get a discount on one entree at Hugo's if you have a player's club card from the Four Queens Casino upstairs.  Free validated parking at Four Queens as well!  What more could you ask for on a great dining experience?

Oh wow.  Where do I start?  I can't believe people actually like this place.  The cheese on the salad was old.  The lettuce was iceberg (not that I have a problem with iceberg, but you'd think for 14 bucks, they'd spring for a nice mix).  The potatoes were undercooked, the veggies were old and overcooked.  The steak at Denny's tastes better.    And, to top it off, my friend's stomach started cramping after dinner.  He threw up his dinner and immediately felt better.  The only thing I can figure is people expect it to be good because it is so expensive, then they leave town and never come back, so the owners can get away with terrible food.  Only plus was that they poor a stiff drink.  DON'T GO HERE!!!!!

Service at Hugo's was the best we've ever had (hence the 5 stars). My husband and I are foodies and love to try new places - high and low-end - and Hugo's takes the cake for the best service anywhere. We dined in on a short trip to Vegas after reading great reviews. The menu is pricy but so much is included. A $53 filet also comes with mashed potatoes, vegetables, bread, salad, and sorbet in between. This is a steal in an expensive town like Las Vegas. The salad is prepared table-side, which is a very cool experience! I'd recommend their house orange vinaigrette. We were served by Carlos and Victor - great guys with lovely personalities and an unparalleled dedication to Hugo's patrons. 

The food I'd rank a 4.5, just because we've had slightly better steak in our hometown of Houston. The lobster bisque is to die for. 

Overall, fabulous fabulous place with an excellent atmosphere, interesting history, exceptional service, and delicious food. Enjoy!

Uninspired--not impressed. Definitely overrated in my opinion. Save yourself some money, buy your wife/girlfriend a rose somewhere else and take her to dinner with the money you save. We had reservations and were promptly seated. The service was slow and our waiter forgot to bring the drinks we ordered not once but twice. The salad cart was presented and was an uninspired performance by the waiter, it was just a job to make the salad---go-hum just another salad for a group of tourists. After a wait of about an hour after ordering our food it arrived hot and correct. We had a party of four and 3 of the 4 meals were good (not great ) and the fourth meal was a steak that was so full of gristle it could not be eaten. When we brought it to the attention of our waiter he basically blew us off, when we pressed our dissatisfaction with the steak for the second time he sent the manager over to our table, the manager reluctantly took the unbeaten steak off the bill but was obviously not happy about it. It was a marginal experience and I can not recommend Hugo's Cellar from a service standpoint, the food (3 out of 4 dishes) was good but not spectacular. There are too many other places in Vegas for fine dining.

Four ladies had dinner here on February 28. I was embarrassed I had suggested Hugo's. The food was OK. The server basically ignored us. He was quite friendly with all the tables with men around us. I was never offered a 2nd glass of wine, we were never offered coffee. Our birthday girl was not offered a dessert though we saw several others coming out with candles...for that matter, none of us was offered dessert.  Our server's assistant came with the bill. We asked if the 20% had been deducted for our players' club cards and he assured it had. On review, it hadn't.  He was a big aggravated to have to take it to be redone.  The whole experience made us wish we had gone elsewhere.  I've more recently been to Ruth's Chris and T-Bones (with the same group) and had very pleasant experiences.

This was the BEST dinner I have ever had.  Amazing table side salad service, the best dirty martini in town (more like 3 servings) and perfectly cooked steak and the best king crab legs I have ever had.  They had chocolate dipped fruit for dessert included with the meal and raspberry sorbet between courses.  Our waiter has been there 20+ years and he was very polite and knowledgeable.  I can't wait to go back!

Love this place!  Bartender, Dean, was excellent.  Service was top notch, food was great.  Especially liked the table side salad prep.  They were very accommodating of a Celiac needing a GF meal.  Love the Old Vegas vibe.

Hugo's Cellar was recommended to my by a neighbor of my family before I even moved here but was looking for a romantic spot to have dinner with my late Marine Corps Captain bf coming from San Diego. We thought the Four Queens looked a little seedy as we walked in, but the clubby dark decor that greets you as you enter the cellar tells you this is a special place. Lighting is romantic and dim. The hostess greets each lady with a long stemmed red rose which they place In a vase for you. Various breads, lavash and spreads adorn your table along with butter shaped as rosebuds. 

Service is spectacular. John, the world's friendliest sommelier has been there for 20 plus years and always seems to remember me (I've been there 3 dozen times in 9 years. Sometimes a few times a week, sometimes with longer spans) he makes great wine selections and we happen to share a great love of Perrier Jouet Fleur du Champagne. Even when I don't order wine, he stops by to visit, a fine British chap. They are also famous for their delicious martinis which come with a mini decanter. Your water glasses remain filled and your waiter is assisted by the salad carte guru and at least one bus boy, and of course the fabulous Sommelier. 

I dont order appetizers any longer but the hot stone app was fun. The salad carte which is old school table side has a dizzying array of ingredients and I always go with the parmesan pepper dressing. Usually, I pack half to go. Next an intermezzo of sorbet palate cleanser is served prior to entrees. I usually go for the sea bass en papillote prepared table side and steaming hot tender with a side of potatoes and vegetables. Other diners rave over the chateaubriand for two, prime rib, lobster virtually anything on the menu and enjoyed them thoroughly. Again I get half of my meal to go.

 I love this place so much that when my best friend called to ask where to make reservations for our party of 8 next week when visiting from Hawaii to celebrate her hubby making Full Bird Col in AF, his birthday and reception of a Bronze Star; there was no hesitation in my selection. I will call ahead as I frequently do to to ensure John has a bottle of Perrier Jouet Fleur du Champagne on ice to greet us. 

After dinner, a platter of dried fruits with white and dark chocolate and dipped strawberries with cream is presented. This is where all of my to go boxes come in: the bananas foster is DIVINE a show in and of itself with flames nearly scorching the ceiling as the perfectly caramelized bananas are served up over vanilla ice cream, the air perfumed with a hint of lingering cinnamon. Heavenly. Plus, I have great leftovers for lunch. 

The service is professional, seasoned and on point without being obtrusive. When you leave, your rose is packed up for you along with wonderful memories of a fabulous meal. You could easily pay more at traditional a la carte steak houses but why? Hugo's is a veritable institution and you will walk away happy and sated. And wanting to return.

Hugo's Cellar was the first "fancy schmancy" restaurant that my husband (then boyfriend) tried in Vegas about six years ago. I remember being very impressed by the high class service and the intricately made food. I wondered, was this place good because it was in my pre-Yelp days? Or was it really THAT good? Yes, sir, this place is as good as I remembered.

This restaurant is in an unlikely location. It's inside Four Queens. Downtown Las Vegas has drastically improved over the last few years but admittedly I still hold my purse close to me when I walk around. I would highly suggest to valet your car because the garage elevator was broken and I had to go down four flights of stairs in heels! Hey, if you're going to a fancy schmancy restaurant, you might as well splurge on valet!

Once you get to the restaurant, ladies are given a single red rose. The restaurant is dark and has a old school Vegas feel. We were seated in a booth, and I appreciated the romantic ambiance. Waiters were all wearing tuxedos. They even poured water with a certain flair.

My favorite part about this place is the table side prepared salad. It comes free with your entree and you get an array of toppings to choose from! They give a cute mini raspberry sorbet to cleanse your palette. I ordered the ribeye steak and my husband got the Chilean sea bass. We both savored every single bite and still had leftovers to take home! 

I'm not sure if it's because they knew it was our anniversary but we got hooked up with lots of desserts! We got an assortment of chocolate covered strawberries, figs and apricots to dip in whipped cream. Then we got a chocolate mousse cake that was melt-in-your-mouth amazing! Oh my, my mouth is watering just writing about it.

If you're looking for romance, good food and great service, you can't go wrong with Hugo's Cellar!

In a city known for overpriced mediocre food, Hugo's Cellar is most definitely a refreshing notch above the rest. Where do I start? Think close booths with pretty light fixtures, dim lighting, people's heads huddled together, soft whispers. It's that kind of place. You want to come with a significant other and have long three hour dinners. 

First, it's away from the Strip and somewhat hidden as a basement restaurant (converted from a wine cellar from back in the days) so you automatically feel a little special. The service is impeccable - old school charm meets modern dining, like free salad (!) and a complementary light sorbet afterwards to cleanse your palette. 

Most memorable attribute? Guys - they give a long stem red rose to EVERY female patron, saving you the need to buy her flowers yet giving you all the perks of a romantic evening! How much better does it get??

Great place to spend a few hours at, so more of a dining experience. Kind of out of place downtown, but still a great atmosphere away from the downtown chaos.

Dinners range from 40 to 60 bucks but that is misleading because you get a Huge table side salad where you pick the toppings + bread + 2 sides + sorbet to cleanse your palate + dessert sampler = Great bang for your buck.

Recommend hitting the mob museum for a few hours then dinner here for another few hours and you have a whole night of entertainment!

We ate here last night and, sad to say, it was less than stellar. We called for a reservation at 5 hoping to get in at 7:00. It was short notice I know. At first, Rich, the manager said not until 9:00. I said ok we'll go somewhere else. Then he said we could come at 6:30. Great! I wish we hadn't gotten in.

Let me start off my saying this is not a cheap restaurant by any means and we knew that. When we walked in as per usual, they gave me a rose. They give Roses to all the female guests.

We ordered drinks which were fine. A little light, but not bad. For an appetizer, we had the escargot which was really good. I was none to pleased when the dirty dishes remained on our table for an extended length of time. I finally stacked them and put them by the edge of the table hoping one of the 3 people taking care of us would notice.

Erik was our head waiter. He disappeared and I called over Oscar to order a bottle of wine. He stated he could not take orders for bottles of wine only the Sommelier could. We had to wait for him. That was about a 15 minute wait. I've known the sommelier there for years and mentioned to him I wasn't too pleased with the service so far. He said I should tell Rich, the manager. I decided to wait it out and see how things progressed. They went downhill from there.

I ordered the Veal Oscar and my husband ordered the filet. First, they give you a salad made table side. It is fine. It is a lettuce salad with your choice of dressing and toppings. 

My veal came and it was awful. It tasted fishy. I didn't say anything to my husband, but told him to try a bite. He said the identical thing. I tried his steak. It was dry on the ends and you needed a lot of sauce to get it down.

I had to track down Erik again as I was not paying $49 for bad veal. When I was able to get him and told him the veal was bad, he got rather indignant and stated that the only thing he could get to me was the prime rib. I guess it was sitting there. I did not want prime rib. He got very angry, took the plate and walked away. I just shared my husband's steak with him.

I told John, the sommelier, about the altercation with the waiter. He said to tell Rich. I told Rich what happened and even he didn't offer me something I would like better. He said he would give me his card before I left for a free meal. Yeah right. This meal should have been free. They gave us a desert for our anniversary and you could tell it was not fresh, it had been pulled from the freezer. There was ice falling off of it.

We got the bill and they did take the drinks and my veal off, but charged us $17.00 for the salad that was supposed to come with the meal and that was just wrong!

Before he delivered the bill, Erik came back as I'm sure he was told to by the manager to  make it right. Instead he began arguing with me. Hey jerk I'm the customer.

So for one entree and one desert we ended up with a $129.00 bill. Of course, I couldn't find Erik again to discuss the charge for the salad. On the bill, there is a place for 2 tips. One for the server and one for the sommelier. I gave john 20% of what the wine cost. I gave Erik $1. He didn't deserve anything. Never saw the manager again either. So much for the card for the meal.  This was totally unacceptable for a restaurant of their caliber. I've been eating here since the 1980's, but I won't be going back. Too many other good restaurants in Vegas to choose from. This was the worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant in Vegas!

What an amazing dining experience, from the rose at the door, to the rose shaped butter, to the traveling salad bar made especially for you, to the wine specialist.  Everything was amazing and they made the experience wonderful.

Very good steakhouse, borderline excellent. The rose the lady gets when you walk in the door is a nice touch. The salad they toss at the table is very good I couldn't go 5 stars though. It just isn't as good as Austins (the best kept steakhouse in all of vegas) Still, if your downtown, this is the place to go without question!

My fiance and I are celebrating our 5 yr anniversary this weekend, and because we don't eat much red meat at home he wanted to go to a steakhouse. In my search for one I came across Hugo's. The reviews sold me on trying this place. I called in the morning to make reservations but was told the restaurant did not have any employees in until 2:00 PM. So if this is where you are thinking of going reserve ahead of time or you'll have to wait until 2, and hope you get lucky with an early dinner reservation. The only time they had available for us was 9:30 PM. We got to our reservations 30 minutes early and they immediately accommodated us. The host even mentioned he remembered talking to me this afternoon. That definately impressed us. We were greeted by our waiter very quickly, he and one other waiter made sure our night went smoothly. I have to say their service was great! Right away we were given 3 types of fresh bread and butter. That was followed by a salad made at your table side by the waiter. We ordered the Filet and Shrimp, and the Filet le beuf (I think that's how you spell it). His was medium well, and mine was medium. Both steaks were delicious, but we liked the medium one best. That's not all, they brought us dessert! Fruits dipped in chocolate and whipped cream. Not to mention they also gave us a chocolate lava cake in celebration of our anniversary. For our entire dinner, a glass of red cabernet and one cranberry vodka (for the Mr., taxes and tip, we spent approx $170.00. We are super stuffed right now. My fiance is currently laying in bed in a food coma lol...I can't forget to mention they gift a red rose to every woman when you check in. At the end of the meal they wrap the stem with foil paper so you won't get water on yourself and for easy travel. We will most definately be returning! 

Thank you to Rawshad, Glenn, and the busser (sorry I didn't catch your name) for making tonight special.

Excellent!!! Loved everything about this place. Customer service and food were amazing. Loved the table side salad service. I ordered the 16oz. ribeye and my boyfriend ordered the beef wellington. Both dishes were delicious. The environment is quiet and a nice change from the loud Vegas places. Our tab came out to $150 that included our entrees plus drinks! Inexpensive for the quality and amount of food. We will definitely come back.

One of the BEST steakhouses! It's pricey but its definitely worth it! The red roses they give out will make any woman smile! I make sure to go every time I'm in Vegas. I have cravings for the salad! The palate cleanser is nice too! A wonderful romantic dinner place. Good wine list & great cocktails!

WHAT THE HECK HAPPENED? My God folks, we went in there at 6PM on Feb 22nd and should have turned around. 
#1. Ordered shrimp cocktail. YOU NOW ONLY GET 2. I think they tried for 3 but the third one was the size of a quarter. That and no flavor PERIOD!
#2. Salad cart guy obviously didn't want to be there as he tossed all the stuff into a bowl. His marksmanship was about 75% on. Salad was good.
#3. After the sorbet to "refresh the pallet" we WAITED AND WAITED AND WAITED! 27 minutes later, they bring our dishes. Food quality...just OK!
#4 The real pisser is FOOD PORTIONS. I had a dish with multiple items and a piece of fish that was about 1.5 ounces. NO KIDDING... 2 small mouthfuls and DONE! ZILCH
AND then I found a whole 2 danged small shrimp next to the "fish suprise". 
  Then we tried to pay. WAITER? GONE! They lost my business forever AND anyone else I ever chat with.

Simply, our favorite restaurant in Vegas. Where else can you get a martini with a sidecar in a carafe on ice? It's like getting two martinis, and the sidecar does not get watered down. The table side salad is delicious, and I recommend asking for a little bit of each of the three salad dressings. The breadbasket is fantastic, as well. You can find a better steak in Vegas, but you can't beat the ambience at this treasure. Where else does each lady receive a red rose upon arrival? We do miss Jack, our favorite server, but Hugo's must go on!

In my opinion there are much better steakhouses here in Las Vegas, maybe not for the price for quantity aspect, but at least for the quality of their steaks.  I went here on the recommendation of a long time family friend, and I failed to find all the great things he told me about.  The service was fine, but nothing spectacular.  The steak was cooked properly but to me lacked the flavor or of high quality steak.  The salad they make for you at the table was nice, but again, nothing special.  I'll be honest in that I felt that the sides that came with my steak were better and more flavorful than the steak itself.

The highlight of the meal tonight was their sommelier, a Mr. John Simmons.  I told him what type of wines I like, what I was having for dinner, and then he suggested a price range and went to find a nice bottle for me and my cousin.  His choice was from a winery in Sonoma, CA that I had never heard of, and the price for the bottle was at the lower end of the suggested range, a pleasant surprise.  He also seemed to have the most personality amongst all the servers waiting on the table.

On the whole, if you want a romantic date spot, you can do worse than this place, where they do give roses to all the ladies that come in.  It can be rather intimate, and is quiet enough that you can have a nice conversation without having to shout.  In the end, I seriously doubt I will be coming back here as there are several other steakhouses in Vegas that I prefer.

An excellent meal! Absolutely wonderful experience and wonderful service. 

Pros: 
-Great atmosphere- very old Vegas glamour 
-Great service (An army of waiters, all in tuxedos, all very professional 
-Great food (try to portabella mushroom appetizer. Amazing!
-SALAD CART!! So fun and delicious 
-Excellent martinis in HUGE portions- they come in a caraffe in an ice bucket, it's way more than 1 drink in there 
-great soft, romantic music choices 

Cons: 
-Location. Fremont Street (and all of downtown) just isn't a safe area. The restaurant itself it great- but you take your life in your hands trying to get to it. Crime, homelessness, drugs, abound all around Fremont. I may not go back simply because I was so terrified walking to the 4 Queens and back to the Nugget for a cab. 
-They had to butterfly the filet mignon

I lived in Las Vegas for 11 years and have been back twice a year since I moved away five years ago but I never made it to what is purported to be Las Vegas' 'Most Romantic Restaurant.'  It is a charming and cozy restaurant that offers all ladies a single red rose, romantic lighting, tuxedoed waiters and impeccable service.  Unfortunately for us, there were several families with small children dining at the same time and the shrieks and cries were distracting and obtrusive.  Despite this fact, we did our best to enjoy ourselves.  

We both agreed that the table-side salad was one of the most delicious we'd ever had.  It's a weird thing to say about a salad but it's true!  After the salad we were offered a delightful sorbet on a tiny cone to cleanse the palate.  We both enjoyed a beef entrée: for me the filet mignon wrapped in bacon and served over a lump crab cake and for him a huge slab of prime rib.  

The prices are very reasonable considering that salad, entrée, sides and a dessert tray are included.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and look forward to returning to Hugo's again during our next trip to Las Vegas!

The restaurant had a nice, romantic vibe. The service was exceptional. We started with the mushrooms, which were delicious. The custom salad course was amazing. The steak was cooked perfectly. And the chocolate covered fruit was a nice addition. The raspberry lemon Martini was a delight. We finished with the chocolate mousse dessert. Yum!

Need to find a place in downtown that is romantic? Then you have found the right place.

Located in The Four Queens on Fremont St, you walk down some stairs and walk into a lobby with a few tables and a fireplace with a fire going. Everything is dim and all by candlelight which I love immediately. I came here with a party of 6 for my Birthday dinner and there were 3 ladies (including me) in our group and we each got a rose! How sweet. We had a reservation for 630pm and we were promptly seated.

Our server was great and walking into this restaurant, you definitely get that old school vibe like how it was back in the 50's or 60's and that's how the server's were too. They wore tuxes and they were just a notch above. I ordered the Filet Mignon and it was cooked perfectly with a great juicy flavor. Oh yeah, and it was huge so definitely didn't finish it. LOL. When you order an entree, you get the pleasure of having a salad made at your table. It was a different guy that does this and he was hilarious! The salad was made just to how I like and it was great. After we were done with the salad, we were served sorbet to "cleanse our palates" and that was super tasty too! After our entree, we were served a selection of dessert items (chocolate covered strawberries, figs and apricots). And since it was my birthday, I got a slice of pecan cheesecake which was ridiculous! And I got sung too which made it even better!! Oh yeah and no cell service down here since it's in the "cellar". Kind of nice!

This restaurant is the epitome of old school Vegas style and the romantic feel of it is top notch. The food fits right in and the service was impeccable. I can not wait to come back with just the Hubs for a romantic date night!

My bf took me here for our anniversary, and we loved it! I'll organize my thoughts so it's easy to follow...

ATMOSPHERE: Romantic but a bit "old." Most people there are in their 40's - 60's, but don't let that stop you from going. Try to get a booth if you're there with your significant other to make the meal more romantic :)

FOOD: Wonderful! I ordered the sea bass which was slightly seared and served on top of crab meat and shrip. My bf ordered the duck with wild rice and he absolutely loved it! The great thing is, included in your meal is a salad (made in front of you), a palate cleanser (lemon sorbet) and dessert (chocolate covered strawberries, apricots, and figs). They actually make part of the meat and some of the dessert table side, which is fun.

SERVICE: Great! Service usually makes or breaks my dining experience, and the service here was top notch. 

OVERALL: Great atmosphere, food, and service. Not much more you can ask for!

What a delightful restaurant! The salad made at your table will knock your socks off, the duck was flambe'd at our table, my Chilean sea bass took my breath away, and the gorgeous chocolate fruit plate at the end was perfect!
The ambience here is so romantic and nice and the service was excellent! We will definitely be back next Vegas trip, and hopefully that's sooner than later!

The Hugo's cellar is a hidden restaurant in the 4 Queens... What a good surprise to find such a place there!
The service is good, the staff is friendly.
We went there for dinner on a thursday night, and the restaurant was pretty full, with a mix population of tourist, locals and business event.
The food is typical american steack house with some added value: the free giant salad (we had the Caesar sauce... there is anchovy flavour in it... We didnt like), and the very famous banana "flambee" made in front of you! Awesome!
I recommend this restaurant and 100% sure I will go again!

Great experience.  NY strip steak well prepared and tasty, sides great, and the salad excellent.  Great service including an extra complimentary dessert to celebrate our occasional. Price was consistent with the level of quality and service.  Don't overdress -- we wore coat and tie and dress and probably the only ones in the place.  Business casual would have been fine or a sport jacket.  I'd go back, great steak!

This is one of the last places downtown that I really can say is great for fine dining. Atmosphere is kind of interesting has that cave felling of old Vegas. Steak was well prepared and decently priced. Love the old style salad live prep bar.

More like a 3.5...We decided to hit downtown because we'd never seen the old Vegas.  We went, we saw, we ate, and we left.  I am not sure the scene is for me but the saving grace is definitely Hugo's Cellar.  This place was packed with a variety of folks and the atmosphere was classic and romantic.  It definitely looked like it had not been updated in 20 years with the blue tableclothes and blue tapestry on the chairs.  I took my rose as I walked in the door and we were seated on time for our reservation.  

All in all, the food was good...not mind blowing but good.  It is honestly more about the atmosphere than the food and that is what we wanted on the first night of our trip.  I loved, loved the tableside salad.  It was purely delicious with creamy peppercorn dressing and all of my favorite toppings.  I had to stop myself from eating the whole thing so that I could enjoy my entree.  My husband had the Filet Atlantis and I had the Seabass prepared with crab and shrimp sauce.  Mine was alright but I would probably go for the meat if you dine here.  My husband's steak was cooked perfectly medium rare and had a nice flavor.  Being from Texas, we get good meat all the time and while his steak was good, it was not the best cut I have had.  

We finished our meal with the complimentary chocolate dipped strawberries that were divine!  Oh, and another great thing is that the wine list is priced extremely well.  The value far exceeds most restaurants in Vegas.  We ordered an $85 bottle of Jordan Cabernet, which is a steal in a restaurant.  And, the Sommilier was quite charming with his British accent and all.  If you are looking for something different from the strip, Hugo's is a good call.

Celebrated my Mom's b-day here on a Thursday night.
This was on her list of places to try in Vegas so we figured we'd head to "old town" for an "old skool" dinner.
It was busy.... And almost every table was sat.

The Ambiance:
Dark colors, Low ceilings, Low lighting
Mostly tables, I think they do this to maximize occupancy
Would have been better (IMO) if they had big cushy booths along the walls to give it more of an intimate, private type feeling
The tables are so close together we might as well be having dinner with the people next to us since we ended up having a conversation with them about entrees and desserts
Several times I was bumped by guests passing or by the salad cart... Seriously... if you're going to have salad and dessert carts... make sure there's adequate room in between ALL the tables and chairs so as not to disturb your patrons.  
Loud.... Don't try to have a quiet conversation because you won't hear the person next to you.  

The Food:
Overall.... Very Good, but there's lots of places in Vegas to go for Very Good and Excellent meals, so food alone is not a good reason to go back here. Now if you are staying on / near Fremont street... Yes, this is a very good steakhouse.

The Bread to start... ok...nothing super extraordinary.  The butter served with it was in a flower shape which was nice but it was rock hard.

The Salad...included with your entrée order ... made to order, table side.... It's fun to get to pick what goes in your salad and watch it get made right at your table...  You can choose your dressing and if you pick Caesar you can have an anchovy in your salad diced up.  I opted for the orange walnut vinaigrette which was tasty but other than that... it was just a salad.  

The Palate Cleanser... included with your entrée order..... ours was a lemon sorbet served in a mini ice cream cone.  Very refreshing and fun.  Personally... I like mine served in a long stemmed glass of sparkling wine ... it's classier than an ice cream cone but then I'm a princess and I know it.

The Steaks... prepared perfectly to order and juicy.

The Sides ... included with your entrée order.... meh.  Mine came with red potatoes and mixed veggies.... The red potatoes were dry and crumbly...  The mixed veggies were something that looked like and tasted like it was from frozen Green Giant mixed veggies.  My mom opted for the mashed potatoes and they were gummy.

The Bananas Foster... AMAZING!  This is the reason to come here.  In fact, if this restaurant were closer to Henderson, we'd go here just for this as often as we could.  It is sinfully rich and decadent.  (Of course, you have to like bananas and rum.) This dessert is HUGE.  Big enough for 4 people to share.  The preparer (Victor?) was a showman and talkative so he was fun... be prepared for lots of flame and lots of fun when you order this.

The B-day cake.... They provided a chocolate b-day cake for Mom, and it was rich dark chocolate...  tasty and a very nicely presented.

The Dessert... included in the meal... YES, included not extra.... chocolate covered strawberries and white chocolate dipped figs and a side of whip cream to dip.  So.. you don't really need to order dessert.

The Service:
Very Polite
The Red Rose for each female is a sweet gesture.
They have a lot of people seeing to "your" needs. There's so much activity in the room with the salad and dessert carts and bread and water attendant and the other patrons coming and going ... that again... it's not a quiet dinner but it is entertaining.

The Price:
Pricey but not ridiculous particularly for the amount of food we ordered... and we all took home "doggy bags".
For 4 people where 2 of us split a half bottle of wine and 2 opted for non-alcoholic beverages... the total with tax and gratuity was about $85/pp.

The service was as good as I've ever had which added to a great ambiance. However, the food was mediocre at best. The filet was a little tough and lacked flavor. Their horse radish sauce had a killer kick but the prime rib lacked in flavor again. Overall for the price, it's tough to go back.

We were a party of seven people 4 females and 3 males and when we entered Hugo's right away we were greeted by Dean (the best bartender in Vegas). We all enjoyed not only the great drinks but the comedic stylings of Dean....hilarious!!!! Once we were seated, which did not take much time at all, we were greeted by a team, yes, a team of servers that were there for our entire evening. From the warm delicious bread to start, I knew we were in for a culinary treat. Next were the salads, hand prepared by one of the servers, and made to your own specific order, the salads were wonderful. Then we were treated to a raspberry sorbet to cleanse our palates before our main courses were brought to out table. All I can say is the main courses which included Filet Mignon and Crab was over the top AMAZING!!!! Then the final treat was two platters filled with chocolate dipped strawberries, figs, and sliced apricots. WHAT AN EXPERIENCE !!!!!! Great place to dine!!!!

OMG!  This place is an EXPERIENCE!  Pricey and worth every penny.  The service from start to finish is over-the-top excellent.  we have gone here once a year, every year for the past 15 years.  We have the same sommelier every year and he has never steered us wrong on wines.  The starter salad alone is amazing and delicious. I love that the price of each meal includes the salad, starch and veggies (it's not all a la carte -- which bugs me).  
the portions are so huge that you can easily split a meal and leave more than satisfied.  This place is great all around.  Cannot recommend highly enough.
Ahhh Hugo's. While I hadn't been here in at least 5 years......not a thing has changed. And thankfully so. Old school charm and service. Great food, great service, great drinks. Nice.

This was fabulous.  Old school dining at its best.  The filet was perfectly prepared and out of control huge.  The salad made at the table  was very good. Wine selection get great and the chocolate covered strawberry at end of meal and as wonderful.  Staff professional and knew every thing necessary

When there because the last time we where in Vegas for my parent's 50th anniversary we has a great time.  Nice, quiet, great service great food.  Made it a point for just my wife and I to come back again.  Basically it was the same thing.  Only problem was the table next to us.  4 ladies doing their bachelorette thing.  Very noisy and at time vulgar. A older couple who was seated next to them asked to move and 3 persons who sat at that same table walked out.  Even the maitre d asked them to keep it down.  I don't fault the restaurant because they did everything right to us.  Just wish others where more considerate when your spending over $200 for dinner.

I had my first visit to Hugo's Cellar this past weekend and throughly enjoyed it. My bf and I went with another couple who had previously dined here before on several occasions. As we entered, both Karen and I received a long stemmed red rose which I found hilarious for some reason.

My dirty martini was pretty damn good and so was the bacon wrapped filet mignon served on crab legs along with garlic mashed potatoes. Oh yes, I almost forgot, the table side salad. Our salad maker, I think was named Kenny? made a great salad and I had every damn topping short of onions that he offered. 

The only thing we missed out on was dessert but time was an issue. I'd definitely recommend going here for the "old-school" steak experience, especially with good friends who can appreciate the vibe...

Ours was a party of six, a very special surprise Birthday celebration.  I hadn't been to Hugo's in over 20 years, and didn't remember much about the restaurant.
The service was wonderful from the moment we entered.  As others have mentioned, the ladies I the group were greeted with a long stem rose.
Service was prompt and very good.  I think every employee at Hugo's stopped by the table to wish our birthday guest a happy b-day.  Nice.  Food was served in a timely manner, and was great (except the tough, stringy, white asparagus-no one liked it).  A small pyramid shaped mousse cake was presented to the Birthday guest, along with the dipped fruit dessert.  Very nice!  Everyone had more than enough food, and left very satisfied.

The ONLY hitch was after we had left the restaurant, and went to pick up our car in Valet.  We took our validated ticket to where we had dropped the car off.  After standing, being ignored, for way too long, I hailed the valet (Lamont).  He barked "you're in the WRONG PLACE".  He said we needed to take the ticket to a window half way across the property!  I am disabled, and had walked about as far as I could - and explained this to him.  He said that "that was where I had to go if I wanted my car".  He said, very sarcastically, that if I "couldn't possibly" walk there, that my guest would have to schlep the ticket there, and ask them to bring the car to 'this side'.   I was totally embarrassed!  The Birthday guest saw my anguish, and she offered to go turn the ticket in for me.  She returned, some 5-10 min later, and we bagan the wait.  Nearly 15 minutes later valet, Lamont, walked by and said that our car is sitting at Valet - across the building.  I made the painful trek with the help of my guest.  More embarrassment!  I was nearly in tears from the pain by the time we got to the other Valet area.  Needless to say, my evening was ruined!
NONE of this should have happened.  I had gone thru the trouble of visiting the valet area, and walking to Hugo's, then back to valet, some 5 hours earlier.  Knowing that I can only walk a short distance, I wanted to make sure that I would be able to make the walk.  I didn't want my disability to interfere with the other guests enjoyment in any way.  Instead, I was made into a gimp spectacle.  
I doubt that we will EVER return for more abuse!

An intimate romantic restaurant with excellent high quality dining! This is one of the best restaurants to dine at here in Las Vegas. Tucked away inside of the Four Queens casino, you go down the stairs into a lowly lit beautiful dining experience. It starts with a staff member handing the women in your party a fresh rose. You are greeted by multiple staff, it is a very warm and friendly environment. Plan on spending some time when you come here, your dinner is served in stages and it is well worth the wait. They have an excellent menu of fine dining, from steaks to fish. I love the experience of the table side salad preparation. You can choose from a large array of additions from anchovies, pinenuts, boiled eggs and artichoke hearts. If you would like to have wine, the sommelier will come and discuss it with you, and give you recommendations. Also know that they do have half bottles of wine if you just want a glass or two. I had the fillet wrapped in bacon topped with crabmeat.  The steak was very tender, even though I ordered it well done! They offer a complimentary dessert tray, with fresh fruit dipped in chocolate. This restaurant is an excellent choice for a fine dining experience and a great date night!

My wife and I recently spent our 20th anniversary in Las Vegas and decided to try Hugo's on the recommendation of a buddy who comes to Vegas a lot.

We ordered single malt scotch and wine to drink respectively and were impressed how generous they were with the drinks.  The house Cab was just average, but they brought me a HIGHBALL full of Macallan for the single shot price, which was nice.

We both ordered the salad cart, which was awesome.  The dressings were not too heavy and the selection of veggies to compose your salad from was outstanding.  For dinner, I ordered the 16 ounce NY Strip med rare with the blue cheese creme topping.  The wife got Hugos chicken and we both got special vegetables.  A few cool things about Hugos - First the setting is great, quaint little brick basement with low ceilings and a 70s feel - they bring you sorbet between courses to cleanse the palate.  When we told them it was our anniversary, they brought us a little Luxor-shaped mousse with a candle.  Very cool.  Also, as has been mentioned many times, every lady gets a single rose.  My wife was so tickled by it she brought it home to Denver on the plane.

So, in summary,  good food and fun ambiance.  Go do it once if you want good food on Fremont.

I just had a birthday dinner here, and it was great!  A few friends had recommended Hugo's to me over the years...but I was resistant to the idea of even eating in the Four Queens hotel.  While parking is a bad joke downtown, flip-flop-clad low rent tourists are coming out of the woodwork and it is very crowded on the weekend...I actually think the trip to Hugo's was totally worth it.

The aged meat was FANTASTIC!  I had the filet (10oz) and it was accompanied by a couple of nice sides and included a salad prepared from their tableside cart.  This place has a great old-school vibe, not unlike the Golden Steer.

The service was truly outstanding, with someone always there to cater to our every need.

Considering that I live in Henderson, it was a fair drive to downtown...but I'd go back!  The atmosphere there _really is_ a cellar and it has great ambient lighting.

Every woman gets a long stem rose upon being seated...nice touch.

We dined at Hugo's Cellar on Friday July 15, 2016 and I will admit I was slightly nervous. I was nervous because our party included my 9 year old niece.  I know this is not a typical "kid-friendly" restaurant (no kid's menus here) so I wasn't sure how staff would react to her dining with us. My niece is generally well behaved, and LOVES her food, so we figured she would enjoy a meal here. After getting dressed up in our "special occasion clothes" (as the child calls them) we headed downtown. We made the reservation for 7:00, because this was our arrival day and we weren't sure how long it would take for the deuce bus to make it from the strip to Freemont Street; we wanted to make sure we had plenty of time. We arrived shortly after 6:00 PM, nearly a full hour before our reservation time. We were hungry, so we decided to check and see if they could accommodate our early arrival. As soon as we walked in the Maître D greeted us and singled out my niece, complementing her dress and calling her the prettiest lady in the room. After handing each of us a rose, they escorted us to our table. After we placed our order, bread and drinks were brought to our table. The bread was superb, with the Lavosh becoming a particular favorite. As other reviewers have mentioned, the table side salad service is delightful. Their orange honey vinaigrette was outstanding. I would return to this restaurant for the salad alone, and I am most certainly not a salad person.  Shortly after our salad plates were cleared, a palate cleansing sorbet was brought out. Our entrees were brought out shortly after this. I ordered the prime rib, which was excellent. It was juicy and tender - it practically melted in my mouth. My best friends each ordered the fillet mignon and my niece ordered the scallops. Everyone raved about their particular orders. After dinner, the complimentary chocolate covered fruit was delivered to our table, along with the desert tray. We decided on a crème brulee (as my best friend can't turn down crème brulee when it's available) and the cherries jubilee, as we knew my niece would enjoy watching the preparation. The creme brulee was average - not bad by any means, but not particularly outstanding. The cherries jubilee was very good, but I think I'd prefer something else off the menu next time. 

Hugo's Cellar was a big hit with our group. All staff was welcoming and went out of their way to speak to my niece - my concerns regarding her presence were completely unfounded. When asked about what her favorite part of the trip was all weekend (a weekend that included going to see a show and the Avengers S.T.A.T.I.O.N) she said the "fancy dinner". We will definitely visit Hugo's again, but will probably limit ourselves to a splurge once a year. Cannot recommend this place highly enough!

I just first want to say that this is not the type of review I thought I would write for HC because I have enjoyed it in the past but that was a long time ago so I have to treat my current experience separately. I also understand that It was getting close to closing so we get that the staff may be tired or not on their game. 

My big pet peeve is the hostess staring at you like she has no idea why you are coming towards her. If I ran a restaurant the hostess would lead the conversation not wait for you to inform her that you are there to eat at her restaurant. They presented my Wife with a rose which was a nice touch but the stem looked as if it came from a corn field. A little cut would have been better. We felt we had a sunflowers towering over us the whole time. 

We were seated and met with a couple different staff members who all tried to get us to buy alcohol and then had a look of disappointment when we declined as we always do. 

After a longer than I would have liked wait, we were asked to give our order. I have a Strip Steak and my Wife the prime rib. Before hand they brought out a salad bar and made our salad's before us which was nice. Everything was fresh and was well prepared. 

Then they presented us with what can only be described as a tart, raspberry sorbet.  This was a pallet cleaner, I decided to leave mine dirty after one bite. 

Our steaks finally came out and the first thing we noticed is how hot they were. I've been to enough steak houses to know that it was an abnormal temperature. We wondered if they had put it in a microwave. Pure speculation. Though the steaks in general were good but my strip steak was just a little tough in the initial cut. 

We declined dessert and handed the waiter our CC to pay. It must have taken him 10 minutes to come back. Again too long and he took my ID with him. I just feel like when you're running a business there should always be someone there to take the money. 

Anyway, a three for me. No Lawry's that's for sure. That place knows how to run a restaurant. I wanted to give it a four but too many details overlooked.
My favorite place to dine while in Vegas. Food is great and service is outstanding. Would recommend reservations on the weekends.

What a delight this place was!

Romantic ambiance, tuxedoed waitstaff, and truly wonderful food.

I really felt like Hugo's has some special feel of what old Vegas was like.

The made to order Salad was followed by a humorously tiny sorbet to clear the pallet before the delicious entree.  I had the Ahi Tuna which was seared to perfection.

Dinner was topped of with a rose for each of the ladies at the table, which was a wonderfully elegant touch.

Keep in mind that the price is quite high, so be prepared.  I found it to be worth it, and look forward to coming back some day.

This is usually one of our go to's when we're in Vegas.  The food is probably the best meal you'll get in downtown.  You definitely can't miss the salad cart, and if you want a steak, they make a good one.  I've more recently experienced some of their chicken dishes which I actually prefer over their steaks.  For dessert, we've had the Cherries Jubilee and Bananas Foster, both are great but I'd lean towards the Bananas Foster.  The only real issue with Hugo's is in the last 10 years the service has gone downhill.  It's not terrible but just not as attentive as it used to be.  There are better restaurants in Vegas at this price point but if you're going on a date and want some old school Vegas feel, this is a great restaurant.  We're likely to go back every time we're in Vegas and hopefully it will pick back up to the level it used to be.

Hugo's Cellar at the 4-Queens in downtown Vegas is a place you want to bring someone you want to impress. It's an 'old-style' high-backed leather booth sort of steakhouse, where every lady gets a rose before being seated. It's straight out of 'Old Vegas'. In short, they wheel an impressive 'salad cart' to your table with tons of choices, which your waiter will prepare before you, and the Prime Rib and Filet Mignon entrees were top notch too. Oh, and the service is unbelievable also. If you're in Sin City, it would be a sin to pass up Hugo's!

Waited months to put this on our dining list as the last few times in Vegas ,we ran out of time. Was disappointed and will not be going back. The great thing, was the service. Our waiter was so friendly, not pushy and so kind. We had 8:30pm reservations. My sister and I. Appetizer was spinach/artichoke dip. Very good flavor, but runnier than most we've ever had. The salads, yes, they do table side,molts of choices, excellent display and server. Sister ordered triple seafood sampler, and I had the prime rib. She really liked her food, me, my prime rib was cooked perfect to "medium", but not very warm/hot. I did not want to send it back, ( really, at Hugo's), no, I just couldn't. The red, garlic mashed potatoes and fresh asparagus were good. Just so disappointed in the meat. Prime rib just also didn't have a lot of flavor. I like that the au jus is served on the side so it's not swimming in it. They do give roses to all the ladies upon arriving and wrap them for you on leaving. It is Old World like in Al Capone days, but so so neat a place. It is not cheap, but do not mind paying for an excellent meal, no matter where I'm traveling. Just was disappointed, as sister had been there many times and I just can't return. I do not believe a chef should send out just warm food, especially a steak.

One of Vegas's oldest steak houses and still in my top 3! Its a little hole in the wall downtown in the 4 queens and a dinning experience you wont forget. 5 star service 5 star food. We live in town and have been here a couple of times. We always get the same thing, my husband gets the prime rib that is cooked to perfection, juicy and tender. I get the chilean sea bass that melts in my mouth, I haven't had a better one yet at any other place. Its a DONT MISS whether you live in town or are just visiting!
all I can say is that best steak house and best service in las vegas. guys if ur on ur first date take her to this place. she will be impressed. ps ladies get a free single long stem rose at the door
Hugo's is an exceptional place to go & eat, & relax. It is old Las Vegas. A place where adults can get away. The food is great, as is the service. Everything about Hugo's is wonderful.

Great food with a cool Old Vegas atmosphere.  Only downside is that it is a nice restaurant, but so many people come in off the Fremont Street Experience not planning on a nice dinner and are dressed very casually. Seeing someone in cut off jeans and a tank top might ruin some of the ambiance.

Im a fan of Hugos Cellar.. it didn't blow me away, but the service was great and the food was good. Were it based on service it would be 4-4.5 stars easily. 

The occasion was for a birthday dinner, and we had a few drinks, followed by more drinks.. so that helps here with this review :) In addition I am a fan of "Beef Wellington" and they had a serving of 'Individual Beef Wellington' on the menu. That was actually what solidified my choice to check it out for the big dinner. 

It was myself and a couple of friends, which seemed about right.. but I have to say that it is a very intimate setting.. so it would be very well suited for a date or a couple having a date. Nonetheless, it's worth checking out if you are a group of friends that likes quality food. 

The restaurant itself is in a lower level of the "Four Queens" Casino... The casino itself may be a bit long in the tooth and has some serious smoking areas still allowed, so be wary of that if you are sensitive to smoke.. because there is A LOT of it. 

Down below where the restaurant is located, its dimly lit, old-school style and comfortable feeling. Above where the casino is, its a bit dank, old and crappy.. lol. A friend compared it to snorkeling - in that it looks beautiful when you are down below, and when you raise your head above water, its a little less than exciting.. in fact a dump.. haha. 

Anyhow.. our waiter was awesome in relaying the specials. They create a custom salad for you table side then serve your items as ordered, and the meal is followed up by fruits dipped on white chocolate. It was nice, but I could have doe without dried apricots dipped in chalky white chocolate... I just didnt eat it. 

I opted for a coffee desert drink as I was getting drunk and needed caffeine :] 

So give it a try if you like something with a bit more style. be prepared to drop a few bucks, but make a night of it and head downtown after for some drinks and people watching.

When it comes to a romantic night out in Vegas, this is my #1 recommendation.  Hugo's Cellar is extraordinary.  Located on Fremont street, in the basement of  the 4 Queens Hotel, this is one place in Vegas you should not pass up.

You begin your evening checking in with the Maitre D', and grabbing a seat in their small but well appointed bar area.  When your table is ready, they give any women in your party long stemmed red roses to set the ambiance for the evening before leading you through their intimate dining area to your table.

Your wait staff will stop by, introduce themselves, and get drink orders. (Yes, I said wait staff - you will have three waiters jumping to get you whatever you need to make your dinner fabulous.)  They will also offer to send over their award winning Sommelier to advise on your wine options.  They have a well appointed wine cellar, and a wide variety of bottles to choose from.  

After your orders are placed, and your appetizers are finished, one of your waiters will bring a cart to the table, and make each person a generously portioned tossed salad, right at your table.  Their salad dressings are all wonderful, and they have a nice selection of salad toppers to choose from.

After salad, you will be given a miniature sorbet ice cream cone as a palette cleanser before the main entree arrives, and this is when your taste buds will do a dance of joy.  Their food is AMAZING.  Their prime rib is some of the best in town, but their Raspberry Chicken is my whole reason for going to Hugo's.  It is DIVINE.  My wife loves their Beef Wellington, and my in-laws both love the Queen's Lobster.

After your meal is complete, you waiters will bring a tower of chocolate dipped fruit to share while you peruse the dessert menu. I can't comment on the dessert offerings because their food is so incredible I've never been able to save enough room to actually contemplate ordering one.  I can say that the chocolate dipped figs and strawberries are delightful.

The best part is that at Hugo's, their prices do not match the extravagance of their service.  An average evening with dinner, a shared appetizer, and 2 glasses of wine or adult beverages, and our average ticket is about $150 after tip.  For a dining experience like Hugo's, I have spent easily twice that much at other establishments.  Do yourself and your wife a favor, and treat yourselves.  it is worth every penny.

5 star service, 4.5 food and 5 star value. The often yelped about salad cart is overrated. Plenty of choices for a custom salad, but 3 standard dressing choices. Most places BOA or any steakhouse has way better salads. The rib eye was terrific and cooked to order exactly how I expected. The room itself was an old school Vegas restaurant that impressed me. The hostess was pleasant and the waiter was attentive and very nice. I did not love my side dishes, but they are not a la carte. They were included so I could hardly complain. I had a great experience and will go back next time in Vegas.

I chose this place because of the positive reviews. Either everyone else has really different standards, somethings has changed or some of these review are, well, maybe inflated? 

Any way here is a list of the good, the bad and the ugly:

Good: 
The ambiance*
The martinis*
The salad
The server pouring water
The seared prime rib

Bad:
1) The table-side manner. The waiter who greeted us (Jaime) was clearly in training as another waiter (Greg) was visibly agitated by whatever he believed Jaime wasn't doing correctly and it was awkward for everyone. 

2) The timing. There were two of us, the place was calmly busy, and yet we were seated at a place with 4 settings and had one of the other waiters reaching across multiple times us as they removed each fork, knife, napkin, etc. 

3) The training. Jaime showed how green he was when I told him I was considering the Ahi Tuna. He said it could be prepared the three ways the menu described. Hmmmm, I pretty sure you are not going to have your ahi tuna steak breaded or any of the other ways listed. More training needed before being on the floor.

4) The seating. I've waited tables for 7 years and you don't seat a new waiter with three tables back to back, especially at a labor intensive restaurant like this. 

5) The host. One skill a host should have is being good with faces. We checked in a bit early and the waiter said to come back at our exact time. Since the bar was very tiny, we went back upstairs until the exact time. He had no idea who we were when we came back 15 minutes later. 

7) The seafood. The second waiter (Greg - too agro, not the right personality for a waiter) came over and so I asked him if the Ahi was good. He said no. Points for being honest. He suggested the $54 Chilean Sea Bass instead. Given that the only other seafood item (I don't eat beef) of interest was the $85 King crab legs, and I usually love Chilean Sea Bass, I went for it. He said it came with a "shrimp sauce" on top. I asked for it on the side because why ruin a $54 fish entree with a sauce? This ended up being by FAR the WORST Chilean Sea Bass I've ever eaten. I see why they have you pour a very thick cream "shrimp sauce" on top of it. It didn't taste remotely like Sea Bass. It seemed like it had been boiled in water for an hour and then pan seared. It was total mush and completely flavorless. It was served with red potatoes which were also pretty flavorless. THIS was the #1 seafood recommendation?!?

8) The timing - when Greg had told me not to go with the Ahi, I asked for another minute to take a look at the menu. Then no one came back for about 20 minutes so we could finish ordering. We finally got our salads after being there an hour (we did not get apps) because Jaime was busy making salads for other tables ahead of us, which why I mentioned #4. 

9) The bathrooms. There are no bathrooms in the restaurant, which is subdued and dim like a steak place should be. So you have to go up into the blaring loud casino and walk quite a ways to the bathroom.

10) Attention to detail. My martini was served in a glass with a big crack down the side and I had to request a new glass. I didn't realize olives could age, but these "green" olives were nearly colorless and seemed to have also lost their olive flavor. We were also not given wine menus and had to ask for them. The waiters also did not refill our drinks when they were empty. 

11) The bread. There were 3 types of "bread" in the basket. One tasted like a giant, very stale, almost moist, saltine cracker. The other two were super cheap little rolls you would get at a Sizzler buffet. 

12) Honesty. I already had an issue with this given the low-quality of food they are serving for the 5-star prices, but another thing that was directly misleading was that they say on the menu they serve bottled water. Yes, it comes out of a large glass container with a screw top that is I suppose technically a bottle, but it's clearly refilled tap water. And - there is no ice in the drinks so plan on warm water with your meal. 

If we were not there to celebrate my husband's birthday, I would have addressed these items in person with a manager. 

My takeaway is that this place is trying to get by with an "old school" steakhouse vibe and not even trying when it comes to a good wait staff, quality food or the kind of attention to detail that should be second nature for what they are charging.

Hugo's = Vegas Legend? Yes! 
Hugo's = The REAL old school Vegas Experience? Yes! 

Hugo's cellar is definitely one of the best restaurants I have EVER eaten in Las Vegas. We journey to Vegas multiple times a year and have tried many of the so called "best" in vegas spots via YELP/Tripadvisor. 

 Honestly, They dont compare to Hugos in price, service, ambiance, and quality of dishes. Hugos is a classic and I hope never changes. What folks need to realize, is that places like Hugos dont hardly exist anymore. So you better help keep these places alive.

A classic top notch service gourmet room in 2013? Nearly impossible to find. Hugos is one of the best in Vegas for their traditional menu (Old School but in a good way) offering Steak, Seafood,Prime Ribs, Beef Wellington, Chateaubriand and they succeed flawlessly in delivering excellent food and and service. Hugos You found customers for life.

Service: We were greeted in a warm and friendly manner. The waiters were professional and top notch.  Food was spaced and paced adequately and they had the mandatory 3 person wait staff present for all tables. They also prepared custom table-side salad for ALL orders. Do I want shrimp in that salad? Heck yes. Fresh cracked pepper? A must! I get to choose my toppings? My my my. 

Food:
Wife and I had the Prime Rib, which were excellent in terms of quality and price. The Prime Rib was cooked well and came with all the accoutrements. Solid piece not to mention the custom salad cart. 

Bread: Warm and soft. They had really yummy bread. Probably shouldn't have filled up on it. 

Atmosphere:
Nothing fancy, but clean and orderly. It was probably the nicest spot in the 4 Queens Casino. Its downstairs by the poker tables if your lost.

We go to Hugo's every time we go to Vegas! This is a must go place! The food is always amazing, as is the service. You will not be sorry if you go to Hugo's, you will be planning your next trip so you can go again. Go to Hugo's!! I am telling you to GO TO HUGOS! :)
Jimuay spent 300 on dinner sitting next to a group of people with juicy sweats.  Meal was nice crowd was thrift mall
