The food was excellent.  When you see the price of an entree it appears to be costly, then you find out that you get a huge salad made at your table, a little sherbet served between the salad and main course, then to top everything off chocolate dipped strawberries, dried figs and apricots.
The waiters keep your water glass filled and anything else you need.  The long stem rose for the ladies is a nice touch.
I had the prime rib served just as ordered and my wife the filet mignon which was perfect.
This restaurant gives you both good food and tastefully extras.

So we were celebrating a family reunion in Vegas. We made the reservation for 8 and then it became 10 when we called a few hours before the reservation. It was no problem at all. We waited at the bar for 5 or 10 minutes and had a great round of drinks. And coming from New York, they were reasonably priced.  The host then handed all the ladies a single red rose and we were escorted to our table. The table was in a private room and our roses were placed in vases in the center of the table. So pretty. The service was impeccable, and the prices were great BECAUSE it was NOT ala carte. So refreshing.  When you order your entree, you get salads and sides. The salad was wheeled over on a cart and the waiter puts whatever you like in it. Before you get the main course, there was an intermezzo palate cleansing lemon sorbet cone given out as well. Very nice touch. The main course was delicious. We all got filets. Some were wrapped Wellington style but all cooked perfectly. At the end of the meal they put trays of chocolate wrapped strawberries, figs and apricots on the table. We had a memorable, special evening. I would go back any time.

came highly recommended by a local of Las Vegas

place has very cheap drinks and great cheap food

menu is large drink menu is large

this place is packed with people long waits

decors nice
this place is very very very clean

I came here with my boyfriend for our very first time for Valentine's Dinner (the day before because it was booked on the 14th). From the moment we entered the service was phenomenal. There were warm smiles everywhere. We arrived exactly on time for our reservation and were seated immediately after being handed a rose. Once seated, we had several gentleman serve us. There were 4 to be exact, although I can only remember 3 names: Rashard, Oscar and Dave. All four were kind and humored us quiet a bit. 
First, Rashard came and asked us what we would like to drink. (TIP: it's an open bar charge of $10... We didn't know this or we would have taken advantage lol). I got wine and my boyfriend got whiskey. Both delicious. The server who brought the wine was very knowledgable and funny (can't remember name). The salad done by Rashard was delicious! I asked for the honey dressing that they had and, my goodness, it was delectable, my boyfriend got the same dressing and also loved it. 
Oscar came by next to give us raspberry sorbets in cute little cones to help cleanse. He too cracked a few jokes and was very friendly (our favorite 2 servers were Rashard and Oscar for their humor).
Next the entrées served by Dave. I ordered the filet mignon and my boyfriend had the queen lobster. Both were seasoned perfectly and cooked just right. We didn't have room for dessert although they do bring complementary desserts which are a few fruits covered in chocolate. Overall, it was a great experience and I definitely recommend it to everyone! Just be ready to drop anywhere from $175-$275 for 2 people. It's worth it though!

I have dined at hugos since they opened many years ago but the last 5 years it has been doo doo as far as quality of food and service...except for John, the sommelier .  
But, we have to keep taking our out of town friends there as they have memories there too.  Last time we dined there, there was glass in our salads....the waiter could care less and the manager came in 45 minutes because he also works acrossed the street.  he said he would take the cost of one salad of the check...anyway, if anyone had good service please tell me...I have to go there again on Friday and I want it to be special.

Best martinis ever...and they give you 3 servings in a carafe. Rack of lamb is always perfect. Salad is made to order and spectacular. This time it was the 10 of us dining out. Everyone was happy. I took off one star because the tiramisu was an abomination...come on guys, go pick one up at Costco, charge triple and serve it up.
Another huge minus: it's off of Freemont street....I'm so over the freak show, it's just gross. Having to put up with that might be the only reason why I might not return to Hugo's.

Outstanding traditional steakhouse.

+ Dark, but not so much one cannot read the menu

+ Good service - polite, informative and not overbearing

+ Not everything is à la carte. Salad is included with the meal and it's made tableside. Same with the dinner carbs - choice of rice, potatoes, etc. is included with the meal. This makes my decisions less complicated.

+ The desert that is again part of the meal was really a nice touch - especially the figs!

It on the old Vegas Strip - downstairs away from the hustle just a few feet away. I'd definitely go back.

Simply the best. Best quality of food. We always order out steak rare at most medium rare and it's hard to get somewhere that can make it right. Well Hugo's Cellars is the best place for steak, service, and a must for a trip to Vegas. From the moment we walked in my wife received a rose and staff was more than helpful friendly staff at a restaurant they set the standards on what service should be. Honestly they raise the bar a few notches. Appetizers were great bread with rose butter so good. Main entrees were beyond delicious. Out steak was not over or under cooked which is easily done when ordering a rare steak they do not make any mistakes on food. This review still cannot serve this place justice they are incredible hands down. Oh and VICTOR, he just made it for us he was not our waiter or the manager he was the salad guy he will make your night and the experience very conversational never misses a beat his personality made our entire Vegas trip the best. If you make a reservation and have never been there before request Victor just going to Hugo's cellar is awe inspiring and an experience to remember but having Victor is truly what makes it the best. Must go there is a reason they have great reviews. The price yes it is higher priced so if your looking for a low priced meal it's not here. We spent $160 for 2 steak dinners and drinks. It was our anniversary so they brought a a special desert at no charge. I in no way regret spending the amount we did on dinner the food quality shows why and the service is unlike anywhere else we have EVER BEEN.

man i love this joint. 

the food is amazing and the ambiance very romantic. or in my case BRO-mantic as i come here annually with my high school bud. we had a blast with 6 dudes at the table. we were very loud, but it's spacious enough that it won't matter. plus it's vegas baby.
don't get me wrong this is a classy joint, very upscale, but i love how we can come in here decked out in our now infamous vegas costumes complete with leisure suits and bandanas and no one blinks an eye.

do get: the BEEF WELLINGTON. my favorite thing on the menu. careful tho... if you get it too "rare" the pastry crust doesn't cook all the way through.

salad: this place makes your salad for you at your table and it's divine. my personal preference is to NOT mix in every salad ingredient as it will turn your salad into a funk salad. IXNAY on the hearts of palm (it overpowers all the other flavors). keep it simple, less is more. LOVE the  baby shrimp on the salad - goes well with cream dressing, egg and bacon.

I absoluetly love this restaurant. It's defiantly pricy, not gonna lie, but the food is spectacular, and the ambience is even better. You should probably make reservations, because some nights are packed. The host(ess) seeats you, grabbing roses for all the females in the bunch. The server comes and brings lavash bread and "bottled water". There is a wine sommelier (better be good wine), as well as a full bar. The meals come with a salad cart, stocked full of different toppings, such as anchovies, bay shrimp, bleu cheese, and an amazing peppercorn dressing. The steaks are amazing, I go for filet mignon or any small cut steak. The dessert is my favorite part, they bring you fresh whipped cream and chocolate dipped fruit. No need to order any other dessert. This meal is one of a kind, the ambience is dark and mysterious "hence cellar". The meal will cost ya and the bathroom is located in the casino, but it is well worth it! Trust me

The service and ambience of Vintage Vegas is here and has never left... You first walk downstairs to a larger than life "cellar," and you and your guest is greeted by a maitre de. The woman of your party is given a rose for just attending their establishment! Get ready for food! The menu is elegant, and nothing is missed for a wonderful steak house. The salad is a joy in itself, the way they cater to your order. I had the Atlantis steak. 10oz filet wrapped in bacon and crab, good. So good! Dessert. Try the banana fosters. I don't even like bananas and I loved it.

Best meal in Vegas I've ever had! Huge delicious portions (I thoroughly enjoyed my filet). Salad made at the table. Free rose to all the ladies (bonus!). And some delicious desserts, to boot! Also, there is a great wine selection, nay, AWESOME wine selection.

Having to go through the decidedly lower-rent Four Queens to get there is interesting, but Hugo's Cellar really is a slice of heaven in Downtown Vegas. 

Come for a romantic and delicious dinner, stay for a yard of margaritas and the light show outside afterward.

Excellent.  It's the hidden jewel of Vegas.  If you can deal w/ the humble outdoors (4 Queens Hotel), the restaurant is fantastic - definitely misplaced.  Service is great, food is abundant and delicious.  Try it!

The service here was PHENOMENAL. Our waiters were incredible, and I *loved* all the little touches like the table side salad (AMAZING!), the sorbet, the flambee table-side, the chocolate covered strawberries...

The ambience was wonderful, everyone there was so friendly...

I LOVED EVERYTHING ABOUT THAT!

The food was just "OK" though. My boyfriend got rib eye and garlic mashed potatoes. The rib eye was decent and the mashed potatoes got cold very quick. I got the duck and boiled potatoes. The duck was a bit dry and the potatoes were bland.

With the desserts, the chocolates were already super-hard, so it wasn't fresh-dipped. Even the whipped cream was kind of hard.

I loved the salad, especially the pine nuts.

For best FOOD on Fremont, I'm a huge Vic and Anthony's fan. It's amazing. But the experience here was outstanding!!! We'll definitely go again. :)

This is our anniversary/special occasion restaurant.  It is always a great meal with great service.  Their steaks are delish and the salad that comes with the meal is something I would put on my list of things to eat if I was going to the electric chair.

The meals include salad and sweets (choc dipped fruits and some delish and I'm quite sure the most fattening whipped cream ever) so save some cashola and don't order any apps.  You will be quite full the time the dessert tray comes out.  Our dinners usually range from $120 (no wine) - 200 (with wine) for the 2 of us.  It's fantastic every time....well almost....

This visit was not as good as our other visits because of a bunch of goobers in the back room (we were seated right next to it) being very loud and obnoxious - since when do birthdays excuse you from having manners? The food and service were great despite the mannerless cretins.    

If you go, request a booth in the front part of the restaurant.  It  is almost a completely different experience - much more quiet and romantic.  

There isn't a dress code per se but there is a sign that says no tank tops, shorts or flip flops.  Well, obvs they don't enforce it cuz the BF and I both had flip flops on and I had a tank on.  There were folks in there in shorts and crap that they just pulled out of the hamper so it doesn't look like they enforce the rules.

PS: The gals get a rose upon entry which you can give to one of the many hobos or unsupervised little kids outside on the FSE.

I hate to be like this, but Hugo's Cellar was kind of a disappointment.  After all the amazing reviews, we thought it would be a nice, romantic place to eat.  It  was nice and romantic.  The food...well... 

Lobster bisque was very good.  Then it went downhill.  I ordered my meat medium,  and my husband ordered his rare.  Mine came back extremely rare, while his was literally cold.  Both dishes were sent back. They gave me a whole new steak, which was again, very rare. And instead of truly heating up my husband's steak, they simply placed the entire plate back under the heat lamp. So the plate came back hot, while the steak was still cold.  Just very disappointing for a place that is supposed to specialize in this kind of thing.

My husband did not want to make a big deal, so he just didn't eat the dish and asked for them not to charge us.  They didn't...so to speak.  They ended up charging us 15 dollars for the salad he ate beforehand.  Come on.  15 dollars.  

Atmosphere was great.  Steak- no way.  Two dishes screwed up? I'd rather not take the chance to try again and just go somehwere tried and true.
Heard about this place from a friend and I am glad that we finally tried it out. Awesome food and awesome service!! Love the old school feel that the restaurant gives. We will definitely be back.

Top of the line!

Talk about a throw-back in time, this is the place!  It's located in the cellar of the Four Queens Casino in downtown Las Vegas near the Fremont Experience.  I felt like I was stepping back in time when I walked in.  There's even an old school smell that accompanies the place, one of those nostalgic smells of another place and time.

The atmosphere is quite romantic, as the lights are perfectly staged for an evening of fun.  =0)  Every couple is given a long stem red rose for their significant other.  I found that to be a rather charming touch.  

The wine is absolutely delicious and they have their very own wine connoisseur who delights in telling you a story or two about his wine experience working at Hugo's over the years.  He's quite personable.  ;0)  He promised he'd help finish the bottle of wine off if we had any problems with it.  =0)  The martini's are to die for as well!  I had one that seemed like 2 and a half....wow---is all I have to say about that.  

The food is absolutely delicious and the service was superb!  Before I kick in to detail about how wonderful the food was, let me say that every entree comes with seasoned vegetables and baby red potatoes, a fresh salad, fresh bread, sorbet and chocolate dipped fruit.  I kid you not...really.  =0)  

So, carrying on---We had the Fabulous Michael as our marvelous server and he was SUPERB, with an in-depth knowledge on all of the meals offered.  I opted for the awesome Salmon and my pal opted for the Chilean Sea Bass.  They were both EXCELLENT!!!!  

Prior to the dinner coming over they have a huge salad cart that comes around and you can select exactly what you want on your salad.  I was pretty full just from the salad.  =0)  But, I pressed on and ate a little bit of everything.   Well, we were quite full, but the Banana Fosters looked like such an awesome presentation that we decided to order that just for the experience.  =))

The experience is quite unique and I recommend giving it a try!  You must!!  You will be quite delighted, I promise you.

Yvette L. Brownstone from Ventura, CA

This Place is HORRIBLE!
We had the Prime Rib there.... you cou not even cut it it was so tough.
My friend choked on it and the waiters could care less if you die there...
All they want you to do is pay and get the hell out.
Very Rude and Outrageous prices!
Not fine dining as claimed.... Go to the strip for real fine dining leave downtown for quick bites only....

Truly one of the grand old dames of the Las Vegas scene.  It is certainly a throwback, but in the way.

Food/Drink: In the end, this is the most important right? Everyone at my table enjoyed their meal. I had the fish of the day, which was done perfectly, but can't comment too much on everyone elses.  The others in my parties got a Ribeye and some other cut of steak and both gave two monster thumbs up. The sides were perhaps a bit too rich, but nothing to really cause a downgrade.

Service: Service stuck out the most to me and really is what earned this the five star.  From the beginning they are extremely attentive.  The rose for the ladies was welcomed by all.  Additionally, we had a classically trained sommelier who was excellent and chose a wine that really actually complemented the meal, that was not even close to the most expensive on the menu.   

Ambience: Classy place, dark (not too dark) and romantic.  I thought it had excellent acousitcs insofar as you knew others were in the restaurant but you could still talk at a nice level.  

Price: $300 for four of us with a good amount of wine seemed extremely fair for the enjoyment we got from the night.  So it is pricey, but less so than most of the fancier steakhouses in town.

I definitely recommend for a special night out.

Old style Vegas at its finest. Classy, elegant, and incredibly good food! Everything is included with your meal (salad, sides, and a small Deseret platter). Total bargain for Vegas!
The Kona coffee was excellent (and a terrible idea for me so late at night! Lol)
Had the beef Wellington and it was cooked to perfection. I was super surprised at how much I loved this place!

I'm with the band: Hugo's should not be missed. It is as it should be when one parts with hard earned dollars for another to prepare and serve them a nice dinner. Isn't that what we all want?

Excellent cuisine, unobtrusive service, and chivalry. 

Save room for dessert and the Kona coffee--a nice finish.

This is the hardest three star review I've rated because I actually loved the place.

First, the ambience is great. Located in The Queen casino, you walk into a candlelit cave of old school class. The staff is friendly and professional.

Second, the intangibles of Hugo's are fantastic. Each entree comes with a made to order salad prepared at your table-side that was surprisingly filling and delicious. Between courses they provide you with a sorbet palate cleanser. 

The reason I couldn't give a review higher than three stars is due to the steak quality. I had the ribeye and the gf had the filet mignon: both were okay but not great. Better than a chain restaurant but no where near the quality you would expect from $50+ steaks. This is unfortunate because everything else was done so well but they failed to stick the landing where it matters most. 

Bottom line: loved everything except for our entrees. If you're going to try Hugo's, be prepared to be charmed and order something else besides the steaks.

Went to Hugo's last night for a special anniversary with my wife. We had not been there in 8-9 years. We were seated quickly and we ordered a nice bottle of wine from the sommelier. That was the highlight of the dinner. I ordered the Sea Bass ($59) and my wife ordered the Seafood Trio ($62). My Sea Bass had a frozen taste to it and it was like eating a sponge No taste whatsoever,  My wife's entree was similar. I sent mine back and ordered a filet instead,  as I was not willing to try their seafood again. The filet was good... not great. We came to Hugo's because of the great tradition of excellence in service and food. Neither is present anymore as the service was just ok. When I spend $200 on dinner for two people, I really expect a much better food experience. No more Hugo's for us.

My fiance and I were looking for a place to have a nice romantic dinner during our Vegas trip and we found it at Hugos! The atmosphere was the best the brick walls and candles had such an intimate touch. The service was great I wish I remembered our waiters names but my pregnancy brain won't allow me to do so lol. We both had the filet which was cooked to perfection, garlic mashed potatoes, and asparagus. The Salad with the pepper ranch made to your exact desires was a great way to start the meal. Overall it was a wonderful experience and we will definitely be coming back to have more dinners here during future trips

hugos is in the four queens hotel/casino. their prices are right in line with Fremont st . when in Vegas definitely visit this place. the food is delicious and the service is better than the strip. 
don't expect to be treated like a whale, but its nice to hear please and thank you from the staff. also I liked that they brought drinks when we needed and had good intuition of when to check on our table...

My wife and I were trying to decide what we wanted for dinner so we took a drive to downtown. As we were walking around we remember a friend recommended this place. We did not have reservation, so we went to see if they had any open tables. We got there at 6:30pm and the host said he needed to wait until 6:45 to see if any reservations did not show up. So we decided to wait. At 6:40 the host said he had a cancel. 

I like to rate my food items on a 5 star scale. The number of * is my ratings

What we ordered/items came with entrees: Caesar salad*, NY Sirloin*, Tomato/ pesto stuffed chicken*, dessert plate (we did not eat any of it)

Positives:
Lemon sorbet that is served between the salads and entrees.
No ordering of sides separately (also listed on negatives).
Build your own salad tableside.
Service for bread and water

Negatives:
Atmosphere: Very dark, old feeling, and very small place. They have too many tables for the table side service for the salads and desserts. We sat at a table and when the gentleman was preparing the salads for the booths behind us he kept bumping into us.

Service: The waiter had broken English so it was hard to understand him. He did not make any recommendations. Right after we ordered the guy came to make our salads. The gentleman did not recommend any salad or describe any of the dressings. We heard him describing everything to the tables behind us after we ordered. 

Food: 
Salads- Terrible dressing was very very fishy (anchovies).
Entrees- First, my steak. The steak seemed like it was from a café that serves the $1.99 steak and eggs. This was not a steak from an expensive steakhouse. My wife's chicken was something that you could also get at a cheap café. 
Sides- This was very disappointing that the sides came with the entrée instead of us being able to order what we want. The entrée sides were a stuff tomato, veggies, and mashed potatoes.

This was the most disappointing places we have EVER been to. We have been to many expensive steakhouses and this by far is the WORST. We are locals there are many other great places to eat.

Best restaurant in Vegas!! The atmosphere is very classy and romantic. Each lady is presented with a red rose upon arrival. The service is impeccable! Have eaten there countless times and have never been disappointed with the food or service. The wine list is extensive and John the sommelier is very friendly and knowledgeable. The martinis are served in a little carafe and made to perfection by Dean. I have enjoyed every entrée I have ever had....from beef wellington to prime rib to steak to salmon. The waiters make your salad tableside which is a nice touch. For dessert the bananas foster is incredible, especially when made by Victor. If we lived in Vegas would definitely make Hugo's a once a month event, but do make it there every trip to Vegas!

Old school Las Vegas glamour really felt here! Long stemmed red roses are handed out to the ladies! Prepare to be pampered from the moment you make your way down a short flight of stairs and enter Hugo's Cellar. We had such a marvelous evening celebrating our 30th anniversary.

Hugo's had the right amount of baby boomer nostalgia with waitstaff in tuxedos and elegant 70's deco.  Diners today will love the experience of having tableside service of some of their dishes and desserts. Hugo's is one of the very few restaurants that still carries on this tradition since 1976.

--Highlights --
-all entrées include steamed veggies, choice of potatoes, or wild rice, finished off with strawberries, figs and apricots dipped in chocolate.

-Entrée dishes: something for everyone. Various cuts of steak prepared, seafood, duck and chicken. http://www.hugoscellar.com/files/menu.pdf

-basket of breads and cheese lavosh with a plate of butter carved out in shape of a rose is brought out as soon as you are seated. 

mini ice cream cone with Raspberry sorbet serves as a palate cleanser after salad/before main meal 

-Salad Made Tableside
Server wheels their cart over to you and custom makes your salad.  Of course I got the works with Bay Shrimp, artichokes,  and about 8 other toppings with romaine lettuce. 

Beef Wellington is what I ate!  Loved it!  A VERY tender beef filet garnished with Foie Gras and duxelles wrapped up in a puff pastry, paired with a bordelaise sauce!

-Dessert
after main meal if you order Cherries Jubilee, it's made table side, with a little fire show even.  Cherries, cherry liquor flambe'd served over vanilla ice cream. I would get this again! 

Get Hugo's Cappuccino with brandy and coffee liquor. It actually worked out perfect having it with the complimentary chocolate cake that Chef sent out for Happy Anniversary wishes! Thank you! 

When it comes to service. Impressive. It's well known that most of the original waitstaff since early '80s still works here. One of our servers Jaime, has been there the second longest time at 31 years, Michael, 14 years and the new kid on the block (I didn't catch his name) was 7 years!  

--More 411--
-  dress code not enforced but stay classy and leave shorts, tanks, and sandals at home. 
-  reservations a must! so call..Monday eve was packed
-  plan on spending 2 hours - dinner is slow paced
-  Your red rose is wrapped up in foil for you to take home 
-  they'll validate your ticket for both valet or self parking
-  I thought spending a little over $200 for 2 meals, desserts and beverages was pretty reasonable. 

--Summary--
After having dining experiences at well known Michelin star and celebrity chef restaurants in Vegas, I'm so over it, doesn't impress me anymore. This time I wanted a place that had good food that we both would like, classy and unpretentious. You see hip, trendy restaurants come and go with a blink of an eye. Not Hugo's Cellar! It has withstood the test of time. Happy we celebrated here. Couldn't ask for a more perfect evening with my hot date.

What a class act of a restaurant.   Had reservations for New Years Eve and could not have chosen a better place.   The staff was very sweet and we loved the table side salad.  We were then given sorbet to clean our palette just before our entrees.  I had the beef and it was very moist and tender.  My fiancee' had the sea bass and he really liked it.   My mother opted for the prime rib.  Dessert looked amazing but we were too full.  We were also given passes to Fremont Street Experience and they gave us New Years Party favors as well as a rose for the ladies.   I highly suggest this place!

Vegas is filled with steakhouses.  Palazzo, alone, has three of them.  So with so many options on the strip, its going to have to take a pretty good recommendation for me to stray off the strip for my savory appetite.  Hugo's cellar was recommended to us by one of our customers and he mentioned that it was one of the best steaks he has ever had.  Big words, when it comes to steak in Vegas (..and it was mentioned to us during dinner at Delmonico's).  Nonetheless, my girlfriend and I made it our mission to try Hugo's the next time we were in Vegas.  Here is the short of it:

Pros:
Your lady friend gets a rose when you enter the restaurant.  The amount of food you get for 50 dollars (steak) is a lot.  You get bread, chocolate covered strawberries, salad, and potatoes or vegetables.
Reasonably priced compared to most, if not all a la carte steakhouses

Cons:
Decor is more old school (or hasn't been changed in a while).  Fits in well with the Fremont street casinos.
The steak and the meal were just OK for me.  I definitely left full but I wouldn't necessarily say it was melt in your mouth or the steak was anything to write home about.  

Vegas Cons: 
In a city where image can be anything, this place just doesn't cut it.  Its in a cellar and it is on Fremont street.  There are so many other choices in Vegas that can give you a better view, or a more comfortable seating, or give you better recognition or name.  
The crowd is older, not as dressy and fits more with the surroundings.  I wore dark jeans and a nice shirt (standard guy-wear) and I felt overdressed.  

In the end though, I would eat there again.  However, one has to understand the type of meal you are getting and what you are paying for.  With that in hand, its one of the best deals on the strip.

The only reason that I gave them 2 stars is because of the service. If this review was based on the food quality it would be a single star. I have been going to Hugo's for 30 years and by far this was the worst food I ever had there. This food was way over priced for the quality. 2nd Street Grill at the Fremont across the street has a better quality steak dinner for 50% less. I was so dissatisfied with this visit. I know the new owners also own some bars in town: if they are trying to bring "bar quality" food to Hugo's, it's a big mistake. Sorry to say I will never go back to Hugo's.

We were excited to go Hugo's for 20th anniversary.  Service was awful. I had baked stuffed shrimp. Shimp was hot beause plate was hot but stuffing was cold. Sent back and came back hot but shrimp was over cooked. The waiters never came back to check on us. I ate 2 of the 5. The busser came and took our plate  I was to mad to say anything.  He also was the one who brought our chocolates at the end. They didn't offer dessert or coffee. We normally go to Michael's and everyone said to try Hugo's. I was very disappointed.  My husband did enjoy his beef wellington.

This place is awesome! It's like traveling back in time. We discovered this place through our friends a year ago and we had to go back. We enjoyed our team of servers and waiters last year 2013 as well as this year 2014.
Ladies/Gents as you walk in you are greeted with friendly people. Ladies you are handed a rose. Then they will all lead your party to your table. 
They offer you bread and offer you the wine list/drink list right off the bat. Last year our awesome waiter assigned us drinks based on our personalities. We enjoyed them! 
My favorite part of the meal besides the amazing steaks (rib eye, NY steak and prime rib, are all recommended) and the yummy sides, is the salad. They make the salad according to your taste, right in front of you! Love love this part.
This place is highly recommended!

My bf and I went here for a nice sit down dinner on Sunday to cap off our weekend in Vegas! My bf ordered their prime rib, which he loved! I ordered the ribeye steak cooked medium well and it was the best steak I've ever had in my life! It was cooked perfectly and the meat was buttery and melt in your mouth delicious. I finished every last bite of that steak, it was beyond glorious! This place is very nice and they treat you like royalty, will definitely have to come back for the food and the service!
So...I am local. I have been here many times & as much as I LOOOVE the salad, I'm leaving disappointed with the entrees lately. Lack luster in flavor or complexity. Always enjoy the service however!

Picture yourself transported to 1969 Vegas... the hosts and servers wear 3-piece suits with roses in their buttonholes, the somellier has a silver tasting spoon around his neck. Women are greeted with a long-stemmed rose. You're completely transported, until you look around and see the patrons are wearing short sleeved button ups with cargo shorts, the women swearing loudly about how far they can spit. 

The service was very friendly, if a little slow. Gives you plenty of time to sit and relax to enjoy your meal, this is definitely a meal you don't want to rush. 

The escargot was buttery, fluffy, and so deliciously rich. Be careful, they're hot!

The beef wellington was good, but a little dry. We ordered it medium rare, came out completely medium. In the future I would probably go with one of the signature cuts of steak instead.

Duckling flambe - it's always fun to order things that are flambeed table-side! Was very moist and delicious, would definitely recommend this dish. 

Lemon sorbet served in tiny sugar cones as palate cleansers between apps & mains. 
Complementary chocolate-dipped strawberries / dried apricots / figs to close out the meal.

Was not expecting much, was pleasantly surprised, and would definitely come back!

We have been coming to this restaurant since 1987. Its my favorite. Every aniversary and birthday that we are in Las Vegas we come here. Our aniversary is in two weeks and hopefully we will be there again. My absolute favorite restaurant ever. I love every bit of the old school feel. I love the salad with the creamy peppercorn dressing. We have brought friends with us and now its their favorite too. It is expensive, but worth every penny to me. Make sure to go hungry because with all the food you will get full.

What a gem of a place hidden in ol' 4Queens.  Easily the best restaurant in downtown.  The food was great and the service even better.  Females receive a rose.  Who does that anymore?  Everything comes with a custom salad made to order.  Steaks were great.

The ceiling were low--hey, it's called a cellar for a reason.  The room's filled with dark wood and cozy.

I also like this place because we were comped here often.  Yay!

By far the best service one can get at a restaurant. Hugo's likes to keep it real old school with its dim lighting and basement brick feel. The food was delicious and the in between desserts as well. A recommendation would be to make the salad a bit better by adding other options/dressings as the salad is like any other salad at fresh choice but without so many choices. Overall great company, service, care and most importantly amazing plates.
Great salad and rib eye.... One rose in a vase is very cheap for Hugo cellars standard

I brought my boyfriend here last night for his birthday. I was really disappointed as several friends and family members have raved about the place. 

We started with the bread basket which was quite dry. Next came the salad which was ok but nothing amazing. I did enjoy the gentleman who made it  

For our main course my boyfriend had the stuffed shrimp which was also very dry. We ordered a side of sauce but that didn't help much. I ordered the filet and shrimp au poivre which the best thing we had. It was good but I wouldn't say $58 good.  

The complimentary chocolate dipped fruit is the reason I'm giving them a 3. That was pretty amazing and the manager took my boyfriends shrimp off the bill. 

Don't really think I will ever make it back here.

Food was wonderful, tableside preparation of the "hot rock" and Caesar salads were great. Waiters were attentive and dressed better than most of the clientele. Hugo's is a great place for a romantic dinner- except when redneck loud ass uncouth slobs are taking a break from Wal-Mart and "gracing" us with their presence. Would have been 5 stars, but Hugo's really needs to make more of an effort to control the loud white trash that periodically infiltrate an otherwise great local dining establishment.

This was our first time here and it was our 16th wedding anniversary!! I can't say enough about how amazing our experience was!!! My filet was huge and perfectly cooked to order at M-MW and they didn't butterfly it,  nailed it!!!!
The service was above and beyond and that salad cart!!!!! YUM!!! We are regulars now!!!!!! The price per plate was comparable with other high end restaurants, but you get MORE than enough food!!! We were stuffed!!!!!!
Thank Hugo's Cellar we look forward to coming back!!

This a very nice restaurant in downtown. I had dinner the day after dinning at Eiffel restaurant. It does not have a view but has everything else you may look in a nice restaurant. It feels very intimate and dinner was delicious. The cocktails are probably the best I had in Vegas and Dean the bartender is awesome. We met a couple at the bar that has been coming to this place for the past 6 years or so. That tells you a lot about a place. Do yourself a big favor and visit this restaurant, may be your best dinner in Las Vegas.

I had such a wonderful time at Hugo's. My boyfriend selected this place for my birthday dinner and he hit it out of the park!

I received a lovely long-stemmed rose when we walked in.
Table side salad preparation was superb.
The sorbet palate cleanser is a nice touch.
Entrees were delicious.
I also really loved the fact that chocolate-dipped fruit was included, for dessert.  The other desserts presented to us looked delicious as well, but we were just too full to eat more.

We left Hugo's full and happy. Great food, impeccable service, and a very intimate feel/setting. We'll definitely be back soon.

Heard great thing about this place, so we decided to book this place for a birthday dinner. When everything were done, we wished that we shouldn't gave gone to it in the first place. Even though the service and atmosphere were great, the food was so disappointing, especially at about 50 bucks each for the main entree.

The rack of lamb was under seared, under cooked, and under seasoned. The result was a very gaming smell dish which I couldn't even finish. Well, the upside was the mash potato that came with the lamb was good ... LOL

My friend's fish entree was average and nothing special, which I wouldn't have b***** about it if it didn't cost 49 bucks for it.

Maybe it was a bad night for them, but these kinda of food quality probably won't get my second visit.

Just took another trip out to Vegas with my parents - and of course we ate at Hugo's 3 of our 4 nights!  The food is just out of this world.  The salad made at the table is awesome, the dinner is awesome, the bananas foster is awesome!  But if you are there Thursday - Monday, ask for RASHARD, he is by far the best.  He will make your experience memorable! :)

I love the atmosphere and the ambience first of all. I love the fact that all of the ladies get a long stemmed red rose. It makes you feel so special, and just like a woman.  I think any woman would feel special if her significant other took her here for dinner. The food is spectacular.  Last night we had the spinach artichoke dip, which was so divine. Our salads were made fresh table side. We all got to choose our own toppings and our dressing. I had the peppercorn dressing and it was delicious. I chose queens lobster for my dinner. It was medallions of lobster and a delicious sauce with sun-dried tomatoes. I really enjoyed it. It came with vegetables, too. The portions are quite large. Between our courses, we were given sorbet on a tiny cone. It was a delightful touch to clean your palate. I also want to note that they serve chocolate covered strawberries, figs and apricots with fresh whipped cream for dessert. We also ordered crème brûlée and chocolate mousse and everything was absolutely delicious. We truly enjoyed everything about this place and would give it 10 stars if we could!

This place is classic, the food is great. The service is horrible, hence why it's getting 2 stars from me. I believe service to be a critical component of the dining experience. 

The manager is extremely rude and not at all accommodating. I tried to organize a dinner party for about 30 people here, the manager told me that he was unwilling to accommodate a party of our size during dinner. He said we could come at 5:30 or at 9 because our party would take up too much space and he had other patrons to think about. Guess what manager, you just turned 30 people guaranteed to order 30 dinners... Idiot. 

I've never been spoken to so rudely. I'll never come here again. There are several steakhouse in the Las Vegas area, no need to come to this one and be treated like crap.

This could not have been a better experience. Service was impeccable. We were celebrating my niece's 21st birthday and this place was perfect. Kind of an "old school" classic steak house...my sister was ecstatic to find beef Wellington on the menu. We also loved the table side salad service and the chocolate dipped fruits that were included.  Just wish we had room for the banana foster! Or flambé...steaks and prime rib were perfect. The only thing I didn't love was the asparagus...I like mine with some crisp too it and it was a tad on the mushy overcooked side. We will definitely be back next time we are in vegas. My brother in law talked about it for DAYS.

Love love love this place! I never come to Las Vegas without coming here!
It's old a school vegas steakhouse with top notch service!
Atmosphere is amazing and very old school Vegas vibe. 
The food is fantastic and the steaks are some of the best I've ever had!
5 stars all around!

So I returned a year later.   
Steak is still good.  Salad is still the bomb.  I had the single lobster tail this time.  Perfection. 

Thanks Hugo's.

I was really excited to finally get a chance to try this old school gem that I had heard so many great things about.  I took my friend here for his birthday and we just loved it.  Unfortunately, we were both coming from the Yelp event at Ellis Island and had eaten a little (a LOT) so we weren't as hungry as we should've been.  However, we both got the tableside salad, which was great, and an entrée. I ordered the Filet de Beouf Atlantis which is a filet mignon wrapped in bacon served Oscar style (with crab).  It was really good, but I can't say it was blow-me-away delicious.  The quality of the steak is just not comparable to other steakhouses on the Strip.  

My friend ordered the prime rib, and it too was delicious, but there seemed to be a lot of fat on it.  The flavor was great though and it was juicy and tender.  

The service was on-point.  It was a Wednesday night so it was pretty slow.  The servers were very attentive and nice.  The sommelier came over and took our wine order and they were out of the wine we ordered but he suggested something else in its place that ended up tasting amazing.  

The restaurant is very dark and romantic and definitely has that old-Vegas feel. Though I've had better steak, this was a unique dining experience and we really enjoyed it.  You can get a voucher from Tix4Tonight (not the one IN 4 Queens, but any other store) and get 25% off your entire check including alcohol. Can't beat that!
OG "gourmet" room in Downtown Las Vegas. Favorite of residents and old-school gamblers. The only part of 4Q worth visiting. Gamble at the Golden Nugget or a Boyd property if you have to go downtown.

Make sure you make reservations and you're there on time as they are known to give them up. This is really a gem in downtown Las vegas which can run with the rest of the big guys on the strip. The ladys get roses when they first arrive. ..ahhhh...

Their salad cart contains the freshest of ingredients which comes with the meal. Their dressings are just tasty and they make it in front of you :) Their steaks are cooked to ordered, the quality of the food is good. Their sides make me smile, I think this is much more of a group place than romantic although its setup for romance it offers the classic old'school vegas vibe for a good group of people. 

I want to give it a 3.5 but we're going with a four here because Rae really likes it. :)

When I asked my craps dealer where he takes HIS wife for an anniversary dinner in Las Vegas, he didn't hesitate to suggest Hugo's Cellar!  After our dinner experience last night, I can see why!
     Incredible service; from the salad prepared at table-side to the help with the wine list by our sommelier made the evening special.
     The seafood was extraordinary!  The seafood sampler appetizer we shared had large beautiful shrimp, plump lobster medallions and king crab leg meat that was very fresh and tasty.  My ode had the sea bass entrée and loved it!  But the best was my prime rib steak.  Hands down, the BEST prime rib I've ever had - perfectly cooked, tasty and almost fork-tender! Outstanding!
     The after dinner sweet of chocolate-dipped strawberries, apricots and figs served with homemade whipped cream for dipping was the perfect way to end a perfect meal!  
     Next time we are in Las Vegas, we will make time to come here again for dinner!
Great mix on the menu.  Never really thought of the salad being a big part of the meal, but will always look forward to the salad at Hugo's.

Amazing food!!  Located at the Four Queens Hotel in Downtown Las Vegas.  Our friends took my husband and I to this wonderful place and we were not disappointed.  It has an old Las Vegas feel, you think that you are back in the 1950's.  You will have a waiter, a server, and a wine sommelier.  Awesome. 

Come and enjoy this delicious meal.

Old School and fantastic.  

Top notch service and even better food.  Great atmosphere to enjoy a delightful steak dinner.  The mashed potatoes are amazing, steak was cooked to perfection.  I would put this on your to do list for ever trip to Vegas. 

Enjoying dinner at Hugo's then walking up Fremont St. is a tradition for the wife and myself.

Delicious! Blast from the past...loved the table side salad bar...sommelier was very friendly ...food was amazing ...the filet melted in my mouth...definitely not what I was expecting from the 4 queens
Beautiful Mahi, garlic mashed potatoes were fabulous, tableside salad wonderful, bartender is matched by none.  This is a gem in downtown with a classy, old world vibe to celebrate with Friends.

Absolutely positively amazing!  Spent New Years Eve on Fremont Street and ate here and it was simply excellent!  Four of us ate and each meal was a work of art masterfully crafted!  The service was suburb as well, which makes a perfect combo, thank you Richard!  I highly recommend Hugo's.

"Great Old Style Vegas Experience"


Walk down a short flight of stairs from the worn, dated 4 Queens casino, and enter another world. Instantly, you're in the restaurant frequented by celebrities of decades ago... Frank, Dean, Sammy, and others. If I have any criticism of the appearance / ambience... it is a little too dark... but, that's Old Vegas. The Maitre'D and wait staff are all in Tuxedos. Women guests are presented with a long stemmed red rose upon arrival.
Service is old school, and impeccable, from sommelier, to captain, to waiter, to busboy. Salad is prepared individually tableside, intermezzo (small lemon sorbet cones), and shared dessert tray are all included with the price of the entrée. Was it the best meal I ever had...NO... but maybe in the top 20%. The food is good, not great, but the overall experience is worth the visit.

You go here for the old Vegas experience. You get advice from real experienced sommelier, and included in your meal is a table side salad, and small dessert that includes two chocolate covered strawberries, figs, and apricots. Also, they come often to fill your water and check on you. As you  come in women are handed a rose, it's really sweet. 5 stars for service and 4 stars for food.

Article interviewing Hugo's sommelier. http://m.reviewjournal.com/business/wines-wit-and-wisdom-hugos-cellar-sommelier

Don't let the location of Old Las Vegas fool you, this place rocks!  On arrival, I was given a rose. It is a very romatic setting and the decor is old school Vegas, which I love. The drinks were stiff and service was great! Victor rolled the salad cart over and prepared a custom salad, which I was sad I had to stop eating so I wouldnt be full for the main course. The entrees were of generous porportions. My honey's piece of delicous salmon was huge! At the end of the meal, they brought complimentary chocolate dipped strawberries and other fruit with whipped cream. As I was sitting there, I was already planning the next special occassion/excuse so we can enjoy an awesome meal there.

I want to make sweet, sweet love to Hugo Cellar. I mean, I was given a rose when I walked in the door AND a custom salad was made for each person in my group, in front of us, at the table. That calls for some major lovin'. 

This place is old school classy and I loved it. Ignore the fact that it's in the Four Queens and GO, now. (If you have some cash to drop, that is...) It looks like a Cellar that your Dad or Grandpa might frequent, all brick and leather chairs and green glass chandeliers. But Oh, the food. Oh yes. And the wine! They have an on-site sommelier and he has personality to spare. Loved him. 

Starts out with a salad that is custom made off a cart for you at your table. I recommend the Orange Vinaigrette, it was blow-your-mind good. I ate my whole salad, even though I knew a ton more food was coming, it was that amazing. And you can have it made really simple, or do like my guy did and get the works...which includes anchovies, hearts of palm, pine nuts, red onion, etc. Then you get a little mini raspberry sorbet to clear your palette. It worked! I had an amazing chicken and mushroom dish, but also know that the scallops and filet mignon come highly recommended by my foodie friends. After all of the moaning and giving each other bites of the deliciousness, you are treated to freaking chocolate dipped strawberries and figs with creme fraiche. (it's an all inclusive price.) 

My friends had been there before and raved about the Bananas Foster. Now I see why. This guy in a Tux stands at your table and makes an AMAZING Bananas Foster, we are talking flames rising and the whole shebang. So delectable, I had said I would have a bite but ended up having like 5. And I double licked the spoon. 

If you are looking for a true experience type restaurant, this is your place. I truly enjoyed myself here and will definitely go again. 

I want to go to there!

Loved everything about this place. A bet pricey, but fuck it it's Vegas right? The table side salad is awesome. They make it to your liking right there in front of you. The ribye was perfection. Would definitely go back.

Party of 5 at 6PM on a Monday; it was good for old school steak on Fremont. The lobster bisque gets high points for being served hot. It was delicious and its a very generous serving. Salad is cold and large, but overly dressed and the choices of dressings are too limited (with the cesear not really an option for most people since it reeks of anchovies). Don't spend your money on the king crab legs - unimpressive and not worth it. Stick to the steak; filet is excellent as was the beef wellington. Solid player in a classic Fremont casino. Its nice that it is still around and its charm hasn't faded too much. Whether they can stand up to a Ruth's Chris or modern steakhouse.. no. But its all about the tradition here. Service was good - although a bit distracted for being so early in the evening.

We are from New Jersey and have been going to Hugo,s for many years. The atmosphere is lovely. We have never had a problem with the service. Our meals have always been over the top. We recommend this establishment to anyone wanting to experience the real old time classy Vegas.

I'm giving Hugo's an extra star for the wait staff. Victor and Vincent double teamed us and blew our socks off. 
The food was just ok... 
I had the fillet and while it was big it wasn't one of the best fillets I've ever had. It just lacked a bit of character. There was no wow factor I guess. 
The mashed potato's are the best I've ever had. They could be radioactive and I would still eat them by the truckload. 
My wife had the veal and it was a edible, but nothing she would order again. 
The salads are cool, the service great, and the wine list was stout. If your downtown check it out, but I'm not sure I would take the $20 cab ride to and from from the strip just to eat here.

One of my favorite steakhouses in Las Vegas! Hugo's has been here for such a long time. Ladies get a red rose. The butter is in a shape of a rose. The steaks and appetizers are very good. I was very happy and come back as often as I can.

My Husband and I celebrated our 3rd Wedding Anniversary at Hugo's cellar.The yelp reviews and photos made us want to experience the ambiance,fine menu,and personal tableside service.Our expectations were met and superseded what we imagined!The 16 oz Rib eye with a split of king crab was mouth watering,and our appetizer(Crab~cakes)were served hot,not warm which made a big impression on me liking them!The memorable personal touches were the Champagne we ordered,the salads numerous toppings,the polite,professional waiter,(Raachard)his busboys,and the incredible Kona coffee brewing for us both,along with Bananas foster being prepared made for a delicious desert,they even gave us a piece of complimentary chocolate Lava cake for our Anniversary and Chocolate dipped strawberries!We were very impressed and the best way to describe our evening was "We were planning our next visit before we had even finished our meal!!"The long single stemmed red rose was very much appreciated when the host seated us.The only thing I would say bothered me was that they do not have a dress code,it's disappointing to see others seated around you arrive in shorts and pool thongs when you want a 5 star experience,they should have a dress code or seat those not properly dressed in another section.

Loved it all the way around. Service was quick and attentive. The food was cooked perfectly. The price was fair. Be warned though, the Hugos cut prime rib is a huge serving!! I only finished half of it. My wife had the sun dried tomato chicken, and loved it! We'll definitely make this a regular place to eat when in Vegas.
Great atmosphere, service, and food! A bit pricier than your "Outbacks" and what not, but well worth the money. Advanced reservations is definitely recommended.

When folks come to Vegas I believe what they seek is an experience.   Whether it's a show, their hotel, the casino, people watching or the food.  Hugo's Cellar excels for a food experience!  The ambience is what I imagine was typical for old-school Vegas, a place for regulars with, ahem, "connections".  The wait staff is attentive and professional without being in the way.  Carlos is a fine waiter and Diego kept our water glasses full.  Then there was Victor.  At Hugo's they make each diner a salad to their specifications from a table side salad station.  Victor was the salad guy.  But he was so much more.  Victor was the story guy, and the "tell it like it was" guy, and the guy who embodied the ambience of Hugo's.  The name over the door read "Hugo's Cellar", but it could have easily read "Victor's Place".

Our party of 8 dined for close to 3 hours.  Mine and my wife's bill was around $170 for two entree and two martinis.  Expensive? You might think so.  You could think of it as comparable to two tickets to a Vegas show with a free steak meal.  I think of it as a Vegas experience and well worth it.

Hugo's Cellar was a amazing dinning exsperiance 
Great service, Great wine list, Good cocktails, and amazing food!
Table side service was awesome - the table side Hugo's House salad was awesome and the table side Bananas Fosters was great to watch being made but even better to eat.
I highly recommand you take your best gal or guy to Hugo's Cellar - you will have a great time and a awesome meal 
Oh all the ladies get a beautiful long stem rose :-)
You will not go wrong with this restaurant!

We've been going to Hugo's almost every year for our anniversary (17 years).  Victor was awesome as always and is THE best waiter in Vegas, bar none.  John the sommelier is always great with the wine!  See ya next year Hugos!

There is probably no place better known by the locals here in Vegas then the city staple of Hugo's Cellar.  I could write all kinds of information about where, when, what, how to enjoy, find, experience this restaurant.  However, there are plenty of reviews for all that.  So my experience in a nutshell:

The traditional rose delivered promptly to my girlfriends' hand by the staff as we were seated.  The nice sommelier that retrieved the PInot Noir we shared as we paired our meat & fish.  A beauty of a seafood sampler or "plateau" arrived in perfect timing.  Wonderful Caesar salad prepared table side to our specifications.  Then the entrees; Veal Chop Natural for me; bone in.  Veal Oscar for the lady.  The food was tremendous, topped with fresh sorbet and Cherries Jubilee table side yet again.

Yup, so many words to describe how wonderful Hugo's was.  It's an experience, a little pricy.... However, I believe that in most cases you get what you pay for.  Most of the time as a serial restaurant patron I find myself staring at the check asking myself if the juice was worth the squeeze..... At Hugo's; I had some damn good juice.

Service and staff where excellent.  Salad and breads great.  But not the best seafood we have had.  Tuna was over cooked and had no flavor.  Scallops were average.  We were expecting way better with the reviews we saw.  Way over priced for the quality of seafood we received.  Definitely not on my list of places to visit again.

Growing up in the Santa Maria/AG area, I love a good steak. Hugo's Cellar is one of the best steak houses I have ever been to! It is in the basement of the old Four Queens casino in downtown Vegas, but do not underestimate the amazing food, service, ambiance, and overall experience you are in for at Hugo's Cellar! 

The salad is something to behold. They actually bring a cart to your table with about 20 different items and make it fresh for you at the table. The steaks are huge and I recommend always getting the smallest cut. The restaurant is pricey. We go here only for special occasions when in Vegas or if we win big! 

You can't go wrong with the Prime Rib or the Filet Mignon. I haven't ever tried a fish dish as the steaks are so delicious I can't being myself to try something new.

If you want the true old school Vegas experience I highly recommend Hugo's Cellar. Make sure to make reservations well in advance as this is a favorite restaurant with the locals.
Fantastic food and menu options. Staff is courteous and attentive. I like the prime rib and my bride enjoyed the filet with foie gras on top.

My wife and I generally go to Hugo's when we're in Las Vegas and have a special occasion to celebrate.  The food is good, and so is the service.  It's a bit overpriced, but we don't go there alot, so we can overlook that in favor of the ambiance and the little things like a rose for the female guests.  We like to go to Fremont Street even though we stay toward the south end of the strip.  Hugo's is worth the trip if your looking for a memorable dining experience.

We had very reliable food.  Nothing made us go wow.  Reminded us of eating on the cruise ship.  The salad that everyone talked about was a little lack luster.  Not many normal salad veggies (no cukes, olives, carrots, peppers) but the concept was great.  Food was presented in a timely manner.  The servers were very friendly.  There was little seasoning on the beef (I had an end cut of prime rib and my  husband the filet de beouf.)  Mashed potatoes, wild rice, and veggies were good.  Fruit platter was good.  Brought us a piece of cheesecake because it was our anniversary.  Very thoughtful.  Overall it was good...  Just not WOW.

We returned to Hugo's Cellar for my boyfriend's daughter's birthday and were VERY disappointed in their service!  This is the first time I have ever had bad service.  We sat for almost 25 minutes before we got offered anything to drink and then we had to flag down Greg, the gentleman who serves the salad, and ask him where our waiter was and if he could just take our order.  

Our waiter did not even bother to stop by until our food was brought out and even then he did not apologize about not helping us and just tried to drop the food off and run away.  Two of the steaks were cooked wrong, and of course one was the birthday girl's!  This is one of the only steakhouses in town that cooks steak the way my boyfriend and his daughter like it and she had never been to a nice steakhouse before and we really wanted her to experience what Hugo's usually offers.  They did offer to have the steaks fixed, but at this point we were all starving and wanted to eat together so they just kept them as they were.  

Then all the waiters sang happy birthday to a big group at the front.  Mind you, when I made the reservation I told the hostess that we were coming to celebrate a young girl's birthday and asked if there was anything they could do and I was told she would get dessert.  Her birthday was not even acknowledged at all through out the whole dinner, not even when we were offered dessert!  When this happened after we had watched another table get the full birthday treatment and his daughter felt kind of left out or not very special he got up and walked away from the table to so he did not get upset with the waiter.  When the waiter asked if there was a problem I told him we are here for her birthday and wanted her to experience what we usually experience when we dine here and it has been anything but pleasant.  He didn't even say sorry and just walked away!!!  

In the meantime, three other tables that were in our waiter's area were being totally ignored and one of them had been seated before us and got their food long after us.  I don't know if this waiter was new or what his deal was.  But his rude manners and lack of concern for his customers has made my boyfriend not ever want to return again, which makes me very sad as this is my favorite steakhouse!  I'm very disappointed in the service and how we were treated.  The food is still wonderful as ever, but for the price I can go anywhere else in town, even Olive Garden, and get better service than we got.

My husband and I found Hugo's Cellar thanks to yelp.  We were very hungry and walked in with no reservations.  We had a 15 minute wait and it was well worth it.  The prices were high but we were ready to pay for the experience.  All meals included bottle water, a delicious salad make table side, and chocolate covered strawberries.  Chocolate covered dates and apricots were also offered but we were not interested.

My husband had the 10 oz filet and it was cooked to perfection.  I had the beef wellington, which I have always wanted to try.  Both dishes were amazing and both steaks seemed much bigger than 10 oz.  

I've tried and tried to find a problem with the meal.  Maybe too much salad dressing?  The meal was amazing and we cannot wait to get back to Vegas to eat here again.

A touch of old Vegas. Tuxedo dressed staff, a rose for every woman, table side salad and an awesome martini, what more could you want? It is a bit pricy but for downtown or the strip it's priced accordingly. Just wish other patrons would dress accordingly.

Great experience.  Celebrated my wife's birthday and she was properly appreciative.  One of my top 3 dining experiences  in the U.S.- atmosphere, service and food were first rate.  I like Scoma's in San Francisco, Commander's Palace in New Orleans and Hugo's Cellar in Las Vegas.  Will go again when next in Vegas.

my friends and I visited downtown Las Vegas. We decided to eat at Hugos. Never been, but heard decent things. WOW..we were blown away by the service that we received. Manager Rich is the nicest guy. class act all the way. We also had show reservations, and informed Rich. He immediately went into action, told the waiters to make sure we were out before show time. Food was great, steaks to die for!!! Better than anything we had on the strip, and it wasn't ala carte. finished off nicely with chocolate covered fruits. a perfect meal, incredible service and the nicest people. We will be back!

Hugo's Cellar deserves a "10" for both service and food (Hugo's chicken and sea bass).  We celebrated our 20th anniversary there, and everyone was very welcoming and professional.  We loved the vintage decor.  The sommelier was right on target, and did not attempt to oversell us in any way.  The garlic mashed potatoes were heavenly.  Can't wait to return for my birthday celebration, and I wouldn't even consider going anywhere else for a special occasion.

food was good and service was great.  I guess my only beef with it is that Hugo's is very "Old Vegas".  I am only 21, I am more interested in hip and trendy restaurants.  Not a sit down, 5 star time capsule.  I will come back but give me a few more years to mature like a fine wine

I have to give this amazing steakhouse 5 stars. I decided to take my boyfriend out for dinner to celebrate his birthday & we chose this place which has been in Vegas for 37 years (!) located in the Four Queens casino downtown. 

Upon being seated, the host gives every female a single, long-stem perfect red rose which you can place in an individual case on your table. 

We ordered the Hugo's Hot Rock Specialty for Two ($36) as an appetizer in which the server brings out a 500 degree sizzling slab of granite. He then cooks chicken, filet, ahi, and shrimp on it & leaves it on your table. It was delicious. 

For the main courses, we ordered the Filet de Boeuf- Atlantis ($65) and the rack of lamb ($56). 

The Atlantis is a gigantic, thick filet wrapped in bacon & served over lump crab meat with béarnaise sauce. It comes with sautéed mushrooms, mashed potatoes, green & white asparagus (there's white asparagus??) and two crab claws. 

The rack of lamb is marinated in olive oil, garlic & Rosemary & served with an Indonesian style sauce. 

The filet was tender & delicious. I ordered mine with a bleu cheese crust ($3) which I try to get whenever I eat steak. The lamb was also very good. 

All entrees come with bread, table-side salads (try the honey-orange-walnut vinaigrette!) which is the best salad I've ever had, and a sorbet to cleanse your palette before the main course. You also get chocolate dipped strawberries with house-made whipped cream, white chocolate dipped baby figs, and chocolate dipped dried apricots. 

Service was good, and for the price, you get a lot of food. We'll definitely be coming back here.
Expect to spend $100 pp for full course dinner and drinks, but well worth it. You will leave full unlike restaurants on the strip which cost just as much. Service and food quality are unparalleled.

I have been to Hugo's four times. This is one of the best secrets in Las Vegas just wish it was on the main strip. If you ever wanted 5 star service this is the place. I have only had a couple issues with food but for the most part they are aces in my book. I love the table side salad preparation but be sure to stay away from the pine nuts. Love the roses and chocolates. Be sure to make a reservation and always come here on a winning night.

Classic Vegas all the way!

We've been here a few times and love the older establishments that are still around. It's too bad more & more of them keep disappearing because the way things used to be in this town was awesome! Wish I could have really experienced it! 

Hugo's is tucked away & it feels very intimate. When you walk in it really feels like you're stepping back in time. The host is always so nice and all ladies are given a long stem red rose. I have to give it to them because this is such a lovely touch & the experience starts...

This place is dark & romantic with lots of masculine touches all around like the art & dominant blue colors. 

The food is great! The value is great as well. Meals include everything so prepare to be stuffed. 

We ordered: Beef Wellington & raspberry chicken and both were very decadent. The raspberry chicken is unreal! You get perfectly cooked veggies & a starch (in my opinion the garlic mash is the best). One of the highlights of your meal will be the customized table side salad service. You get to pick all your toppings & the honey-orange-walnut dressing is divine! The lemon sorbet that comes over to cleanse the tastebuds was great & then let's not forget about the complimentary dessert. Chocolate covered apricot, figs & strawberries! And fresh whipped cream! You will love all this indulging! 

My man decided to also get the shrimp cocktail which isn't worth the price tag & several drinks which were reasonably priced. 

We had a lovely meal & it felt like the days of the Rat Pack.

Hugo's Cellar is still the premier downtown classic dining den where continental cuisine is served, and table-side service is the norm rather than the exception.  Ladies still receive a long-stemmed rose, a palate cleanser is offered just before entrees are served, and complimentary chocolate-covered fruits are bestowed in abundance at meal's end.  All I missed was French Onion Soup Gratinee.  Alas, it is not served here.

To begin at the beginning, my party of four enjoyed Cheese-Toasted Lavosh and Sourdough Rolls with rosettes of butter, before some of us shared a very good Shrimp Cocktail.  But only 3 shrimps were presented for $16, along with a nice traditional Cocktail Sauce and a Thousand Island type dressing.  These were followed by an excellent complex salad prepared with a choice of Caesar, Peppercorn, or Honey Raspberry Orange Walnut Vinaigrette Dressing.  I recommend the latter, which was light, flavorful, and interesting with its different fruity notes.  A diner has 20 ingredients from which to pick, including Romaine lettuce, pine nuts, hearts of palm, tomatoes, Parmesan Cheese, shrimp, mushrooms, croutons, anchovies, bell pepper, red onions, and egg.   

An Intermezzo of Lemon Sorbet was a refreshing change of pace before we launched into our entrees.  I had an excellent, perfectly cooked medium-rare Fillet Atlantis, which is similar to Filet Oscar, but here the Filet Mignon is surrounded by Crab Claws.  Except the claws were ice cold on arrival.  An offer to flash heat my entree was accepted, and it yielded beneficial results.  On return the crab meat was hot, and the smooth Bearnaise Sauce tasted great.  Mixed vegetables on the plate, including cooked tomatoes, were good, and Boiled Parsley Red Potatoes and mushrooms were very good.  But, based on the little crab provided, I didn't feel it was really worth the additional cost.

While it is not necessary to purchase a dessert, a pyramid of Caramel Chocolate Mousse with sweet Whipped Cream was really luscious.  But it resulted in a few Chocolate-Covered Figs and Strawberries being left behind on their plate.

It is fairly dark inside (It is a cellar, after all!), and the ambiance is romantic.  Service was formal, attentive, and professional.  Food is pricey, but the cost of entrees is discounted 20% for each diner who is age 55 or over and presents a Four Queens Club 55 player's card.  Thus, a Fillet Atlantis that is normally sold for $60.00 is reduced to $48.00 for young seniors.

4-1/2 stars overall, and still very much downtown Vegas's diamond in the rough!

Wow! Wow! to the service.  Wow! to the food.  Wow! to the ambiance.  Wow! to the prices.  

Walking through "Freakmont" Street, pass through the smoke filled casino of the four queens hotel and descend into another world.

The staff of Hugos remember days gone past and bring them alive in the dining experience.  From the personal attention of the wait team to the very knowledgeable, yet un-pretentious sommelier, this was just an amazing meal.  

Your meal includes (not a small) salad, a very generous entree, vegies and starch.  

The food was the best we'd had the entire trip and then some.  The table prepared salad set the stage.  The final coffee service with whipped cream and chocolate sticks put the perfect cap on it.  

By no means a "cheap" meal, dinner for six of us at Hugos was expensive...but worth it. 

We left completely stuffed, with five doggie bags, and very dumb smiles on our faces.

ps.  Like the Coq D'or room at the Drake in Chicago, they know how to make a martini...and small it is not.  :)

Hugo's is an Excellent place to take your wife, significant other or even a business partner to dinner. They prepare your salad for you in front of you and give Roses to the women upon entry! It was viewed as a 4.5 but I give it a 5 for everyone's service and kindness. Food was excellent in my opinion! I had the Cellar cut prime rib and it was huge. Could not finish it.

Very good food. Very good service. Very high prices to the point of the cost being higher than what you get. Only go here if you have been a winner gambling and your looking for a way to blow your winnings.

This place is amazing. Excellent food, incredible service, and a great atmosphere. 

I was actually worried when we walked into the cheesy hotel that this restaurant is located in, but all fears were tossed out the window when a red rose was given to every woman in our group. They bring the salad cart over to the table so that they can make it right in front of you. Raspberry sorbet is served between dishes to cleanse the palate. 

This restaurant is in a class of it's own.

SO much fun. Old School Vegas all the way. Roses at entrance for the ladies. Went here for Valentines day and it was very nice.
One of the few places where you get a complete meal at an expensive steak house. LOVE LOVE LOVE the salad. I was so full I took 95% of my meal with me. Not cheap but what steak house is?

Love this place.  Its so intimate and romantic.  Great date spot. The wine guy is amazing with pairing.  Every entree I have every tried there is spot on. I love the table side salad the dressing is something I crave.

This place is great old school Las Vegas. The casino itself leaves a lot to be desired, but the restaurant is great. You go down the stairs descend into a totally different world from the casino above. The brick walls and dark intimate feel of the restaurant are in total contrast to what is going on above you. Once downstairs, you are greeted by the manager as soon as you arrive and shown to your table.

The waiters here all wear tuxedos and it gives the restaurant a real elegant feel. We had no less than 3 waiters during our dinner. All were very professional and delivered great service. We did not have any issues during our meal.

We did not order any appetizers because they already give you so much food included with your meal. For starters, they bring you a bread basket with assorted breads in it. All were very good and tasty. We very much enjoyed the table side salad. It was terrific. Presentation was nice and they have so many ingredients to choose from. All items were fresh and it made for a great salad. 

They brought us out a little raspberry sorbet cone before our entree as a pallet cleanser. It was a nice touch and did what it was supposed to do. My entree tasted fantastic after eating this tart little treat.

For entree I had the 16oz prime rib. It was very good. Nice and juicy and full of flavor. Served with great horseradish sauce, vegetables and garlic whipped potatoes it was a very nice dish. My wife had the chicken champignon which was very good as well. Loaded with mushrooms and served with a tasty sauce it was good.

After your meal, you are brought a plate of chocolate covered strawberries, apricots and figs with a dip. This was a great touch to a wonderful meal. We were both full from our dishes but ate these little gems anyway. A lot of restaurants could learn something about customer service and service from Hugo's Cellar. 
Our whole dining experience from start to finish was great. I will definitely be returning here next time in Vegas for another wonderful meal.

First time at Hugo's Cellar, stayed at the Four Queens ...it was highly recommended by my mother and her husband so i had to try it. Went there Saturday 15th and I'm embarrassed to say we missed our reservation which I made a week in advance but thankfully we tried and were welcomed in and there was a booth for us which I loved, plus a rose for me!  My boyfriend and I were celebrating both our birthdays...we both ordered the Rib Eye steak with garlic mashed potatoes and having our salad made table side was GREAT!  I have to be honest and say we BOTH thought we had the BEST steak EVER!  The miniature raspberry sorbet cone they give you after your salad to cleanse your pallet was such a surprise as well as the chocolate covered strawberries and fig and date too!  I'm definitely coming back...EXCELLENT!

Came here for our Anniversary last night and i will not be coming back. It was my first time at hugo's cellar and unfortunately it was my last time too.  I noted when I made the reservations that we were celebrating our anniversary and it was not acknowledged at all by our servers, the sommelier did say happy anniversary after we said we were celebrating.  

I was so excited to try hugo's cellar and I'm sad that it was such a disappointment.  We got there early for our reservation so we could go to a show.  We got seated right away, got our drink orders taken after a few minutes and didn't see either of our servers for almost 30 minutes.  Nobody even acknowledged that we were just sitting there waiting for our server.  

My boyfriend asked an employee about getting our order taken, they didn't know who was our server, he came back to the table and we waited like another 10 minutes for one of our servers to come to the table.  We told him that we wanted to order an appetizer but we were running late now since we had waited for so long.  He didn't even apologize for leaving us sitting there for over 30 minutes.  We had to skip the appetizer and order the main course.   We got the included tableside salad but I felt like I had to rush while eating it.

 I work as a server and am not unreasonable but I expect good service, even an apology for making us wait and an acknowledgement of our anniversary would have been nice.

I took my husband here for a bday one year about 2 years back. i never remembered to write a review for it, but i still remember it like yesterday! this place is wonderful, great food, great romantic ambiance, great staff from the door to the floor! this place is an old school cellar with a nice drink and dinner menu. they serve salad first on a cart in front of your table, then bring out some kind of sorbet before your dinner, after dinner they serve different chocolate covered fruits and figs! you will definitely leave FULL & SATISFIED with a bag in hand of the rest of your food! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! DEFINITELY RETURNING! :) LADIES GET A ROSE WHEN YOU WALK IN AND THEY PUT IT IN A VASE AT YOUR TABLE AND PACK IT TO TAKE HOME. HAPPY COUPLES DATE NIGHT :)

Service is 2nd to none. Food is fantastic.  What more is there to say.  Tho Hugo's Chicken is fantastic. The sauce was perfect for this dish and the salad was great.  I had the Walnut Honey dressing. Very tasty.

My wife and I dined at Hugo's Cellar on a Saturday night. I made my reservation the Friday morning before through the Open Table phone app.
