We came down the stairway entry to Hugo's to see a dimly lit and beautifully set up lounge area. We approached the host to let him know we had reservations at 9pm, it was only 7pm, but we were hungry and figured what would it hurt to ask. 

The host let us know that he would get a table for us right away, it would just be about 15 and we could sit at the bar and have a drink while we waited, so we did. 

Just as we finished our Jameson and Ginger Ales, the host came over to let us know our table was ready whenever we'd like to sit down. We followed him over to the host area, were he handed my wife a month stemmed red rose (that all ladies are offered). 

(In an effort to avoid tl;dr, I'll cut small details.)

Our waiter, Dave, explained in detail everything that we would receive with our meal then gave us a minute to decide. Some fresh bread arrived, Dave returned and we chose. I went with the 16oz slow roasted prime rib and my wife chose the filet and shrimp prawns. 

Our table side salad service arrived, I went with their signature vinaigrette and my wife, the Caesar. The vinaigrette was absolutely wonderful, wasn't expecting to enjoy it as much as I did. An orange sweet twist that went very well with the fixings I chose for the salad (which was pretty much everything). My wife's Caesar was good, but not great. Nothing to complain about, have just had much better is all. 

Our sorbets came next in order to clean our pallet before dinner. We got another round of drinks, finished our sorbets and relaxed while waiting for our entrees. 

When our meals arrived they looked beautiful, prime rib was a perfect reddish pink for my medium rare and my wife's filet and shrimp was much larger then we expected. 

One tip, get the garlic mashed potatoes as my red potatoes were nothing special and I need to salt them. 

Hugo's was amazing, beautiful, intimate restaurant with a wonderful buzz. Service was incredible and on its game. Food was also wonderful. 

I would have given Hugo's Cellar 5 stars but here's why I didn't; my wife and I both had to season our meats. I expected the prime to be so amazing I wouldn't need to reach for the salt, unfortunately I did. Prime rib was definitely not seasoned properly as it came out without much flavor. After some salt and pepper it was incredible. 

Overall Hugo's Cellar is an excellent steakhouse experience without the added price of ala-carte. With definitely return and recommend.

This is a must stop in Vegas. It's an old school Steak House/Vegas Super club with amazing food and excellent staff. Loves our waiter Rashand. He connected with us in a personal level and was completely unpretentious and just an overall nice 'kid.'  My sister had the filet & shrimp and I had the Beef Wellington. All amazing. Make sure you go hungry and make reservations. Excellent raspberry lemon drop martini too. Great date place too

Yes, the food is THAT good. Yes, the special touches such as free dessert and a rose are lovely. The tableside salad is spectacular. But the part that amazes me is the quality of service. It is flawless.

The overall experience was amazing. The host was very polite and accommodating. We got the perfect booth in the back corner. Very romantic setting. When you first walk in all ladies are greeted with a beautiful, long stem red rose. Our waiter was very friendly and knowledgeable of everything on the menu. Our orders came out perfectly. Everything was timed very well so as not to over crowd the table or defer interest. Sommelier was very helpful and informative of the wine list and pairings. Our steaks were cooked actually to our request. Dessert was exceptional. Mascarpone cake and complimentary chocolate dipped fruit plate. I will definitely be coming back. Thank you for the great experience.

Excellant food and service. I highly recommend for a special date. The service is superb with some waiters working there more than 10 years. They first give you a rose for the lady. Then after ordering they mix a custom salad right in front of you. After your salad a little sorbet to change your palette before your main course. We got the Filet Beouf and the Veal Oscar. Both were cook to perfection!

This is definitely a place to go for a romantic date or to celebrate a special occasion. The instant you walk down the steps the atmosphere and ambiance changes to elegance and peacefulness. The amazing service starts with the hostess and continues all the way through the end of the meal. The waiter and his team are extremely attentive to everything that's happening at your table. The rose that you get is pretty much a perfect rose, long stemmed, bloomed, flawless color, and smells great. 

The dishes are a bit pricey but I want to say they give you a story along with the food. Everything that comes out is perfectly timed during the course of your meal and is done to enhance the food. I would say this place gives you more than a meal, you also get an uniquely memorable experience.

The banana's fosters was so good! and they make it fresh in front of you. I would recommend saving room for this! I had the beef wellington, even though it's my second time having it, it was pretty amazing. I ordered a straight up Caesar's salad, I don't know what it was...but I couldn't stop eating it even though I got a little extra. Maybe it was the freshness of everything, the dressing, or the crispy croutons I just couldn't stop eating it. For appetizers, we had crab cakes and the hot rocks. You can taste the freshness in the crab cakes from the first bite and gets even better with the sauce. If you happen to go into Hugo's after someone orders the hot rocks, you'll want to order it too. It smells delicious and it fills up the whole 
restaurant. It's perfect for a date and adds to that experience.

So when it comes to fancy dinners and fancy restaurants and all that jazz, I'm a newb.  I have very little experience eating at fancy steakhouses and fancy restaurants, though 2011 seems to be changing all of that.  Sometimes...perhaps in an optimistic perspective, change IS a good thing! =)  

So when I went to Vegas to meet up with my bf and his family, along with the soon to be bride & groom, our celebration dinner was held here, an old school steak house located in downtown Las Vegas in the Four Queen's Hotel & Casino.  It's downstairs from the casino, and it's "like" you're in a cellar. Cool points, yes.  When you step inside you already feel the old school lady & gentlemen-like vibe.  The ladies are greeted by the hostess with red long stem roses, WOW!  Takin' it back to the old school when chivalry was common and ladies wore dresses everyday.  Very cool.  

Our large party was comfortably seated in the back in a room with a large table, a bit secluded from the rest of the customers but not too much where we felt completely alone.  You can tell that this restaurant pays attention to all the little details.  
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VG0nWxGsPixYLsyi49gyxQ?select=gAM4ACYEhIx06gGnZ2dieg 
Gorgeous butter, looks like real roses.  I had to snap a picture before the guys dug into their bread and lavosh!

The menu here is pretty too, http://hugoscellar.com/files/menu.pdf , what I liked about this steakhouse was that they included the prices for each meal.  AND, if you read carefully, the meals COME with sides.  Unlike other fancy restaurants where you have to order your starch and your veggies, it's all included on your plate and in the price.  Even the side table service salad, which was incredibly delicious, is included.  My boyfriend and I tried the orange walnut dressing, which is more of a vinaigrette, and it was AMAZING! Toppings were extensive to, he goes around asking what you want.   And I give props to him, there were 13 of us I think!!

Our servers were great, consistent in their service, and were patient while they took our orders.  We munched on the bread & lavosh and a bunch of us shared this lovely appetizer :  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VG0nWxGsPixYLsyi49gyxQ?select=2tIJIqMtkeY_nKVA-CQbSw
I've never had it baked or made like this, and I enjoyed it very much.  Now this is when I got confused---  my lack of experience in fancy restaurants will do this to me --- they brought out these: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VG0nWxGsPixYLsyi49gyxQ?select=uw_zJGr1XcaAgm0PinftyA 
"Why are they giving  us dessert before our meal? " Confused look but hey that looks yummy...  Come to find out, they're palette cleansers--- Wow spiffy!  It tasted like raspberry sherbert and it did its job pleasantly.  Cuz my main meal was scrumptious.http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VG0nWxGsPixYLsyi49gyxQ?select=6GeGY9m4Z4N4Idq5KqtREQ

most of the guys ordered prime ribs:

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VG0nWxGsPixYLsyi49gyxQ?select=w5lMYhy-RCtaiwM0dSVLCg
all around the table everyone enjoyed their meals.  The meat was good and the sides were just enough to complement the hunk of meat we all had.  
Now, there are choices of great desserts here, they're even on a cart for every one to see when you walk in.  But, the meal also comes with this: 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VG0nWxGsPixYLsyi49gyxQ?select=0nuarmXcKjJsZOBQNx-FlQ

which to me, was just enough to satisfy my sweet tooth that starts aching for some form of dessert after a good meal.  I absolutely loved this steakhouse and I'm glad the whole fam was able to celebrate the soon to be bride & groom here.  Great atmosphere, attentive staff, quality food, and attention to detail.  5 stars in my book!! Now all of you, go try it when you're in downtown vegas!

Yelp 365 challenge:  59/ 365

Flawless.  $120 plus tip for dinner for two:  house wine, duck and steak, starch and vegetable sides, breadbasket, tableside salad prep, fruit dessert, lava cake for birthday boy, rose for lady.  So, $140 for an elegant and delicious meal.  Worth every penny.

Every lady deserves a rose. 

And that's what Hugo's gives you. 

Additionally, a candle lit dinner in a romantic setting, many men to wait upon you, and exceptional food. What more could a girl ask for?

Ooo-Weee, this place is FANCY.  Make you wanna wear a really pretty dress and get all dolled up fancy.  Who knew a place like this existed in Downtown Las Vegas.  Well, apparently this chick knows now.

I came for a friend of my cousin's birthday.  At first glimpse, this place seems a bit cramped.  True to it's name (cellar), you go down stairs to get to this little place.  The lobby area is a bit small, so if it gets crowded, it may only  be standing room only.  Once we were seated, each girl was brought to the table and given a long stemmed red rose.  I know, cheesy ... but it was cute nonetheless.

They have a great selection of seafood and meat.  First course was salad.  Their salad was delicious, and I probably could have just made the salad my whole meal.  Not a side salad.  This baby takes up your whole plate, and comes with all the fixings.  Of course, you get to pick which fixings you want on it.  I also had some of their bread.  I especially enjoyed the lavosh.  It was crispy and flaky, and something different from the ordinary bread given at restaurants, although that was served as well.

After much deliberation, I chose the filet mignon. Very tender, juicy, and well cooked (medium rare, just the way I like it).  I was pleased with my choice.  I also got to try the Escargot en Croute.  It was my first time tasting escargot, so I really don't have anything to compare it to.  However, I know I liked it, and will be willing to have it again.

If you're in the mood to be fancy, hit this place up.  However, it is definitely on the pricey side.  For me, great to try once on my dime, but I hope next time it'll be on someone else's.

AMAZING!!!!  

Husband and I can't remember if we have been here in recent years.  This was the first place that I brought him 14 years ago when he came to visit me in my hometown for Christmas break.  So, last night for our 12th wedding anniversary, we decided to take a walk down memory lane and kick Vegas old school.  

First of all, the service is incredible.  You are consistently (in a good way) being checked on by the various servers.  You never have a moment of wanting.

The food was O M G!

We shared the lobster bisque.  I took the first bite, turned to husband, and said, "THIS is what lobster bisque is supposed to taste like."  Great flavor and chunks of lobster.

The wine sommelier recommended a nice half bottle of pinot grigio for me to accompany my salmon.  I had it sauce nantua, which had a nice sauce with bay shrimp and crab meat.  I liked the accompanying veggies.  Husband had the Beef Wellington.  While we both enjoy our meals, husband does prefer his meat well, which is not possible with the Wellington.

Ended the beautiful meal with a house cappuccino.  ;-) 

Complimentary salad is outstanding, as is the chocolate covered fruit.

This is a classy, old school Vegas place that is worth the trip to the Four Queens.  Husband's favorite part is that he does not leave hungry, unlike some of the other "upscale" places in town.

Hugos Cellar has a classy vibe to it. One star knocked off only because it says there's a dress code but people came in with shorts, etc. I would have not worn fancy pants and wore my lucky shorts into the restaurant if I knew a dress code won't be necessary. 

On important news: food- the escargot and crab cakes were great as well as the bread was filling. Escargot had only 6 pieces. Crab cake 2 pieces.  I was ready for my entrée  (2 filet mignon with foie gras). But to my surprise they gave a pallet cleanser of yummy sorbet in a cone. *i thought that was cool.

Unfortunately yet fortunately surprise! A salad bar swings by and gives you a HUGE yummy salad (that's why there's a huge green plate on your table)....I wasn't expecting such a huge salad.

My stomach was filled to the brim with salad and i didn't have enough space for the entree as well as dessert? What the?  Chocolate dipped strawberries, figs, and apricots...as well as cream? *all complimentary  Food overload. Delicious but wow!

Also prior to dessert they show you a tray of desserts
 Be warned  that was delicious but not part of your meal so it'll cost more....but the creme Brulee was tasty.

Why Hugo? Why did you pounce the salad bar on me!?

Entree unfortunately had a small sliver of dry foie gras (2 inches width and maybe 1/4 an inch of height) on top of the filet mignon.... so i would pass on that entree next time. Personally i do like a decent sized buttery melt in your mouth foie gras for the price. 60 bucks. *I've had fist sized foie gras or all you can eat foie gras for the same price at some restaurants. No joke. If on the menu...make it a decent size and don't skimp on it. Salad was deliciously huge....why not the entrees foie gras? *prior to the meal, I asked the waiter about the size of foie gras and he shaped it like a baseball size but it was more like a pog size (a half dollar coin size) Remember them pog toys?  My bro had rib eye and that was huge and delicious.

Overall. Great place. Pricy but good for special occasions. Eat less of the salad and bread so you have more room for the entree.Also takeout box is fancy and tasty food.

I used to love this place, the food is good...pricy but comes with a side table salad prepped to your liking. If you're a lady a rose is given to you before you get seated. My older friend whom I love like a grandfather took me for my birthday. This was my third time there and the waiter an African American treated him with respect but treated me rude. I understand this is Vegas and whatever he assumed I can't blame him, however, he needs to set aside his opinions and lack of professionalism when on the job. I asked if they offered a side of sautéed spinach and he replied in a rude manner that they didn't. ..so I asked well what do you have? To which he said only a medley of veggies. I wanted to ask what they were and decided to just go with those. Aside from the terrible waiter who looked at me like I was an escort I love this place. Cozy old school, an underground hidden gem! Everyone with the exception of the one waiter have always been polite especially their sommelier.

This was amazing!!  My husband got the prime rib, the waiter suggested they slow cook it and then grill it bc he could t decide between it and the ribeye. It was awesome!!!! I got the beef Wellington, it was great, but I liked his better. 
Comes with salad, which is made at your table side in a cart. There's a lot of things to choose from. 
Also comes with potatoes an veggies. AND dessert!! 
The raspberry martinis rocked and were strong. They give you the shaker, so you get 3 drinks out of it.
Very nice food. Nothing wrong with the fair. However, food is over priced. Waiter got our order wrong. Tipped him anyway. Take a healthy credit card or lots of cash.

WOW- what an amazing experience!  Hugo's you really impressed the BF and I.  Walking off of Fremont St into the romantic, cozy cellar was like being transported do a  totally different area.  Love the idea of the rose but more importantly the service was IMPECCABLE!  I mean come on, when the sommelier has a sippy cup to try each bottle you know you re in a good spot.
For once we did not over order and instead ordered the absolute perfect amount of food.  Started with the Shrimp scampi, made to order salad and then the hot rock app for two.  It was perfect- I mean the salad alone is a filler.  Two bottles of wine, the filtered Kona coffee and complimentary desserts really rounded out the meal.  What I really love is our server also agreed we ordered a great amount of food, I was nervous they would think we were being cheap but we always have tons of leftovers that we waste so thanks for being real with us!
Out of the ten times I have been to Sin City I can honestly say I think Hugo's is my absolute favorite spot!  DO it, go, make the trek down to Fremont- more than worth it!

Old school Vegas at its finest. 

I've been coming to Hugo's since I was a teen. My dad worked in 4 Queens management and we were lucky to be comped here quite a few times. In those days though, I was vegetarian (Womp Womp). 

I've developed a new love for Hugo's as a grown woman. My friends and I went for a birthday celebration. Upon entering the restaurant, all women are given a single red rose (classy). On this particular night, I ordered the filet de boeuf Atlantis. With the meal comes a table side prepared salad with pretty much every topping imaginable to choose from. Get the peppercorn ranch. You won't be disappointed. Back to the filet. Oh my. Filet mignon wrapped in bacon sitting on a bed of lumped crab. Does this really exist? Yes it does. 

Try to save room for dessert. You must get something flombéd. Preferably the bananas foster. It is just such a delight to have your dessert prepared table side and then set on fire!!

If you are really feeling hungry, I highly recommend the Hugo's hot rock for 2. Table side they bring slabs heated to 500 degrees smear them with garlic and then sear pieces of chicken, filet mignon, shrimp and tuna. It is served with 3 different sauces and is quite delightful. 

Shout out to John the best sommelier in town and the V team Vincent and Victor who really understand old school Vegas class. Real Gentlemen and really great service.

Overview:
Classy traditional dining with all of the extras.  Don't let it's location fool you.  Hugo's is the real deal in classic Vegas charm, a true hidden gem.  Make a reservation ahead of time- they are often booked in advance.  

About the experience:
As a local, Hugo's Cellar is my favorite restaurant in town and I have been bringing family and friends here for over a decade.  The service and food never disappoints.  
Located in the back of the smoky Four Queens Casino floor you will need to take the elevator down or use the stairs to enter the "cellar".  Upon being greeted, the Maitre d' will had each lady a long stem red rose and seat you at your table.  The server helpers are quick with the complimentary bottled water, bread and drink orders.  Hugo's has a pretty darn good wine list and a sommelier on staff to help you with your wine choice. 
The menu is fairly simple with your classic seafood, chicken and steak choices.  I am a big fan of the Chilean Sea Bass prepared with the seasoned bread crumbs.  The Filet is always to perfection as well.  
One of the highlights of the meal is the table side salad preparation.  The waiter will freshly prepare your salad with an abundance of toppings such as pine nuts, boiled tomatoes, eggs, shrimp, multiple cheeses, etc.  Absolutely delicious.   
After the salad course you will get a small sorbet cone to cleanse your palate for the main course. -- Fun, right?  
I have often times skipped the main course just because the bananas foster here is fabulous.  It is one of the few restaurants left in the country that still does tableside flaming desserts.... and boy do they do it good.  It doesn't get much better than cool ice cream topped with ripe bananas, cinnamon and freshly made rummed caramel sauce.  
If you do not opt for a traditional dessert Hugo's does bring you freshly whipped cream served with chocolate dipped strawberries, figs and apricots.  
Finally, don't forget the coffee.  This is my mother's favorite part- served with mint sticks and more hand made whipped cream.  If you have room, they do make an excellent chocolate martini served with it's own ice bucket and shaker.  
While in Vegas, be sure to check this place out and bring your appetite.  You will not leave hungry:)

First, reservations are a must! There were 7 in our party and they placed us in a corner booth/table, which was perfect. We ordered drinks, appetizers, had salad prepared table-side. The salad toppings and dressing selection was vast; the result was delicious! Our entrees were generously portioned and tasted great. As we were celebrating an anniversary and a birthday, a special dessert was presented to the celebrating parties; the occasion was spelled out in chocolate on the plates. Very good! We topped off our meal with coffees and a dried fruit/chocolate/whipped cream platter. Needless to say, we were beyond satisfied (i.e. stuffed!) when we left. Each lady in our group was presented with a rose, which was an appreciated touch. In sum, we felt welcomed, appreciated, and were excellently treated. If you're looking for an elegant and romantic experience, Hugo's shouldn't disappoint.

My husband and I were traveling to Las Vegas with two other couples and wanted to treat them to dinner to thank them for all the help they provided while we were renovating our house. My husband had heard that Hugo's was a great steak place and we arranged to take our party there. We loved the atmosphere, so old Vegas! The roses were a nice touch, I especially like that there is a bud vase at your table so that your rose isn't just sitting on the table wilting (the waiter even wrapped the stems in foil before we left). We had Greg, Erik and Santiago assisting our table that evening and they were all stellar!! I had the Filet de Boeuf ~ Atlantis which was wonderful! The pace of the meal was what I really enjoyed. You would think with an appetizer, salad, sorbet, entree and the chocolate covered delights at the end you would be stuffed...the slow pace of the dinner helps!! Our bill was hefty, treating 4 people and ourselves to dinner, but worth EVERY SINGLE PENNY!! My husband and I plan to go there every time we go to Vegas from now on!

This place is absolutely nothing less than fabulous. top notch service the whole way through. it is truly a dining experience, not just a meal. My wife and I shared our five year anniversary here yesterday, I had put in reservations online with a request for a booth in the special instructions, also mentioning the anniversary. when we got there we were greeted, and offered a table but told a booth would be available shortly. I only waited maybe five minutes. it's got such a great vibe, a very classy old school feel. They hand your lady a rose as they take you to be seated. The drinks are expertly crafted, I had an old fashioned while my wife had a dirty martini. We started with escargot, which I'd never had. Wow. Seriously, a revelation. I've been missing out. The rest of the meal was nothing less than superb. I will definitely be back, next time I'll have to make sure I save room for dessert (even though they suprised us with one).

Excellent!  We had the filet and it was cooked perfectly.  This by far was our favorite dinning experience in Las Vegas.  It's tucked away from all the hustle and bustle of Vegas, in Four Queens on Fremont.  Our servers were fantastic!  The extra touches (each woman who comes in gets a rose, salad customized and made at your table, complimentary chocolate dipped strawberries, figs, and apricots) all really made the dining experience superb.  I finished with a brandy cappuccino, another slam dunk.  We didn't have reservations, but someone else didn't show up so they took us no problem.  Fantastic place!

Hugo's is my absolute favorite restaurant! It's classic, old-school, fine-dining at accessible prices. The whole restaurant is very dark and romantic, with ladies being given a rose upon entrance (they put the roses at your table, and then wrap them for you to take when you leave).

Larger parties have multiple teams of servers helping them, and a competant sommalier makes rounds, helping guests select the perfect wine pairings. Every entree comes with the signature Hugo's salad -- where they literally bring a salad bar to your table and make each salad to the specific diner's request. You can load up on pine nuts, artichokes, hearts of palm, shrimp, hard-boiled egg, parmesan cheese, anchovies, etc. -- it's all up to the diner.

After the salad course, delicious sorbet is served in mini cones as a delightful palate-cleanser.

Then the sumtious main course never disappoints - I'm a big fan of the Hugo Chicken - it's well-priced and yummy!

Every dinner is topped off with a selection of fruits dipped in chocolate and served with real whipped cream. In addition, you can select a tasty treat from the dessert tray, or pick on of their specialty flambe desserts. This time we opted for the flambe route - choosing the Bananas Foster. BEST. BANANAS. EVER!

The staff is so lovely - they really know the meaning of customer service. You leave Hugo's full, happy, satisfied, and with a lovely rose. You also get to take some amazing pictures in Downtown Las Vegas -- it's a seedy place, but those lights make for some killer photo ops. Also, if you're feeling seedy, you can stick around the Four Queens Hotel for some $5 blackjack on a Saturday night. I had lost $100 on the Strip, made it back and then some Downtown. 

Honestly, I've gone to other high-end restaurants and didn't leave nearly as satisfied as I did leaving Hugo's -- which is why I've been back again and again. Don't be fooled by the big names - Hugo's is the place to be!

This is a old world style romantic restaurant with great food and even better service. My husband took me here for Christmas dinner.  Ladies receive a rose after entering. Each entree comes with a big salad that you customize when they bring a rolling salad cart to the table. The food was great- lots of steak, lamb and veal choices. I am not a huge meat lover and I had a chicken dish that was surprisingly delicious. After dinner, we walked out of the casino and walked Fremont street. I like the Fremont street atmosphere much better than the main strip for walking around. Highly recommend for a romantic night out in Vegas.
Outstanding.  Had the New York strip and shrimp cocktail.   The dinner includes salad and dessert.   Great ambience if u like old Las Vegas. Excellent service and great half bottles of wine.

Great food, great service. At first glance it seemed pretty pricey, but everything was included, they don't charge extra for your salad or potato. They even give the women a rose to take with them.
Highly recommend them.
Glen

Hugo's Cellar is my go to restaurant in Las Vegas. Never disappoints for the last 25 years. Old Vegas style, great service, and consistently great food. Small bar area is loads of fun. Cocktail presentation is over the top. Get there early and hang at the bar. No place does King crab better.

This is a delayed post, since I was here last month. Great old-school Vegas restaurant! A Gem, tucked inside of the Four Queens great food and great service. I had the ribeye, which was cooked to a perfect medium rare. My friend had the duck, which I intend to have the next time I go. Also had the Kona coffee after dinner, which was excellent. Make sure to stop by if you are downtown. They will treat you right.

A gourmet meal in the 4Q? Absolutely! The hub and I are big fans of this old-school gourmet room, where a couple can get some hooch with their dinner and still have a bill slightly over $100. It's dark and cozy, and the roses to the ladies add a cheesy yet sweet touch. Food isn't trendy or exotic, but is solid. I usually splurge on the filet with a bowl of lobster bisque. The salad cart service comes with the meal, and is always a treat. I look forward to the complimentary dessert tray with chocolate dipped fruit. And every time I have been there, the sommelier wears this Flavor Flav-esque clock/necklace thing. I have no idea what its purpose is, but it slays me!

Blow off those posers on the strip, and head downtown for some authentic Vegas fun without breaking the bank!

My wife and I ate here a few weeks ago on a Wednesday night. We were greeted right away and only had to wait 10 minutes for a table. I had a very nice glass of single malt scotch and my wife has a glass of cabernet. For the main course I had veal oscar while my wife ordered the small prime rib. The veal was topped with king crab legs and smallish pieces of white asparagus, the veal was perfect but I was not crazy about their version of bearnaise sauce. It was like a gravy than a sauce. The prime rib was near perfect, not the best she ever had but close. salads and the huge side dishes had us too full for desert. Price was very reasonable as we got out for under $150. I am marking them down 1 star (food is 4 stars) because of the lack of  dress code enforcement, guys wearing sandals, jogging outfits and shorts.

This is my favorite steak house in Vegas. Food is amazing! The filet mignon is so tender and flavorful. The service is great, especially the ladies getting a rose at the front when you come in. Very classy place.

Oh my god.  What an amazing experience.  When you are seated every women is given a beautiful red rose. The staff is amazing and the food was spectacular.  We will definitely be visiting again 
Hey and hat off to Gene on the waiter staff. Good gosh he makes an amazing salad.   Woo hoo

Just went back for the second time!  And i'm so glad I went back.

We were a little early for our reservation so we went outside and had a drink and walked around for a few minutes.  Then we came back in and our table still wasn't ready, so we sat at the bar.  We ordered a shot of jack and a shot of johnny black.  The shots were in rocks glasses and were almost filled up.  for $7 each? like seriously? no complaints here!  So needless to say, b4 we even sat at the table, we had a small buzz.

We were led to the table with the rose, and of course I got such a great feeling and knew the dinner would be perfect.  The wine sommelier was humorous and knowledgeable.  I think we ordered a bottle of merlot, but i could be wrong! LOL (damn those "shots")

Most of dinner was a blur...Of course, the salad was great! (one of my favorite parts of the meal) and I remember having the sea scallops for my main meal and I remember the portion being huge and really good.  He had the veal and loved it too.  

Of course, the chocolate covered strawberries and apricot w/ the homemade whipped cream topped off a great dining experience, once again. :)

LOVE THIS PLACE~
I have to say this place is very impressive, everything on the menu is delicious and service was phenomenal!

Excellent old style steakhouse, and while not cheap, it's a place where you get exceptional value for your money. The meals come complete with a very large salad, sides and desserts. Plus, the service is very good and the serving sizes are very filling. I would definitely come back when I feel the urge for a good, old fashioned steak meal.

We had a party of 8, we visited on Wedneaday April 1st. They sat us immediately, then it took awhile to get a server or order cocktails...but once we did, service was great. They come by your table and build a salad! It's delicious! The spinach artichoke dip appetizer is wonderful!!! I had the filet, it was cooked perfectly. We were too full to get dessert, but saw that they have bananas foster they prepare table side. Wudu our water attendant was fun!

We have been going there at least 2-4 times a year for 36 years every time we are in LV.  We feel they may be in the top two restaurants we ever ate at.  We love it.   The food was great again last nite. The beef Wellington was fantastic 

My only gripe is I have a favorite dish that I get there and have every time I have eaten there in the last 36 years: veal dijonnaise.   It is no longer on the menu but they have been kind enough to make it for me every time I come except the last time.  They said they did not have the sauce ingredients.   OK that happens.  But we requested it when we made the reservation 1 month age and reminded them when we confirmed the reservation 2 days before.    It is as if they ignored it.  That is not good customer service and for that reason alone I can not give 5 stars.

Subterranean, dimly lit, vaguely romantic restaurant that offers a cool "Old Vegas" vibe, but overpriced for substandard fare. Valet parking at the Four Queens is slow and frustrating, I suggest self parking in the garage. I've eaten here a handful of times, and the food seems to be getting worse and worse. Table side flambeed duckling was dry and overcooked to the point of inedibility, tasteless steamed baby vegetables, fatty and overcooked meat, marginally fresh seafood, and a raunchy table side salad course complete with frozen baby shrimp, wilted iceberg lettuce, and sickly sweet dressings. Service was fine, but nothing remarkable. The high points of this place are the knowledgeable and fun sommeliers, decent dessert cart, a palette cleanser sorbet course, and a cool ambiance if you can ignore the drunk tourists at the adjacent table.

I dined at Hugo's almost 5 years ago for my first wedding anniversary and I have been wanting to go back ever since!  They treat you like royalty, handing you a long stemmed rose when you are seated.  The ambiance is great, and the servers are welcoming and attentive.  I had a bacon wrapped shrimp entree and my husband had a steak.  Both of us were very pleased with our meals and were blown away by the salad cart, which was fantastic with many choices.  The only set back was when I ordered an appetizer of lobster bisque and ended up not liking it at all, which could just be my palate.  The covered fruit tray at the end was perfect.  Definitely a re-visit kind of place!!!

Heard a lot about this place; how great the food and service was. Everything far exceeded our expectations. My wife and I are celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary and the meal here provided a very memorable evening.

Service was good. Food was OK. We ordered the Chilean sea bass and the rib eye steak. Sea bass was average and the steak was decent. I've had better steak. We had the table side salad and my salad had a fishy taste even though I didn't get anything fishy. The sorbet to clean your palette after the salad was a nice touch. They have us a chocolate cheesecake for our anniversary and the chocolate dipped fruit with whipped cream.

From the roses to the ladies upon arrival to the chocolate covered fruit at the end of the meal, Hugo's is more than a meal, it's a dining experience. 

This is an ideal place to take your special lady (or guy) for a special meal. Ironically, my first meal there was with three other guys, but I immediately brought my wife there the next time we were in Vegas.

Hugo's gives you a throwback feel to the classy full service fine dining from days of yore. The sommalier was very helpful and the table side salads were a real treat. My favorite entree was the beef wellington.

Plan on spending some coin, but just sit back and soak everything in. You don't find many places like Hugo's Cellar any more.

I think I know why people like this place. It is elegant, old school, nostalgic, and classy.  Their waiters wear tuxedo.  However, I've had better.

I had the rib-eye and my friend got the filet with foie gras. First, my rib-eye was not medium rare - it was rare- and so I had to send it back. To me that was disappointing for the chef (or helper) to not get it right.  And the flavor was just alright. Oh they serve salad before hand and it was just alright.  I wasn't impressed.  They make it right in front of you which had its appeal.  The garnish was unimpressive.  The veggies were slightly overcooked.  

My friend's foie gras were so small that it's like getting a thin slice of meat at the deli counter.  It wasn't worth what they were charging.  And because the piece was so small the flavor didn't stick out.  

Honestly, I wouldn't go back.  I've had better steaks in LA and I bet I could get better elsewhere in Vegas.  Spend your money on the bigger restaurants like Bobby Flay or something.  

The service to me was just ok. It took a long while for us to get service and greeted.  That was problematic for me.  

So all in all, for experience sake, sure go here. But for really good food for the money that you will end up spending there anyway, go elsewhere.

Hugo's Cellar came highly recommended by a couple of very good friends. So when the opportunity arose to finally experience it, we jumped at it! 

Located in the basement level of the Four Queens Casino downtown, you would never imagine such a place would be found here!

Items Ordered:

- New York Strip Steak 16 oz. (medium) ($58)
(included: table side salad, garlic mashed potatoes, vegetables, and chocolate dipped strawberries)
- Diet Coke ($3)
- Three Layer Cake ($7)

New York Strip Steak, 16 oz. (5/5) Steak was very thick and juicy and cooked to perfection! Absolutely delectable!

The garlic mashed potatoes (4/5) did not disappoint as well. I just wish the portion size was a tad bit greater, but still, they were very good!

The table side salad (4/5) was a real treat in itself! I opted for the Caesar dressing with some shrimp, croutons, parmesan, and tomatoes. Very tasty and great portion size! Not a tiny salad by any means!

Chocolate dipped strawberries (5/5) were a great treat after the main course! Strawberries were HUGE! I could have had a couple more of these!

- Three layer cake (4/5) was a very satisfying way to complete the meal. Not too sweet, but very delicious! Also was the perfect portion size, as I was stuffed after the main course!

Service (5/5)  Absolutely charming and attentive service! Some of the staff have fantastic stories about some famous people who have dined here in the 70's and 80's! It just adds to that classic, old school vibe that I absolutely love!

My only complaint was with how the deserts were presented. I was led to believe that the desert was part of the main entree due to the fact that the waiter approached us and just told us to pick one. Every other steakhouse I've been to will ask if you wish to have desert before asking you to just "choose" one. I was so stuffed by the awesome steak and potatoes that I probably would not have had desert otherwise. It's not  huge thing, but I didn't care for that. (minus 1/2 star)

Ambiance (4/5) Classic, old school feel to the place. All of the waitstaff were in tuxedos. The room was tastefully decorated. Ladies were given long stemmed roses. Great little touches led to a fantastic atmosphere!

This was a great experience and I will be sure to recommend Hugo's Cellar to others as it was recommended to me!

4.5 stars!

This place is really nice and the food is delicious. The atmosphere is very intimate and cozy. Every lady receives a rose. Each table receives bread and butter in the shape of a rose. Your entire comes with a salad. They bring a cart to your table and you choose everything you want on it. I'm not a fan of salads but this one was delicious. You also receive a small complimentary chocolate covered fruit tray after your meal. Our appetizers never came out but even with that I still feel it was worth 5 stars. The staff was very attentive otherwise. Loved it and would definitely go again.

We spent Valentines Day here. It was very nice. A little bit of a rough start but a strong finish. 

We arrived and it took a few minutes to be seated. Understandable at it was a big night. Small line to get in. 

Each meal comes with a salad, breads. and starches. For an upscale Vegas restaurant, this was a nice touch.

Some highlights (all included). 
Table side salad preparation
Small cone of sorbet to cleanse your pallet.
Chocolate covered fruit for dessert

Our meals were good. Rib Eye and Beef Wellington. Crab cake also good especially the sauce. 

I also enjoyed the white chocolate mouse cake. 

Drinks were very reasonable. Sodas were $2 and mixed drinks were $7.

We commented that we thought the servers forgot about us as after we sat down no one came over for about eight minutes to greet us at table. Once they did service was fantastic. 

Annoying that there was no cell service which is ok on a romantic night. 
I would go back.

The food was outstanding. My wife had a filet mignon and I had the Seafood Trio. Both were cooked correctly and tasted wonderful. The service was top notch, staff were everywhere and you never had to "find" someone to refill drinks, salad or bread. The only reason it got a four star was the atmosphere. The 4 Queens Hotel is a little run down and unfortunately you have to go through the whole hotel basically to get to the restaurant and the only restroom is also back out in the casino. Other than, it was a great experience.

Wonderful, elegant dining location.  We have been to Hugo's Cellar several times during our Las Vegas trips.  It is always a treat to dine there!!! The food is excellent, the staff are very professional. They treat everyone with the utmost respectfulness.  Their menu has a wonderful selection of tastes to satisfy most anyone's palate.  They grace each woman with a red rose upon arrival.  Great date place!

Good thing its so hidden, not many tourists know about this place. It is the best romantic fancy restaurant i have been in so far. The whole place looks like a stone cellar from the old world, very romantic. ALl the ladies recieve a rose from the host and the service is just the best you can get.

The price is high.. BUT the food and the atmosphere is well worth it. 
Make reservations, take your girlfriend or wife here!!

One of my favorite places to have a fantastic meal while in Vegas.  Unfortunately it will only get 4 stars....when you get a long stemmed red rose, a Sommelier to help you with your wine pairing, 10 star outstanding service and food, one should not have to dine with people who wear cargo shorts and sandals to dinner, and look like they are eating at a trough.  Keep it classy and elegant.  Keep it a memorable moment because of the excellent food and service, and not because of the group of people that looked like they just got off the tour bus to the Hoover dam.

37 Years ago two monumental things happened.  My husband and I were married AND Hugo's Cellar opened.  We have been visiting Las Vegas one or two times per year  since then and every single time...we go to Hugo's.  We love, love, love it! Things we cannot live without?  Lavosh, shrimp cocktail, salad, sherbet-in-the-middle, any entree, and the chocolate-covered strawberries, coffee with real whipped cream and chocolate chips.  Mmmmmm.....    At 55 years old, we are totally stuck in our habits and LOVE Hugo's.  You should go and start a tradition of your own.  :)

Go there!!! Order the Blue cheese crusted Rib eye. Get a table-side salad (customized to your liking) and take advantage of their two sommeliers on staff. Most of the employees have worked there for over 20 years and they know their sh*t. They're super witty, classy, and hilarious.

I went with my girlfriend, and another couple. In total (the four of us) we ordered two steaks, two lovely bottles of wine, two apps (crab cakes and shrimp cocktail) and two table side salads (then split). I think we dropped $320 all together. The experience was wonderful and we'll definitely return. 

Enjoy.

Good quality steakhouse.  The salad cart is great and comes complete with all kinds of interesting ingredients like pine nuts and 'chovies.  I enjoy the atmosphere, but the decor is more than a bit dated--think old school Vegas.  I have had wonderful steaks here over many years, but I have to say my last trip I had a disappointing cut of beef.  The sorbet palate cleanser is a great touch after a salad with the aforementioned 'chovies!!

We have dined at Hugo's twice.  The first time a few years ago was five stars all the way.  The second time was a few weeks ago.  The food was delicious as always, but I was slightly disappointed.  I felt a little overlooked as I was never brought my glass of wine or sorbet.  I had the filet and my husband had the raspberry chicken.  The service, ambience, quality and overall experience have been stellar nonetheless.

Not sure why all the rave reviews.  We eat out often and are accustom to great dinning. We drove from the strip to Freemont Street and went into the casino.  Walking into the cellar they presented me a rose which is a nice touch but after that it was all uneventful.  This is not a Four Seasons dinning experience( Four Season in Philadelphia).  They poured us bottled water and put out lavash and hard cold bread.  We ordered our meal quickly and it was a long time before they came over with the salad cart.  Nice idea but  would have been nicer on a cold plate.  The salad dressing was unremarkable.  The next course was a intermezzo in a cone(very cute)but the tray could have been cleaner. My husband asked to have a glass of Cabernet with his dinner and the waiter came over when his meal was 75% completed and asked him what he would enjoy. Really you even have a sommelier with a tastevin.
The steak came out done perfectly executed  but the side vegetables were like mush. Then it was time for dessert which was a nice touch, strawberries, figs and apricots dipped in chocolate. Not one time were we approached till the end while we were walking out did they ask if our dinners were acceptable.  They were not even crowded. Overall it was just okay....prefer Fleming's or Morton's.
Awesome place we luckily stumbled upon unplanned. Impeccable service. Wonderful food romantic   Wonderful atmosphere. Will come back again!  This is one of the best restaurants I have experienced.

No, we didn't come her for Valentine's Day dinner (mind you I think Vday is lame and fake); we came for our Anniversary dinner. 

Didn't necessarily want something romantic but, I did want something different and super old school. And after recommendations from my boss, this sounds like it could be as Super OG as can be! 
And after looking at other restos I wanted to try, I think this place had the most bang for the buck AND THEY HAVE RACK OF LAMB (my fave!) 

Right in the cellar of Four Queens, lies this little gem of a restaurant! 

After getting our romantic drink of Hennessy on the rocks, we ordered the shrimp scampi, lamb, and rib eye.
Initially, we wanted to order the appetizer of hot rock but, our waiter (Glenn) said he didn't recommend it as it was a lot of food that we were ordering already -- hence the shrimp scampi switch up! 
And our waiter was on the dot about that. 

The table side salad that came with our meal was delicious. I love salad so I could've had him come around once more :) 

My lamb was fantastic. Not too many places have lamb so this was exciting to me. Other steak houses make their lamb toooo salty for me so, this was perfect. Not salty at all and was amazing with the tasty mash potatoes and veggies. 
The Indonesian sauce it came with was tasty, but I liked my lamb just the way it was. 
The BF, actually, took my sauce for his rib eye which he found delish! 

After entrees, we got a complimentary cake and ice cream and their standard fruits dipped in chocolate. It was very nice! 

Ended the night with their Kona coffee brewed tableside. That was definitely the high light for the BF as he's a HUGE coffee drinker. 
The more it boiled and brewed the more amazing our area smelled. Coffee accouterments of cinnamon sticks and mint chocolate was unexpected and yummy! 

Service was awesome! Ambiance was vintage and really OG. Like this is where Frank Sinatra used to go. That's craaaazzzyyyyyy! 

I'd love to come back with a bigger party so, I can enjoy this place again :) Downtown Favorite for sure!

I heard about Hugo's Cellar through an email from TripAdvisor titled "15 hidden gems" which described attractions/restaurants around the world that weren't well known, but worth a visit. After a little more research I discovered that reviews on Hugo's were stellar. However, I can't say that I completely agree. To start, Hugo's is definitely "hidden" as it is tucked away under the Four Queens Casino in Old Las Vegas. (Old Las Vegas is worth the trip if you haven't been but expect a $30 can ride from the "strip")  Walking down the stairs into the restaurant definitely transforms you into a different world away from the crowd, noise and hustle of Vegas. There was no blaring music or flashing lights to disturb your meal. The cellar-like atmosphere with brick walls and dim lighting created a comfortable dining atmosphere. The well dressed clientele was a plus too - a very civilized meal compared to many Vegas restaurants which are sprinkled with the occasional obnoxious dinner guests. The service was some of the best I received in Vegas: friendly, attentive and knowledgable staff not just looking for an "up-sell". Thesommelier ,in particular, recommended a wine that wasn't on the menu, but exactly what we were looking and reasonably priced. 
Based on the atmosphere and service, Hugo's Cellar is absolutely a hidden gem in Las Vegas. The food, however, was nothing to brag about. I had pretty high expectations based on some of the reviews I read.  We started with the escargot which was overpowered by garlic and topped with a random puff pastry - quite tasty if you're a garlic fan but disappointing for those who actually enjoy escargot. It's basically escargot for those whole don't actually like the taste. Next was the famed "table-side salad". A novelty idea that brought fun and personalization to the meal, but honestly was limp romaine lettuce with mediocre toppings. More exotic lettuce choices would have been a plus. The tomatoes were mushy and lacked much flavor. I was a big fan of the pine nuts though! Fresher ingredients are necessary all around.
For the main course we shared the stuffed jumbo shrimp and the Tournedos Hugo (two five oz filets topped with foie gras and artichoke hearts). The shrimp were small (far from jumbo) and dry. The stuffing was bland and was overpowered by breadcrumb instead of crab that the menu boasted. The filets were mediocre. The fois gras was something you'd find in a can and I didn't see any artichoke hearts on the plate. I figured this dish would be extra special since it bears the restaurant's name; guess not.
A free dessert of chocolate covered strawberries, figs as apricots with fresh whipped cream was included. We also tried the creme brûlée which was just average.
Bottom line: if you're in the area and looking to escape the Vegas atmosphere for a few hours you should consider trying out Hugo's Cellar (but not if you're on a budget). Otherwise it is not worth the trip to Old Las Vegas.

This restaurant is located in the Four Queens casino and tucked away down a little staircase off from the black jack tables. Dimmly lit but cheery with chatter, this is the old time "romantic" restaurant. 

Our booth had a little frosted flower light fixture mounted on the wall low, next to the table. Etched glass separated the booths to provide a little sound privacy. All the women received a long stem rose just before you're seated and the service was attentive from beginning to end.

There's a lot of gray hair in this place but it's a totally sweet place that doesn't smell old. Sure there's fake plants and Christmas lights. Sure the chandeliers feel a little like a billiards hall... but it's a really cute place.

The food was decent. My prime rib was cooked rare as I requested but I found the meat to be a bit too chewy. The Beef Wellington melted in my mouth though and I'd order it again.

I love that a great salad, bottled water and chocolate dipped strawberries all come to complete your meal. You'll even get a little cone of sherbet between your salad and entree. 

Foodwise this place is fair.
But when you consider the service and the atmosphere this place is a solid 4 out of 5 stars.

This place is a home run! Come a little early and order a manhattan from Dean. He knows his stuff and pours an excellent manhattan (it comes in a carafe, so it's really two manhattans for the price of one!). The ambiance is all old school, and though you will feel wildly out of place in the casino all dressed up, it is appropriate for this steakhouse. 

The only reservation we could get was 5:30 pm on a Saturday - make your reservations early! We started with the bread, which is assorted and very good. Their butter is like crack to me, so tray that too. My husband and I both got the salad made at the table. It was very good, but if I had paid $19 to have it as my entree, I would think it a little on the light side. My husband got the prime rib, which as massive, and I got the vegetarian option of the night. Oh my, was this a plate of awesomeness! Raviolis stuffed with portobello mushrooms, covered in a light pesto sauce, with yummy vegetables on he side. My husband could only eat half of the prime rib, but he enjoyed it. 

Next time I would bring a change of clothes to better mix in with the crazies in downtown, it was quite a show but we didn't stay long because we were out of place being dressed up. The hotel itself is kind of gross, and we saw some really unsanitary things happen on the casino floor, so be prepared. Hugos is worth it though!

This is definitely a solid 4, the food was very good, and the service just the right amount without being overbearing.  

My only concern is the table salad service.  Yes it is nice to have a salad made at your table with your choice of fixings and dressings, but unfortunately that also limits your selection.  For example, they only have three types of dressing, I would prefer that  a nice generic salad be made in the kitchen where they could have serveral type of dressing available.

Writing reviews is definitely not something I usually do and as a server I am usually very forgiving of busy servers.  I do not understand where these good reviews are coming from -disappointing.  I work at an upscale steakhouse on the strip and this place is a joke.  The servers are rude and short - maybe working at the same place for 30 years made them bitter.  We ordered a bottle of wine and almost finished it when our appetizer showed up almost an hour later.  The food is subpar and for their prices one can get superior food and service on the strip for less.  This was my fiancé' birthday and if we didn't have fun laughing at the experience we would have had a terrible time.  Worst than the food was the terrible service.  We will NEVER go back.

So this is now the talk of L.V. when it comes to high end, high priced dining.. 

I can say anything you order comes with potato's, (boiled red, or whipped), veggies, and a salad that is made to order; right at your table.. 

The steaks are all large portions, and the fish is well prepared. 
But NOTHING but the salad, really was above average.. 

So, If your in the area of downtown L.V., and you want to impress a date, or have an occasion to celebrate, (and your not concerned about spending an average of $40 bux per entree); come and enjoy. 

Otherwise, I'd say stay on the strip, and go to Encore or Something nice @ the MGM or Mandalay Bay. (The MIX that is on the top floor of THE HOTEL is MUCH better, and there the ambiance is topnotch..

Hugo's Cellar is a MUST!!! Everything from the appetizer I ordered (grilled mushrooms), salad made table side, main dish, and dessert (chocolate dipped fruit) were delicious. The taste is indescribable. Service was excellent all around. You will not be disappointed : )

Took my wife and 4 friends for my wife's 50th birthday. Damn. We have been to a lot of nice restaurants in our day but Hugos gave us the whole experience. Great atmosphere, great service, great food. The best dining experience we have ever had. The apps were great, the table side salad was great and the entrees were great. This is one day we will never forget.

What in the blue hell are you thinking my fellow food critics ?!!!! If Hugo's is a 4.5 star steakhouse than you may as well throw me in the kennel and lock up the key because this has got to be the most overrated and overpriced restaurant in las Vegas. I spent weeks deciding on where to eat to celebrate my cousin's engagement. after much deliberation I settled on Hugo's because everyone recommended the place from our hotel concierge  to the Yelp community. Well I should have known when the restaurant  asked me for my credit card number upon making a reservation that this was going to totally suck. Should have listened to my instincts....

We started with the mixed meat grill which consisted of a bunch of undercooked meats that they bring out on a sizzling platter. Nothing was seasoned at all so the meat itself tasted bland and dull. Plus the chicken was undercooked when they brought it out so we had to kind of guess when it was ready to eat. The various dipping sauces that came out with the platter were just entirely overpowering and the dish itself was just a pointless and lazy way to serve meats at a high end restaurant like Hugo's. Since we were a party of 7 people it was at this point that I began to worry that the rest of the meal would go downhill. Once again I was right... 

The table side salad was a complete f^*%%ing joke. I'm angry just typing this out. It's like the salad bar they used to have at sizzlers except a waiter is actually mixing ingredients into your custom salad. The ingredients were cheap and pathetic. My shrimp were smaller than toe nail clippings. The lettuce was wilted and The salad itself wasn't even tossed well AT ALL. I basically had a glob of dressing that never made its way onto any of the lettuce.  Everyone hated their salad. Nuff said...

Next We proceed to the entrees and nothing improves. I ordered the tenderloin and shrimp both of which were drowning in a cream sauce. The shrimp themselves were actually cooked well. They were also deveined. My steak was small and bland once again. Albeit there was no fat which I will say was nice. The veggies on the plate were a complete afterthought and the mashed potatoes tasted like Ora Ida box mix. I was too embarrassed to ask how everyone else's meal was but judging by the half eaten plates i don't think a single person enjoyed their meal here. The assorted chocolate covered fruits at the end were a nice gesture but unfortunately they did not make up for the lackluster meal our party was served that evening. 

I love old school steakhouses but only if it's done right. This was not done right. The fact that we were the last table in there on a Saturday night at 10pm was probably a bad sign. Oh and the fire alarm went off twice during our meal. The staff never came over to apologize so we basically sat at our table and listened to that loud noise for a good 15 minutes. It was probably a sign from God that i made a fatal mistake by eating here. 

Never again.

The service was exceptional, the food was really good, and although the prices were high the dishes came with salad, sorbet, small sides, and petit fours.  I'm off beer at the moment but they had hinted at a fairly interesting beer list.  I am a big fan, and ever-so-shocked to find this kind of quality in a downtown casino restaurant.

The rose for my lady was a nice touch!  The ceiling was low and the atmosphere felt cozy, but I didn't find the place felt too crowded or cramped.  It was packed, but not too loud.  We got lucky with the reservations on a weeknight, but I recommend making a reservation in advance for weekends.

So glad I looked on Yelp to find dinner last night! :)

My husband and I were going to Vegas for our anniversary which was 6-16-13. I had never been to Fremont Street and wanted to go for night before we spent the rest of our vacation on the Strip. I was told Hugos Cellar was a must for dinner. We loved this restaurant.  The food was good and the staff was great.  Large quantities! We were miserable, in a good way, when we left.  Fantastic martinis!!! The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because we actually went to Gordon Ramsey's Steak on our actual anniversary and it was like apples and oranges to Hugos.  It was on a different level. Obviously, it is a celebrity chefs restaurant.  But for a great meal and awesome wait staff, you have to try Hugos.  If we make it back to Fremont Street, we will definitely return here!

The most romantic, warm, rustic feeling restaurant I have ever been to. The food was absolutely amazing and not once was I disappointed. Crab cakes app, beef wellington and veal oscar entrées. The table salad was also very tastey and made the way you want it.  For our 2nd bottle of wine the Sommelier recommended one that ended up being our new favorite!  Was here for a "just because" night with my honey and it brought back all the amazing feelings I had the night he surprised me in Paris with dinner in The Eiffel Tower.  I was certainly swept off my feet by the delicious food and loving company.  Gentleman treat your ladies to a romantic evening here and you will have one grateful woman!

I have been going to Hugo's for the last 20 years. It was my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas for that period. We went last Friday April 29th and were very disappointed in the food and service. All four meals were delivered cold so we sent them back then they reheated them and it was well done when served the second time. We made the mistake of not complaining again and ate the meals, but should have sent them back and left. I suppose any place can have an off night, but it was very disappointing for Hugo's to have one. Hopefully something did not chance permanently, we will try it one more time. The drinks were and the bartender were still great.

First off, there were people dining in here that were dressed in jeans and t-shirts. Our waiter explained to me that since Vegas is a tourist town they are pretty lenient, but it is up to the Maitre'D who he lets in. Just do yourself a favor and don't show up casual. Slacks and a button down shirt is fine for men. A dress is fine for women.

My husband and I were in Las Vegas for my birthday and we went to Hugo's Cellar. It was fantastic!

From the red rose at the door to the chocolate dipped strawberries, figs and apricots, everything was perfection.

I had the rack of lamb and it was so tender (Medium rare). 

We were so full after dinner that ordering dessert seemed impossible, Nonetheless we ordered the Banana's Foster. It is made table side the old fashioned way. We only had room for a few bites, but worth it. 

We ordered drinks, entrees, and dessert. Price with tip $300. Expensive? Yes The best meal you will ever eat in your life.

Great restaurant.  Excellent service, fabulous menu, great waiters, and a decent Sommelier who is very nice and has a great Winelist available at reasonable prices.  Truly old school Vegas.  Just off Fremont Street in downtown Las Vegas.  Very nice hotel/casino.  Women get a long-stemmed rose (not a rosé as some women were apparently expecting) when they come in.  We had great food (tableside Salads, Seafood Trio, Peppercorn Fillet) and finished up with the included Chocolate Strawberries & Apricots.  Worth the trip.

This was my fifth and final visit to Hugo's Cellar.  ...Not sure what's happened, but there were more negatives than positives this time. 

Our table of four ordered: two rib-eyes, veal Marsala, tournedos (filets)

I'll start with the good:
- The filet was great.
- The wines selected with the help of the sommelier were fantastic.
- The salad cart was good, as usual, though I think I'm over it.

The bad:
- The ribeyes were unremarkable, bordering on unappealing.
- The veal marsala was a little chewy, with unremarkable taste.
- We waited a L O N G time for the check.

Two of the things that kept me, and my friends, coming back here trip after trip (tasty food and  great service,) just didn't happen this time. The great location and old-school Vegas ambience aren't enough to carry this joint.

Every other visit over the past 10+ years was at least four stars. I wonder if this experience was a fluke, or if it was indicative of something more permanent.

What an amazing experience my wife and I had. From when we first walked in when the maitre d handed her a long stem red rose to the complimentary desserts everything was fantastic. 
We were seated in a very romantic area and her rose was placed in a vase.  Then we were asked if we wanted wine we knew we wanted champagne so we ordered that after looking over this very extensive wine list and the Sommelier  came over to help us choose. He was great and so friendly. Our wait staff- yes staff- then asked if we wanted any appetizers.  We were ready to order.  My wife ordered the scallops and I ordered the Duck Anise flambé.
In case you don't know every entree comes with salad, sorbet to cleanse your palate after the salad and complimentary chocolate covered fruits. David one of our wait staff wheeled over a cart and told he was about to play 20 questions, because you get to pick from 20 items to have on your salad-- from shrimp to hearts of Palm and artichokes to chopped eggs and anchovy. Yes the usual salad items are there but each person picks their own items  
After salad raspberry sorbet in a mini ice cream cone was brought to us. 
Then came the entrees.  My duck was flambed table side. It was wonderful.  My wife's scallops were out of this world. 
Last but definitely not least were the chocolate covered strawberries, apricots and figs. We didn't order any other dessert because we were too full but we did order the Hugo's Cappuccino it's loaded with brandy and some other liqueurs.
All the while during this experience our wait staff made sure our glasses were not empty and we had whatever we needed. The sommelier even filled our champagne glasses so we didn't have to. 
If you think this was expensive--- well. How about 160 including tax and tip.  
Why did we ever wait so long to go there

Very classy & 'old school' & a great atmosphere, we loved it. It was quite pricey but the food was outstanding so it was worth it. We had the steak, which was just delicious & breaded shrimp. Definitely worth a visit.

My wife and I had dinner at Hugo's Celler on Tuesday 6-4-13.  This is the fifth time in seven years that we ate here.  I found this place strickly by accident in 2006.  I call it our hidden gem!
The service is outstanding.  Although the waiters are in Tux's, you can wear casual clothing there.  The food is excellent, the drinks are generously poured and the steak selection is great.
I look forward to coming back to Hugo's again.  The prices are also very reasonable for the quality and quanity of the food.  Make sure you tip at least 20%...the food and service is well worth it.

This was an outstanding dinner and I am happy to write this review.  The place was packed and we didn't have a reservation.  The wonderful host slipped us in anyway.  What a romantic, elegant old-school dinner house.  For starters every lady guest is given a rose when they seat  your party.   We ordered crab cakes that were excellent.  For entrees we  ordered fillet Mignon, and stuffed chicken.   The dinner salads are made for you at the table.  You can choose from, artichokes,pine nuts, tomatoes, mushrooms, shrimp,cheese, croutons, etc.... just wonderful.  I must mention their orange honey walnut vinaigrette.  This was the best dressing for a salad that I have ever tasted.  Wonderful.  Now back to the entrees.   My husband had the best melt in your mouth fillet he has ever ate.  He was blown away by how perfect his steak was.  Our chicken was delicious as well.  Nice and tender with an awesome sauce.  We were so stuffed from our meals that we didn't order any extra dessert.  They bring a complimentary dessert to your table.  Chocolate covered strawberries and apricots and I believe dates.  This was a wonderful ending to an unforgettable meal. We all agreed that this was the best attentive service that we have had in ages. We did not want or wait for a thing.  If you are in downtown Vegas and near the Four Queens hotel and casino and want a delicious meal I would highly recommend Hugos.  I wish I could give more stars.

Old school vegas. Booths sommeliers duck flambé filet mignon surf n turf all that. Great place where you expect to be treated well. Do yourself a favor and get reservations for your first dinner in Vegas here. This is how I always want to start my Vegas out. It's not in my choice of place on town but that's even part of the draw. You don't know till you try it, this is vegas at its heart. I'll be sad when it goes, much of the soul of old vegas is alive in this cellar.

Protip: if you like martini this is the place, it comes in a carafe on ice. Awesome.

Oh Hugo!!!!

What can I say? Our time there was truly magical. My friends (3 of them) and I decided to make reservations to Hugo's Cellar on our most recent visit to Vegas. Upon arriving to our reso's, we were each given a long stem red rose. My heart immediately melted because really, who doesn't like flowers. We sat at a very nice table and had 4 waiters attend to each of us. It's like we each had our own waiter. We were given so many options, so many recommendations and so many choices. They explained to us that Hugo's was one of the last places that have continued their "special service" of table side salad, picking our own sides, and including dessert in our experience. We each ordered a dirty martini and not only was it delicious but it came out in the cutest container and crystal holder. (please see attached picture). It was like 4 martinis in one. My kind of drink! A nice gentleman came by and made our salad, asked each one of us what we wanted and what we didn't. It's tableside salad making in which you figure out how different you and your taste buds are than your friends. Haha! Of course, mine was the yummiest. After we finished the salad, we were give cutie patootie little tart sorbet ice-cream cones to clean our taste buds for our main dish. This was sooooooooo cool. I wonder why high end LA restaurants don't use this cool and cute tool. Anyhoo, My friend and I shared the Ribeye with crusted horseradish (16 ounces) YUMO! There is an additional $25 they charge for splitting your meal but it's soooooo worth it. They split it, everyone gets the same amount of sides (asparagus, rice, mashed potatoes). My other two friends split the Filet Mignon with crusted horseradish and theirs was just as delicious. Dessert came out a short time after. We got chocolate dipped strawberries, figs and chocolate dipped apricots with the MOST delicious whip cream you have ever tasted. Everything was so excellent. Service, service, food, service. They appreciated us as customers and we appreciated everything about them. The bill came and we were shocked! This time shocked because we didn't expect a place like this to be soooooooo reasonable. We love Hugo's Cellar and it's amazing staff. Keep up the great job.

This will be expensive meal.  However, we spent less then other nice meals in Vegas.  The atmosphere is interesting, it definitely feels throw back and its nice that's its literally steps down so it feels like it is in a cellar.  Its dimly lit and has a very cozy feeling.  They give all the women a rose, which is cheezy and vintage in the best way.  I did really dislike the fact that there was no bathroom in the restaurant, you have to go into the casino and the casino and the bathrooms are not near as nice as the restaurant.

There is a lot included with entrees.  This is really nice because it allows you to enjoy the evening with spaced out servings.  However one of my complaints were its way too much food.  We started with a bottle of wine and the bread/lavosh.  I love the fact that sommelier serves and tastes every single bottle.  At other places we went to they didn't seem to bother for cheaper bottles.  The bread was really good and I was big fan of the lavosh, I haven't had good lavosh in ages.    There is sorbet that was nice to cleanse the palate.  

Then was the salad cart.  Again vintage, but I loved it and honestly wish more places did this.  It's not just a garden salad there are tons of selection of items to add and different dressings.  My husband and I can both be picky, so it was nice to not ask to hold things and just be able to add what you want.  Everyone said it on here and it really is when of the best salads I have had.  

Then with your entry comes vegetables and potatoes.  I got the ten ounce filet.  I love filet but this was about 2 times too big for me.  It was amazing and the Bearnaise was really good, but I was stuffed just getting through half of it with everything we had before.  I wished they had a smaller option.  My husband got the filet with shrimp and loved that.  

The chocolate dipped fruit was really good and nice to end the evening.  I was so stuffed I only ate one.  I wanted more of everything, so it was hard to control myself, but next time I will eat less bread to save room for entree and dessert.  Overall service was great, very attentive.  We were in a little bit of a hurry and they were good about taking care of us quickly.

We ended up at Hugos after a recommendation from a bartender. We we're going to go to one of the big chef named steak houses but after several locals told us about Hugos we decided to go.

Food was incredible. Service was some of the best I've had. My wife was greeted with a long stemmed rose. The entire team basically serves you and are all very attentive and professional. Having them make salads table side was nice.I had the prime rib, wife had the ribeye. Both came out searing hot and cooked to a perfect Med Rare. The Ribeye was amazing and my prime rib was probably the best prime rib ive ever had. Dessert was so so but we only had the complimentary fruit dipped in chocolate.

We will definitely be going back to Hugo's.
Complimentary salad and dessert were meh. The service was good. The ambience is lovely. The beef wellington was delicious. The scallops were bomb.

We went to Hugo's Cellar to celebrate my son's graduation from UNLV, this is the 3rd time my wife & I have dined there.  This time I was a bit disappointed, especially with the service.  We were seated in a nice booth in the back and although it was a Sat night, it was not a full house.  The waiter was nice enough, except he only showed up about every 15 minutes.  We waited several times for drink refills and clearing of dirty dishes.  About those drink refills; the sodas that were ordered came in 8 ounce small bottles, at $2 per refill.  It has been forever since I saw a soda bill that was more than the alcohol bill.  The appetizers and salads were good, my steak, however was luke warm.  Overall, I would say a fair experience at best for this visit.

Last night was my younger sister's 21st birthday. We decided to go to Downtown Las Vegas without a plan and Hugo's last minute. As we walked into the 4 Queens, we had no idea what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised that we were greeted with roses. We ordered our drinks and food and had a nice bread basket with a table side salad made for us. Our food came and the steak was perfectly cooked. The king crab legs were soo good. Before we left, the wait staff surprised my sister with a small chocolate cake and a beautifully decorated plate for her birthday. A great place to splurge on a nice meal and wonderful atmosphere.

During a recent trip to Vegas, I suprised my wife with dinner at Hugo's Cellar in Vegas. She and I both loved it.  If you want to score points on a romantic date, this is the place to go for dinner.

It's located in Downtown Las Vegas, at the 4 Queens. When we walked downstairs, they greeted us and then gave my wife a fresh red rose. 

We were seated and immediately were offered service. I've had the opportunity to dine at many establishments around the country and few can match the service we had at Hugo's. The customer service we received was excellent. 

My wife had the New York Strip and I had the Rack of Lamb. The steak was good and the lamb was EXCELLENT. Both dishes came with salad (prepared table-side) , asparagus and garlic whipped potatoes. For desert, they brought us chocolate covered fruit and a wonderful blackberry/rasberry cheese cake.

Excellent experience overall. I would love to come back. The only thing I wished they had here was a dress-code. The decor is a little old-fashioned but, then again, we didn't go for the decor. 

Visited April 2011

The girlfriend and I were checking out Fremont Street on a Wednesday evening.  It was dinnertime and we were hungry.  After some cursory research, we decided to give Hugo's Cellar a try.  Tucked away downstairs off of the casino floor at Four Queens, Hugo's Cellar is an unassuming looking place, which, from its décor, looks like time stood still stopping somewhere in the late-60s/early-70s.  That said, this only adds to the dining experience as Hugo's Cellar exudes old school charm and harkens back to the day when going out to dinner at a nice restaurant was truly considered a special occasion.

We didn't have reservations, not that we probably needed them on this particular mid-week evening.  Upon stepping up to the host stand, the maître-d handed a red rose to my girlfriend (and all women who dine at the restaurant) before leading us to our table.  At its heart, HC is a steak place, but the menu has a good selection of seafood choices as well as lamb, veal, chicken, and duck.  We opted for the Chateaubriand and Lobster for Two which consisted of a roasted center-cut tenderloin filet and broiled lobster tails with a side of green and white asparagus.  Soon after our order was placed, a cart wheeled up to prepare custom, made to order salads at our tableside.  The salad was made with fresh romaine lettuce and topped with pretty much anything you could think to throw on a salad.  Think salad bar at Fogo de Chao, not Ponderosa.  After our salads were cleared away, David our lead server delivered two small cones of raspberry sorbet to cleanse our palate.  Next, our main course was served up.
